JOB DESCRIPTION

A board certified behavior analyst (BCBA)is responsible for developing effective treatment for children with ASD, providing supervision and training to staff to oversee treatment fidelity, and collaborating with colleagues in an energetic and supportive environment and focused on quality and ethics.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Provide regular training and support to direct care staff implementing treatment protocols in clinic, school, and community settings
Complete functional behavior assessments (FBAs), functional analyses (FA), and design behavior intervention plans for clients, to include follow through and support assistance for correct implementation
Design skill acquisition protocols inclusive of developing communication, social skills, independence, and behavior skill sets
Regularly review and analyze data to determine program and treatment outcomes and train and support staff on correct data collection measures
Provide oversight to cases, staff and family to make sure all company policies are followed and that treatment is provided according to ethical and best standards of practice
Provide regular training to parents and multidisciplinary professionals pertaining to applications of ABA
Comply with organization, state and federal regulations set forth to include professional development, safety training, confidentiality policies, and adhere to the BCBA task list
Work collaboratively with other therapists, providers, BCBAs, and school staff for effective programs
Demonstrate positive attitude and professional and ethical conduct at all times
Participate in all team meetings and company wide trainings as designated by supervisor and organization
Maintain good standing and certification status with the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB®)
Performs other related duties as assigned by management

QUALIFICATIONS:

Hold a minimum of a master’s degree (BCBA) or bachelor's degree (BCaBA) in related field (education or psychology)
Hold a certification as a BCBA or BCaBA and be in good standing with the BACB®
Experience with designing treatment protocols, behavior intervention plans and skill acquisition programs using behavior analytic principles with individuals with developmental disabilities and autism
Experience collaborating with other professionals and therapist to implement practices and principles of ABA in clinic, home, community, and school settings
Experience with delivering direct instruction/implementation of skill & behavior protocols
Experience training staff, parents, and direct care workers in implementation of ABA
Completed the supervision and ethics requirements outlined by the BACB®
Maintain current CPR and First Aid requirements

Please visit our careers page on our website at www.pathwaysbehavior.comor our Indeed page to learn more about the BCBA position and other opportunities at Pathways Autism Center.

Our Fortune 500 company is driving a digital transformation and looking for forward-thinking innovators to disrupt how our industry thinks about and uses technology. As one of the world's leading employee benefits providers, we help millions of people gain affordable access to benefits that help them protect their families, their finances and their futures.

Are you an asker of questions, a solver of problems, and a challenger of the status quo? Our mission is to provide a differentiated customer experience and exceed the expectations people have of technology at any company — not just insurers.

We are seeking individuals to join our team of talented IT professionals who share never-ending passion and an unwavering focus on our customer experience. Team members comfortable working in an agile, fast-paced, and delivery-focused environment thrive in our environment where we value an entrepreneurial spirit and those who challenge the status-quo.

Unum is changing, and we’re excited about what’s next. Join us.

General Summary:

This is a hybrid opportunity, defined as a work environment that combines remote work and in-office work. This allows employees to have the flexibility to work from both home and the office, striking a balance that suits individual preferences and job responsibilities. Additionally, it promotes collaboration, work-life balance, and diversity of thought. 2 in-office days per week from our Atlanta, GA, Portland, ME, Chattanooga, TN, or Columbia, SC campuses.

Unum is hiring a Senior Business Analysts responsible for ensuring the delivery of the defined business objectives within the agile team. They would handle advancement of business solutions across a business portfolio by working closely with IT Leadership, Product Owners, Business SME’s and Business Architects. Senior Business Analyst will play a critical role in mentoring Business Analysts of all levels to ensure we are growing future talent within the agile teams as well as preparing and presenting data to senior management. They will serve as a subject matter expert and have a deep understanding of the Unum business model – both the products we sell and the services model we employ - and will bring forward areas where investment will bring benefit to our customers and the company.

Job Specifications

Bachelor’s degree required, relevant professional qualification or acceptable industry experience.
6+ years successful experience in defining and delivering valuable solutions to our customers
Intellectual curiosity, learning agility, and enthusiasm for tackling tough problems
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral. Comfortable leading groups of people in discussions
Strong team player; able to work effectively within a team and more broadly with people from a variety of backgrounds and areas across the organization.
Able to deal with significant ambiguity and translate into more tangible outcomes
Strong insurance or relevant industry experience
Proven track record of success with business delivery (software solutions)
Demonstrates a metrics and financial mindset to ensure ROI for business
Certifications strongly encouraged

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

Maintain holistic understanding of IT Delivery roadmap and track any changes to the roadmap are aligned in the backlog tooling enabling teams to leverage automated roadmaps and status report, metrics functionality
Pega experience is preferred
Ensures that Product or adoption KPIs identified can feasibly be measured and tracked through the development and delivery activities, ensuring key data points are identified and included from the outset within the scope of the agile teamwork. Identify trends in supporting or cascading metrics that may impact the KPI up to the PO and leadership team
Maintains holistic understanding of relevant client personas and uses these personas to refine work items to develop shared understand across the Agile Team of the client needs
Ensure product backlog quality of work item descriptions are concise and effective represent user needs, with any sufficiently detailed, precise acceptance criteria to support testing and acceptance of the work. Ensure that key data points on the work items are in place to provide expected transparency. Responsible for the investigation and application of changes to program scope. Identifies the impact on business requirements of external impacts affecting a program or project.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, and task/process/workflow analysis selecting the appropriate means of representing the business requirement and ensuring traceability back to source (tools such as blueworks for process mapping, excel).
Be prepared to do presentations to senior leaders
Industry Analysis of trends, technology and market advancements and demonstrated application into our context
Partners with UX and builds knowledge of UX tools and techniques to incorporate persona needs into the product backlog and requirements
Performs system and business process analysis and mapping leveraging enterprise toolset
Maintain and model best practices on a set of tactical agile techniques in relation to work decomposition, planning, estimation, backlog tooling, status reporting
Collaborates with the Business Architect, Product Owner, agile team and relevant subject matter experts to define concise and effective user stories from the capabilities roadmap also detailing precise and accurate acceptance criteria. This includes functional and non-functional requirements
Collaborates with the Team (Architects, Software Engineers, Test Engineers, etc.) to ensure that the team understands the work item as defined in order to help them develop high quality features and solutions that meet or exceed what the Product Owner is expecting
Ensure that product backlog work items e.g. user stories are meeting the definition of ready in line with enterprise targets on backlog readiness, often called planning horizons or planning intake funnel
Ensure backlog work item decomposition is meeting enterprise standards with respect of quality of content and data integrity on key fields to drive transparency and effective reporting
Models behaviors and practices to leverage and fully optimize methodology adoption outlined in product area. E.g. Customer Journey, Agile Methodologies, Program Execution Framework i.e. Program Ways of Working
Collaborates with Business & Technical Architects to evaluate the business suitability of applications/solutions in support of the capabilities roadmap
Evaluates native functionality from third party/cloud solutions and identifies opportunities to meet business needs including page layouts, workflows, reporting and dashboards
Responsible for the investigation and application of changes to program scope. Identifies the impact on business requirements of external impacts affecting a program or project.
Mentors Business Analyst I’s and Business Analyst II’s to ensure appropriate business analyst standards and practices are met, where appropriate
Responsible for assessing requests for change and their impacts on existing applications/solutions in the business portfolio and ensuring the changes are prioritized and assessed for risk appropriately.
Collaborates with the agile team to ensure appropriate acceptance criteria is defined and met by participating in all test activities where necessary to ensure successful feature delivery.
Ensures an innovation culture in the team by continuous improvement of deliveries and participates in evaluating new processes and technologies that can be applied to future feature delivery
Participates in retrospectives to ensure the agile team continuously improves and ensures that value stream mapping is completed in order to remove waste in the process
Collaborates with Chief Product Owner and Product Owner on prioritization and grooming of the capability backlog. Ensure that key information needed to support PO prioritization is current, accurate and available in a usable format to drive high quality decisions.
May serve in a Scrum Master role for an agile team
Ensures that the latest project progress is known to the agile team by ensuring Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools are up to date and participating in daily stand-ups outlining progress made, progress planned and detailing impediments
Identifies data source, gathers and analyzes data relevant to processes identified for process improvement initiatives.

About Osmose

With 85 years of experience, Osmose proudly serves the electric utility and telecommunications industries across the U.S., helping enable the delivery of safe, reliable and affordable electricity and communications services to millions of customers nationwide. We are the industry leader in wood and steel structure condition assessment, life-extension and rehabilitation services. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, with satellite offices in Peachtree City, Buffalo, Syracuse and Boston, the Osmose footprint extends throughout the country. Our staff and field personnel represent some of the most tenured, well trained, and innovative professionals in the industry.

Position: Sr. Financial Analyst (Commercial) | Location: Atlanta, GA | Type: Full-time

Job Summary: We are seeking a Commercial Financial Analyst to join our finance team and play a pivotal role in supporting our company's commercial operations. The Commercial Financial Analyst will be responsible for analyzing financial data, evaluating business performance, and providing strategic insights to optimize revenue generation and customer profitability. The ideal candidate should possess strong analytical abilities, business acumen, and the capability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. This is a new role which provides an opportunity to pioneer new ideas/processes and add value across the organization.

Responsibilities:

Business Performance Analysis:

Analyze customer sales data, revenue streams, and cost structures to assess financial performance.

Identify trends and patterns to support decision-making that enhances revenue growth and profitability.

Track operational and financial KPIs to identify root cause of swings in profitability.

Pricing and Profitability Analysis:

Evaluate pricing strategies by analyzing margins, market trends, and competitive landscapes.

Provide recommendations for optimal pricing structures that balance customer value and company profitability.

Perform profitability analysis on products, services, and customer segments to guide pricing decisions.

Forecasting and Budgeting:

Support the development of financial forecasts and budgets by customer profile.

Monitor actual financial performance against forecasts and budgets, highlighting variances and proposing corrective actions.

Financial Modeling and Scenario Analysis:

Develop financial models to assess the impact of different scenarios and strategic decisions on revenue and profitability.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze the financial implications of new business initiatives.

Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare and deliver clear and concise financial reports and presentations to communicate analysis findings to senior leadership.

Translate complex financial data into actionable insights for non-financial stakeholders.

Qualifications:

Minimum

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics, or related field with a minimum of five (5) years experience.
Proven experience in financial analysis, business analysis, or related roles.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in financial modeling and data analysis.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other relevant financial software.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex financial information to diverse audiences.
Business acumen with the ability to understand the broader impact of financial decisions on commercial operations.
Detail-oriented with a strong focus on accuracy and data integrity.

Preferred

Able to analyze data and build insightful models using Power Query, Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization/BI tools.
Experience using NetSuite to gather financial insights and build reports
Prior experience with process improvement and/or automation i.e. building macros, RPA, or Power Automate flows

Serving the needs of all families with young children, Carter’s Inc. is the largest North American apparel retailer exclusively for babies and young children, encompassing Carter’s, OshKosh B’gosh, Skip*Hop and Little Planet brands. There are many reasons to build your career at Carter's.

The People Data and Reporting Analyst plays a crucial role in providing data-driven insights and analytics that will enable our organization to make informed decisions related to human capital management. This role involves collecting, analyzing, and report development to support HR initiatives and drive organizational effectiveness.

How You'll Make an Impact

70% Data Collection, Analysis and Report Development

Gather, consolidate, and validate HR data from various sources. Ensure data accuracy and consistency by performing regular data audits and validation checks.

Generate standard and ad-hoc reports on HR metrics such as turnover, headcount, compensation, and benefits. Collaborate with HR team members to understand their reporting needs and requirements. Identify opportunities to streamline HR reporting processes and implement improvements.

Design and develop HR reports, dashboards, and scorecards using reporting tools (e.g., Excel, Workday, Tableau). Create visually appealing data visualizations to communicate data effectively. Work closely with IT and other departments to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Provide actionable insights to support strategic HR decision-making.

Conduct ad hoc analyses to answer specific HR-related questions and provide data-driven solutions.

30% Compensation Support

Participate in the implementation of new Workday Compensation related features and functionalities, ensuring seamless data integration.

Maintains the compensation market pricing tool including the annual market pricing data refresh process, pay structure updates, reporting and data analysis.

Assist in development of standard compensation market data updates for ongoing HRBP client data needs. Provide technical support to resolve data-related inquiries and issues.

Maintain strictest confidentiality in all work aspects and ensure continuing data integrity.

Learn compensation fundamentals to expand knowledge outside of reporting and analytics

We’d Love to hear from you if: (Requirements section)

Must have:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, or a related field and three years of hands-on experience with HR data visualization and analytics, Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Excellent writing skills for generating clear, concise release notes and documentation
Project management skills; demonstrated ability to manage work across multiple projects with varying degrees of complexity and timing
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and data accuracy.
Effective communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Preferred skills and experience:

Working knowledge of Workday HCM strongly preferred
Knowledge of HR processes, metrics, and best practices
Experience in HR reporting and data analysis.
Familiarity with HR compliance regulations and systems.
HCM analytics a plus.
OUR Team Members:
Lead Courageously: Have a strong sense of personal values that align with our Company values
Collaborates Broadly: Build cooperation, trust, and thrive in a consensus driven environment.
Customer Focus: Proactively seek opportunities to leverage data and fact-based insights to serve customers and/or internal clients.
Drive Growth: Set aggressive goals and implement plans precisely.
Cultivates Innovation: Respectfully challenge the "we’ve always done it this way" mentality and explore new ways to achieve desired outcomes
Make a career at Carter’s:
Career Development: Success starts from within, and we have several paths from which you can choose to enhance your career evolution. From Carter’s University to Toastmasters to mentorship programs and more, we encourage you to utilize these tools to elevate your professional prowess.

How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?
*****This position will start July 2024******

Locations: This is a rotational position based in the greater Atlanta area. The associate will complete 3-eight month assignments over the course of 2 years. Two assignments will be located in Kennesaw, GA and one assignment in Lawrenceville, GA. The position is hybrid and candidates will be expected to be in office 3 days a week.

Program Summary:
Airgas’ Rotational Career Program (ARC) is a highly competitive two year program for recent college graduates designed to accelerate professional growth by providing training, exposure and experience in a variety of key functional areas that impact our business. Participants will work directly with leaders and mentors who can contribute to their career development in addition to helping them build technical and leadership skills. By the end of the rotational program, participants who have demonstrated exceptional performance and leadership will have the opportunity to be placed into a role within the business based on their accomplishments as well as current business needs.
Position Summary:
#earlycareer
Within our program we have a Financial Analyst role that will consist of three, eight month assignments throughout the Finance & Accounting function within Airgas. The candidate will gain a well-rounded perspective from various areas including but not limited to Accounting, FP&A, Internal Audit, and Operations.

Program Highlights:
Three, eight month rotational job assignments designed to accelerate the development of critical industry knowledge skills and experience
Interaction with various teams across the Airgas businesses
One-on-one mentoring with experienced internal leaders
Challenging projects that foster innovative and creative thinking
Exposure to senior level management
Opportunities to participate in leadership development activities and networking events

Company Name: The Housing Authority of the City of Atlanta (AHA)
Job Description:
Title: Data Analyst
Department: Information Technology
Reports To: Manager, Data Reporting & Analysis
Pay Grade: O

Position Summary:
Conducts the analysis of participant and enterprise-wide data of a moderate to highly complex nature by reconciling data between multiple systems and protecting the integrity of all operational data. Leads efforts in investigating, gathering and documenting enterprise data management solutions. This includes working with business owners, executive management, and IT teams to measure, resolve, compile, and prepare the effective movement, quality, transformation and enrichment of AHA data.

Apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to fully support the enterprise in leveraging its data assets for high quality analytics solutions and reports. Prepare data sets and statistical reports to identify, quantify, and determine root-cause of data quality issues and solutions. Document and execute data validation and testing activities while providing consultative support to enterprise for data usage
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Performs data analysis to evaluate and inform business and data requirements.
Collect customer requirements, determine technical issues, and design reports to meet data analysis needs.
Identify new sources of data and methods to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Synthesizes complex and diverse information for root-cause analysis by collecting and researching data.
Interprets analysis for management and assists in planning efforts to support future operations.
Analyze functional requirements and translate them into ETL mapping documents.
Execute the testing of data management solutions.
Provides support to the agency and individual teams with regards to data availability for reporting, researching data anomalies and/or inquires, and working with various standards to identify and resolve data-related application issues.
Utilize business intelligence software to support enterprise data management solutions.
Provides updates, status and completion information to manager and/or users, via Service Now, email, and/or in-person communication.
Performs all other related duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Strong problem-solving, analytical, organizational, and communication skills.
Proven ability to independently manage small to large projects.
Ability to write business requirements without direct supervision.
Ability to work collaboratively with users, developers, team leads, managers, directors, and executive management staff requiring minimal direction and oversight.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in the fields of Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Statistics.
Proficient in SQL databases, Microsoft Excel and SharePoint
Experience in CaseWorthy optional
Power BI experience is preferred
At least 3 years of experience working in a Data or Reporting Analyst role.
Working Conditions:
Generally, works in an office environment. Must be able to sit and stand for long periods of time. Must be able to work in a deadline-focused and fast-paced environment. May be required to have a valid State of Georgia driver’s license and be fully insurable for the purpose of obtaining clearance on company “Authorized Driver’s List.” Occasional overtime as required to meet workload demands.

Overview

The CDI & Coding Data Analyst will support both departments by developing and providing scheduled data packages and completing data reporting needs, as well as maintaining the shared departmental database, for both outpatient and inpatient settings. Works closely with CDI and Coding Leadership to communicate trends identified in their reviews and to make suggestions for continual process improvement in the form of written and verbal reports. Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to develop analytic strategies to assess the quality and safety of care, and associated activities for the Outpatient and Inpatient Documentation Improvement efforts, provided at WellStar Health System.

Responsibilities

Core Responsibilites and Essential Functions


1. Data Analysis and Reporting:

A. Defines problems, collects data, establishes facts, and draws valid conclusions
B. Accurately completes timely reports as requested by CDI and Coding Leadership in an executive summary format
C. Ensure and maintain the integrity of data that is utilized for any reports or dashboards
D. Provides other documentation or reports, as requested by the leadership, including but not limited to EPIC, 3M, Coding & CDI Auditing Software, other external data, etc.
E. Communicates trends identified in CDI and Coding reviews and makes suggestions for continual process improvement to CDI and Coding leadership in the form of written and verbal reports
F. Utilizes Excel or other platforms to build, compiles and distributes scheduled departmental data dashboards
G. Collaborates with multidisciplinary teams to develop analytic strategies to assess the quality and safety of care, and associated activities for the Outpatient and Inpatient Documentation Improvement efforts, provided at WellStar Health System
H. Oversees and maintains shared data sources (all spreadsheets/templates) for CDI and Coding departments and annually updates/reviews for data and departmental intranet page(s)
I. Utilize reporting functionality in the EPIC/EPSi, 3M 360 Encompass, Vizient and any other data sources
J. Assists CDI and Coding leadership with ad hoc report creation and completion of data projects for daily operations
K. Interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables
L. Conducts validation of reports and special project tasks to support the Outpatient and Inpatient CDI/Coding functions and ensure appropriate data is entered, captured and reported for the accuracy and completeness of clinical information used for measuring and reporting physician and hospital outcomes
M. Build systems to transform raw data into actionable business insights


2. Process Improvement / Project Management:

A. Plans and oversees data related projects and timelines, considering the outlined scope and the overall departmental priorities and vision
B. Takes initiative to identify and apply best practices for data analytics relevant to CDI and Coding in both outpatient and inpatient settings
C. Partners with CDI, Coding, CI and IT Connect teams and makes suggestions for technology improvements, optimization and efficiencies for operational data
D. Serves on work teams as needed for operational and technical projects to provide CDI point of view
E. Represents the CDI Department on all CDI-related IT projects, sitting on project teams, coordinating, and performing testing, and communicating issues and resolution
F. Acts as a super user for CDI and Coding analytics tools; provide education to internal and external stakeholders
G. Participates in monthly, quarterly, and other CDI and Coding application testing, including reviewing documentation, preparing test plans, testing, validating, and preparing training materials and communications for the Outpatient and Inpatient CDI/Coding stakeholder departments
H. Available to act as a technology training resource for WellStar CDI and Coding team members, mentoring them on relevant software and applications, IT related issues, and other questions, as needed
I. Works on miscellaneous CDI and Coding IT initiatives and projects, as needed

3. Customer Support:

A. Understands business needs and objectives, and has the flexibility to adjust to shifting departmental priorities
B. In collaboration with Leadership, presents trends and report metrics relevant for CDI and Coding
C. Shows eagerness towards understanding customer needs to assess for data applicability
D. Provides data interpretation services for key customers

Required for All Jobs
Performs other duties as assigned
Complies with all WellStar Health System policies, standards of work, and code of conduct.

Qualifications

Required Minimum Education
Bachelor's Degree Graduation from a healthcare-related Bachelor's degree program Required or
Bachelor's Degree Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Health Informatics, Statistics, Health Information Management or other health care or data related field Preferred

Required Minimum Experience
Minimum 3 years Relevant data reporting and analytics experience, including working in Tableau environment and/or Microsoft PowerBI Preferred and
Proficiency in Outpatient and/or Inpatient CDI or coding, including chart review experience Preferred

Required Minimum Skills
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Must exercise strong logical reasoning skills and business intelligence
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Analytical skills and strong organizational abilities
Comfortable applying data analysis and reporting concepts
Attention to detail · Problem-solving aptitude
Time management skills
Ability to collaborate with other departments to achieve departmental and organizational goals
Ability to review data from multiple sources and aggregate into meaningful, actionable information for use within and outside of the CDI and Coding departments

Required Minimum License(s) and Certification(s)
For all candidates, one of the following certifications is required within 1 year of hire date:
Certified Health Data Analyst (CHDA) from AHIMA
Registered Health Information Administrator (RHIA) from AHIMA
Registered Health Information Technician (RHIT) from AHIMA

Preferred Skills
Familiarity with Epic, 3M 360 Encompass and Vizient
Understanding of diagnosis related groups (DRGs), Hierarchical Condition Category (HCC) & Risk-Adjustment Factor (RAF)
Database management experience
Background in healthcare regulations and outpatient and inpatient coding guidelines
Familiarity with standard healthcare-related metrics

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Responsibilities

The Clinical Quality Analytics & Insights Analyst provides analysis services and project support to business partners through reporting, data analysis and dashboards. Under general leadership guidance, the analyst is proficient in quality decision support solutions (Benchmarking, Safety and Business Line systems). As such, the analyst is responsible for assessing customer requirements, capturing relevant data sets, developing visual solutions, analyzing results and providing key customer focused insights. An outcomes driven position, the role is focused on providing knowledge and information combined with appropriate customer education that will translate into improved operations.

1. Coordinates, captures and synthesizes internal and external structured / unstructured data; including extract, transform and load processing for quality, safety and clinical operational data
2. Promotes data governance; develops basic auditing tools and analysis methodologies to ensure data integrity; participates in setting definitions and maintains data dictionaries and catalogs
3. Demonstrates data understanding relating data points to quality processes such as peer benchmarking, length of stay (LOS) analysis, mortality analysis, readmission analysis, incident/complication analysis, and safety reporting; relates to operational process improvement opportunities and recommends options as appropriate
4. Attends meetings and daily communication sessions to keep abreast of project objectives, process workflows and progress of business concepts
5. Participates in special projects as required (external benchmarking surveys, internal business priorities, etc)
6. Functions in and accountable for highly sensitive data; maintains absolute confidentiality

Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Information Systems, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Healthcare or similar degree. Required
Equivalent work experience in directly related, data analytics role. Required
Advanced Degree or Healthcare Specialty Program Completion. Required

Required Minimum Experience:
Individual contributor in a team-based operation in technology, quality, safety, human resources, management engineering or clinical operations. Required
Minimum 4 years relevant experience. Required
Healthcare experience. Preferred
Specific knowledge of Kronos Analytics, Vizient ODB / CDB, EPSI, StrataJazz, RL Solutions and HR Analytics tools. Preferred

Required Minimum Skills:
Proven capabilities in Quality / Safety / Business Line and associated data analysis.
Capable of assessing customer requirements and transforming into relevant insights, storytelling using visual tools.
Requires high attention to detail, relevant business and data knowledge as well as process understanding to connect strategy to technology in respective areas of expertise.
Must be familiar with standard IT frameworks and be willing to obtain basic certifications such as Agile, ITSM or Scrum.

Job Title: Sr. Business Analyst - Procure to Pay
Job Description:
The Sr. Business Analyst - Procure To Pay position will play a vital role in leveraging Oracle cloud suite of products and SaaS solutions to optimize our business processes and drive efficiency in the business-owned system requirements and partnership with the IT organization. This position must understand Accounting, IT, and business functions and processes. This individual must demonstrate strong problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as excellent communication skills when interfacing with both the business and the IT team.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements specific to the accounting systems.
Work with cross-functional teams to design and implement effective solutions using Oracle Cloud modules, tailored to the unique needs of accounting operations functions.
Perform detailed gap analysis to identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations for optimizing business processes and system functionality within the Oracle cloud.
Translate complex business requirements into clear and comprehensive functional specifications, ensuring alignment with Oracle cloud capabilities.
Collaborate with the IT team to configure, customize, and implement solutions, while adhering to industry best practices and standards.
Conduct thorough testing and quality assurance activities to validate system changes, ensuring successful implementation and minimal disruption to accounting operations.
Provide end-user training and support to facilitate smooth adoption of new processes and system functionalities.
Helping the business to cost-effectively implement technology improvements and solutions.
Work with process owners to understand their requirements to improve and automate how these processes and procedures are performed.
Support vendor management as needed.
Participate in the project management of the implementation and enhancement of the Oracle Suite of products.
Serve as a subject matter expert on the Oracle cloud suite of products, staying updated with the latest features, enhancements, and industry trends.
Participate in system upgrades, patches, and maintenance activities, ensuring uninterrupted system outage.
Monitor and troubleshoot system issues, identifying root causes and implementing appropriate resolutions to minimize downtime and optimize performance.
Perform the role of SME for the SaaS applications owned by the business working with the vendor to solve any issues.
Manage all work in Smartsheet, with excellent attention to detail, to provide business and leadership with real-time status.
Manage business projects utilizing waterfall project plans and agile methodology while partnering with IT on project delivery.
Compliance: Ensure processes adhere to company policies, industry regulations, SOX controls, and best practices.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies related to OTC processes and suggest improvements accordingly.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS

4-year degree in Business Administration, or a related field required
5-7 years of proven experience as a Procure to Pay Oracle Business Analyst
Strong knowledge of Oracle cloud ERP accounting modules and their application within accounting functions

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, or ABILITIES

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into practical functional specifications.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Attention to detail and a focus on delivering high-quality results.
Project management skills and experience in process improvement initiatives.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a complex and dynamic environment and work independently or as part of a team.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.


Inspire Brands is a multi-brand restaurant company whose portfolio includes nearly 32,000 Arby’s, Baskin-Robbins, Buffalo Wild Wings, Dunkin’, Jimmy John’s, and SONIC Drive-In restaurants worldwide.

We’re made up of some of the world’s most iconic restaurant brands, but we’re much more than just a restaurant company. We’re a team of hundreds of thousands who individually and collectively are changing the way people eat, drink, and gather around the table. We know that food is much more than a staple—it’s an experience. At Inspire, that’s our purpose: to ignite and nourish flavorful experiences.

Position Purpose/Summary

The Data Analyst is committed to providing the highest quality of service to the communities, customers, and employees we serve by. This position will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our data pipelines, databases, and analytics solutions on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform. You will collaborate with our financial analysts, and other cross-functional teams to ensure data availability and accuracy, enabling data-driven decision-making and driving the success of our organization.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and design efficient business Intelligence solutions.
Ensure data quality, consistency, and integrity by implementing data governance best practices.
Build and maintain SQL scripts and queries for data extraction, transformation, and reporting.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines and resolve any issues to ensure data availability and reliability.
Optimize data storage, retrieval, and processing to improve overall system efficiency.
Work closely with financial analysts, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide support.
Constantly improve domain knowledge on telecommunications billing, operations, Customer Service, and other business activities.
Develop, maintain, and optimize ETL processes for data ingestion and transformation using Microsoft Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and other Azure services.
Implement data integration techniques using APIs to transfer data to and from third party applications supporting our business.
Performing all other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Knowledge, Abilities, & Skills for Success
Effectively communicate in a positive and professional manner through written and verbal communications in all interfaces with customers/public, fellow employees, and vendors.
Ability to use appropriate computer programs (including, but not limited to, Microsoft Office Suite) which includes having proficient computer skills and the ability to adapt and learn as programs and processes change.
Ability to work as a team member and exert initiative to work independently to reach a goal.
Ability to embrace change in the workplace while encouraging others to seek innovative approaches.
Ability to function effectively as a team player.
Knowledge of and the ability to comply with Company’s Customer Proprietary Network Information (CPNI) regulations and procedures.
Ability to work a flexible work schedule, as needed, to best serve our customers.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, or a related field.
Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong background in SQL and Microsoft Azure technologies.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong background in SQL and Microsoft Azure technologies.
Proficiency in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Experience with Azure services like Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Studio, Azure SQL Database, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and other relevant tools.
Strong knowledge of data integration and transformation tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a collaborative team environment.
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
Relevant certifications in Microsoft Azure, SQL or data engineering are a plus.
Prior experience with Telecommunications or related industry is a plus.
Prior experience with service-based billing/operations/customer-service is a plus.

ROLE SUMMARY

The Data Analyst is a hands-on position focused on defining the data needs, gathering requirements, and designing reports pertaining to Commercial Insurance. The position will work within IT to help Sompo International create Insurance related reporting - operations, compliance financial actuarial etc.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES

Works with business stakeholders and IT teams to define data needs for the reporting requirements.
Creates source to target mapping documents to capture application data elements for loading from source systems into the enterprise data warehouse.
Collaborates with ETL team to ensure that source to target mappings are correctly translated into ETL code.
Performs data validation to confirm reports are represented correctly.
Experience of creating Insurance related reporting - operations, compliance financial actuarial etc.
Knowledge of Guidewire Policy Center, Guidewire Claims Center, SAP FS-RI & SAP FS-CD applications and their data is a huge plus.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work as part of a team.

5+ years of data warehouse experience.
3 years P&C Insurance subject matter experience (Policy and Claims).
Strong knowledge of PowerBI/Cognos.
Advanced SQL knowledge for Data Analytics.
Cloud exposure will be a plus.
Good knowledge of Data Warehousing and BI Architectures, concepts, and frameworks.
Proven experience in Data Modeling, Data mapping, Reports designing.
Capable of creating and tuning Semantic layer Reporting Views.
Capable of facilitating data discovery sessions involving business subject matter experts.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS

BS in Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

About TruthMD:
We are an industry-leading independent source of truth that provides the deepest, most accurate and up to date view of health care providers, where they work, their credentials, training, sanctions, exclusions, conflicts of interest and hundreds of other data elements. We are dedicated to providing truthful and unbiased information in healthcare. TruthMD offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience, paid holidays, a flexible paid time off program and medical/dental benefits to full time employees.

IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT THIS JOB IS HYBRID WITH A REQUIREMENT TO WORK IN THE ALPHARETTA OFFICE 3 DAYS A WEEK.

Job Description:
This position is part of TruthMD’s Roster Processing department within Operations. This department’s primary responsibility is to obtain, process, validate and import public state board licensing and demographic information for healthcare providers. The Technical Data Analyst will facilitate processing and importation of this data by executing SQL queries to validate and ensure the accuracy of data. This position will report to the VP, Operations.

Responsibilities:

Execute SQL quality assurance scripts at various points during data-processing
Troubleshoot and identify data discrepancies and collaborate with the data team to reconcile errors
Provide insight and feedback on current processes to improve data quality
Assist with automation of current manual processes, including automation testing
Assess changes in data structure and make changes to queries as needed
Assist with writing queries to identify possible bugs or data errors within SSMS database
Perform ad-hoc projects for management to ensure success with various client-related deadlines
Attend twice-weekly stand-ups to keep up to date with other work within data processing pipelines
Leverage existing SQL querying tools to facilitate and expedite processes
Work with internal teams to improve workflow and system processes
Report bugs and recommend improvements as they relate to the roster process

Requirements:

High proficiency in SQL and Excel
Strong organizational and planning skills to keep in-line with refresh schedule
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases
Experience using ticketing system for all project work, Jira is a plus
Bachelor’s degree
Minimum 2+ years in related field

Job Summary

The Data Analyst II is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data sets to provide valuable insights and support data-driven decision-making. The incumbent will utilize strong skills in data manipulation, statistical analysis, and data visualization to enhance understanding of key trends and patterns. The Data Analyst II will contribute to driving data insights, improving decision-making processes, and enabling the organization to achieve its goals through data-driven strategies.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Data Analysis: Perform advanced data analysis, including data cleansing, data transformation, and statistical modeling, to extract meaningful insights from large and complex datasets.
Data Interpretation: Translate data findings into clear and concise reports, dashboards, and presentations, and effectively communicate key insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Data Visualization: Design and create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations using industry-leading tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to facilitate data-driven decision-making and enhance data understanding.
Data Management: Develop and implement data management strategies, ensuring data integrity, accuracy, and consistency, and establish best practices for data collection, storage, and analysis.
Reporting and Documentation: Prepare comprehensive reports, documentation, and documentation guidelines to ensure that analytical processes and findings are properly documented and reproducible.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, data engineers, and data scientists, to identify data requirements, extract relevant information, and align analytical efforts with business objectives.
Process Improvement: Continuously identify opportunities to optimize data collection, analysis, and reporting processes, and contribute to the development and implementation of scalable data analytics solutions.
Quality Assurance: Conduct rigorous quality assurance checks to validate data accuracy, reliability, and validity, and troubleshoot data-related issues as they arise.
Industry Knowledge: Stay up to date with the latest trends and advancements in data analytics, including emerging tools, techniques, and best practices, and proactively apply new knowledge to improve analytical processes.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

Excellent computer skills (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Excellent oral, written, and customer service-oriented communication skills, with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to respond to and coordinate multiple activities simultaneously under short time frames.
Excellent and demonstrated critical thinking ability with keen attention to detail.
Must be able to work both collaboratively and independently and communicate/present professionally with internal and external customers.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or in a team setting, actively participate in discussions, and contribute to the achievement of team goals.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methods (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression analysis) is essential.
Strong attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and quality. Ability to identify data anomalies, perform data validation, and conduct thorough quality assurance checks.
Flexibility to work in a fast-paced and evolving environment, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Understanding of business operations and the ability to align data analysis efforts with organizational objectives and key performance indicators.

Education, Experience, & Licensing Requirements

Education

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and experience required. A master's degree preferred.

Experience

Three (3) years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a business or corporate setting.
Experience working with large datasets and conducting statistical analysis is required.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools. Experience with data modeling and machine learning techniques is a plus.

Travel Requirements

Employee will work remotely from a home-based office. Infrequent travel may be required.

Role is Predominantly Remote. Travel is paid for and project dependent.

description

As an IT Business Relationship Management (BRM) Analyst, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between IT and business stakeholders and supporting the IT BRM Managers, reporting into the VP, Transformation & IT BRM. You will work closely with both technical teams and business units to understand their needs, align IT services with business objectives, and ensure the successful delivery of IT solutions. Your primary goal will be to enhance collaboration and communication between IT and the business units & functions, as well as within the IT functions. You will be a strong advocate for the Mativ IT culture in We Partner, We Listen, We Deliver & We Care.

responsibilities:

Stakeholder Engagement
Develop and maintain strong relationships with business unit leaders, managers, and key stakeholders.
Act as a point of contact between the IT department and business units.
Requirements Gathering
Partner with BRM Managers to document and facilitate the demand intake process, including the gathering and documentation of IT-related requirements.
Build a systemic process for the IT demand funnel.
IT Service Portfolio Management
Assist in the management of the IT service portfolio, ensuring it meets the evolving needs of the business.
Identify opportunities to enhance existing IT services or introduce new ones.
Alignment with Business Objectives
Work with BRM managers and business stakeholders to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for IT projects and services.
Ensure that IT initiatives are aligned with the overall business strategy.
Project Coordination
Facilitate communication between IT project teams and business units.
Utilize IT systems to facilitate IT demand and execution process from idea generation to project hand-off to project management team.
Technology Trends and Innovation
Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies to identify opportunities for innovation and process improvement.


qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field.
Proven experience in IT Business Relationship Management, Business Analysis, or a similar role.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Knowledge of ITIL or similar IT service management frameworks is a plus.
Project management skills and familiarity with project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) is beneficial.
Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP) or ITIL is a plus.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work both with a team and independently.


About Mativ

Mativ is the newly created company through the combination of SWM and Neenah. This is an exciting opportunity for both companies to come together and create a global leader in specialty materials and solutions with approximately $3B in sales generated through our complementary products, innovation capabilities, customers, and attractive end-markets. Together, there is potential to create significant value for our customers, shareholders, and, most importantly, our employees. Mativ is headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia. The Company offers a wide range of critical components and engineered solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. With over 7,500 employees worldwide, we manufacture on four continents and generate sales in more than 100 countries. We offer a wide range of premium applications across diversified and growing end markets, from filtration to healthcare to sustainable packaging. Our broad portfolio of technologies combines polymers, fibers, and resins to optimize the performance of our customers’ products across multiple stages of the value chain. Our leading positions are a testament to our best-in-class global manufacturing, supply chain, and materials science capabilities. We drive innovation and enhance performance, finding potential in the impossible.

The purpose of this requirement is to support CDC in its effort to gather and analyze data from longitudinal pregnant people and infant surveillance and Birth Defects surveillance/registry systems, as well as provide services to support CDC activities related to neonatal abstinence syndrome to make use of existing state bio surveillance and other surveillance tools to improve voluntary, de-identified prenatal and newborn health data. Data may include opioid-related information before and during pregnancy to reduce risks associated with neonatal abstinence syndrome and optimize care.

Develop/finalize a data users’ guide and documentation (standard operating procedures) on data analyses procedures and practices
Conduct data quality review analyses for existing birth defects and pregnant people and infant longitudinal databases
Ensure activities comply with CDC required confidentiality policies and procedures

Install, maintain, and support data networks for Surveillance for Emerging Threats to Pregnant People and Infants Network (SET-NET)
Maintain and support data networks for Maternal and Infant Network to Understand Outcomes Associated with Treatment for Opioid Use Disorder During Pregnancy (MAT-LINK)

About Lukos
Lukos has been delivering professional services to the Federal Government for 15 years. We help a variety of federal agencies in areas such as national security, homeland security, international development, training, analytics, healthcare, and other professional services. Since our founding, we have grown to support all military services and multiple federal civilian agencies.
About Our Name: Lukos is ancient Greek for “wolf”. The characteristics of the wolf match our approach to national security. The wolf is known for cunning, aggression, patience, and teamwork. An individual wolf is smart, strong, and resilient, but the true strength of wolves is their ability to work together as a wolfpack. Kipling said it best in The Law of the Jungle.
"For the strength of the pack is the wolf, and the strength of the wolf is the pack."
At Lukos we take care of our pack by offering full time employees competitive benefits to include: medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, short and long term disability coverage, paid time off and Federal holidays.
Lukos is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or national origin.

New Georgia Project (NGP) is a non-partisan, 501c3 nonprofit organization formed to register the unregistered people of color in the state of Georgia. Our work is based in registering and advocating for Georgians of color (Black, Latinos, Asian-Americans) while engaging them in the democratic process and participating in collective actions around common issue areas. Those issue areas include voting rights, quality and affordable health care, economic justice, civil rights and more.?


New Georgia Project Action Fund (NGPAF) is NGP’s non-partisan, 501c4 affiliate organization. It was formed to increase the civic participation of underrepresented and underserved communities of color.

NGPAF does this by engaging in local and state political campaigns, in support of, or opposition to, ballot measures, referendums, recalls, initiatives and candidacies for local and state offices.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to support the data department. This role will primarily support the field, volunteer/membership, and organizing teams. They will focus on reporting on KPIs, providing training, and support on outreach platforms. We’re looking for a teammate who can innovate, think independently, and initiate change, and simultaneously operationalize and execute on existing development strategies.




POSITION SUMMARY:

NGP and NGPAF are vibrant, independent, fast-paced, non-partisan voter registration and civic organizations that have seen explosive growth in the last twelve months and are headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. NGP and NGPAF seek a passionate, collaborative, and innovative professional that will join the Organization during an exciting time of transformation.

The Data Analyst will provide support to the organization and its efforts in numerous capacities. Reporting to the Senior Data Analyst, the Data Analyst will track NGP/AF’s program and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and tell the story of NGP/AF’s work by building reports and dashboards, as well as training and offering support to the Organizing and Field Teams in all platforms used at NGP/AF. Platforms where professional proficiency is desired are VAN, EveryAction, GetThru (ThruTalk and ThruText), and Mobilize. The position requires a steady hand at time and priority management, presentation and training skills, and the ability to collaborate within a team in a fast-paced environment.

Because our target communities and colleagues come from a wide range of backgrounds, applicants need to be able to thoughtfully navigate issues related to diversity, race, equity, and inclusion, and bring a deep commitment to advancing these values. You’ll also need to bring a strong commitment to excellence and true collaboration, an ability to work quickly but carefully, and appreciation for/patience, and developing and growing your team members.

Job Title: Business Analyst, FFS Medicaid Claims- remote
Job Description:
Putting People First in Pharmacy- Navitus was founded as an alternative to traditional pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) models. We are committed to removing cost from the drug supply chain to make medications more affordable for the people who need them. At Navitus, our team members work in an environment that celebrates diversity, fosters creativity and encourages growth. We welcome new ideas and share a passion for excellent service to our customers and each other.

The Business Analyst (BA), Fee for Service (FFS) Medicaid Claims Processing will provide Business Analysis support for the development, implementation, and maintenance of our Navitus NCRx platform when applied to FFS regulatory accounts. The FFS implementations require full compliance to NCPDP standards as they emerge including the current D.0 standard for pharmacy claims and the subsequent NCPDP F6 standard. Further, the Business Analyst will be responsible for informing the FFS leadership of the functional evolution of the market needs in support of improving product releases.

The BA reports to the Portfolio Manager. The BA is part of related agile teams that are developing the next generation in pharmacy claims processing. The analyst is expected to provide creativity in addressing the unique needs of the product’s constituents and applying state-of-the-art information system concepts and solutions. The BA is expected to work with Navitus internal and external resources to determine projected business needs and translate those needs into the module architecture. The BA will also support procurement activities, ensuring claims responses align with capabilities. Developing solutions further require the BA to approve detailed requirements, work breakdown structures, and other deliverables that support the development and implementation of a best in class tool.

The BA will apply demonstrable communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help support development and product lifecycle activities.

Is this you? Find out more below!

How do I make an impact on my team?

Develop and maintain deep knowledge of NCPDP pharmacy POS claims processing requirements.
Develop an understanding of unique attributes within a claim transaction where contracted State governments apply specific regulatory requirements to support their programs.
Understand the competitive landscape, regulatory lifecycle and related government processes surrounding FFS.
Facilitate and moderate gap analysis and requirements gathering sessions for as-is and to-be stages of product development and accountable for compliance with state compliance.
Learn and apply technical tools that support the product development process and used to communicate the business features to the technical design and development teams.
With input from key stakeholders, prioritize business needs of the product and incorporate the criteria to develop the product’s functional releases.
Facilitate productive discussions to gather and document in both text and visual formats the expected functionality for this product and how it supports the FFS portfolio.
Moderate the development teams to ensure functional and non-functional requirements are understood and implemented consistent with the BA vision.
Work with the team to identify, analyze, quantify, and mitigate risks.
Work with the project management office to utilize and enhance tools that support the requirements, development, and testing processes.

What our team expects from you?

4 years of Business Analyst experience required and Bachelor’s degree preferred; relevant certifications from recognized industry organizations
Experience documenting complex technical processing functions is required
Experience with implementation of government regulations into software development activities is required
Experience participating in an agile development project team is required
Experience with core software applications, including Microsoft Word and Excel is required
Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies is required
Experience in roles like a Business Analyst, Business Systems Analyst, or Product Manager is required
Participate in, adhere to, and support compliance program objectives
The ability to consistently interact cooperatively and respectfully with other employees

What can you expect from Navitus?

Hours/Location: Monday – Friday: 8:00am-5:00pm CST, Appleton Office or remote.
Paid Volunteer Hours
Educational Assistance Plan and Professional Membership assistance
Referral Bonus Program – up to $750!
Top of the industry benefits for Health, Dental, and Vision insurance, Flexible Spending Account, Paid Time Off, Eight paid holidays, 401K, Short-term and Long-term disability, College Savings Plan, Paid Parental Leave, Adoption Assistance Program, and Employee Assistance Program

COMPANY OVERVIEW
PlayOn! Sports is the nation's leading high school media and technology company, providing streaming and digital ticketing services to thousands of high schools nationwide. In 2013, PlayOn! Sports and the National Federation of State High School Associations (NFHS) created the NFHS Network, a joint venture that aggregates the sports media and related rights of state high school athletic associations while celebrating the accomplishments of student-athletes, student broadcasters, and high schools across the country. Through the NFHS Network, PlayOn! Sports provides automated production capabilities free of charge to schools which allows them to live-stream via artificial intelligence and automation thus avoiding the need for production personnel.

In 2022, PlayOn! Sports and GoFan (backed by KKR a leading global investment firm), the leading digital ticketing company in the high school sports market, joined forces to create a streamlined customer experience for in-person, live-stream, and on-demand events. There are 19,500 high schools in the NFHS ecosystem and PlayOn! Sports currently works with over 50% of them. Going forward, the company is focused on: 1) continuing to grow the number of schools it works with; 2) continuing to grow the average revenue per school; 3) expanding the products and services it provides to the high school ecosystem beyond streaming; 4) expanding outside of high school sports.

THE ROLE

PlayOn! Sports is looking for a seasoned Technical Business Analyst to become a part of our team. In this role, you will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions. You will be responsible for analyzing, documenting, and translating complex business requirements into technical specifications. This pivotal role encompasses the management and escalation of bugs and other pertinent issues beyond the capacity of Streaming Support (SST) and Customer Service for our NFHS Network streaming brand.

Additional responsibilities and accountabilities for this role include:

Analyze and categorize technical escalations from SST, ensuring they are well documented and ready for further action. This may involve complex technical logs or working with technical teams to grasp the details of certain issues.
Be the glue between SST, Product, and Customer Service. This means not only engaging in proactive dialogue with other departments to solve issues but also working hand in glove with the customer service team to ensure that the client’s voice is always in the mix.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their objectives, processes, and requirements.
Conduct thorough analysis of business processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
Translate business needs into detailed and comprehensive technical requirements and offering your technical insight to provide a clearer understanding of the platform and products to internal teams.

THE PERSON

3-5 years of experience, preferably in a technical liaison role.
Strong technical aptitude with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.
Experience analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to extract valuable insights that inform business decisions.
Experience identifying trends, patterns, and anomalies in data, providing recommendations for data-driven solutions.
Streaming video background with direct experience operating or supporting a large-scale production video streaming service.
Experience working with CRM software and ticketing systems (Zendesk, Jira).
Bachelor's degree in a related field.


WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING AT PLAYON! SPORTS
PlayOn! Sports is more than just a place to work. It's a place to learn, grow, and thrive as people and professionals. We encourage a healthy work-life balance at PlayOn! Sports through offering flexible working schedules and generous paid time off in the off-season. Come be a part of the team that is changing the landscape of high school sports!
Some benefits we offer include:
Competitive salary
Multiple Medical options to choose from
Dental, Vision, Life and Disability Insurance
Unlimited PTO
401K plan with company match
Fun and collaborative hybrid/flexible work environment
Note: Part-time employees and interns are not eligible to participate in any of the Company’s Employee Health Benefit Plan listed above. These Benefits are only available to full-time employees of the Company.

The Technical Business Analyst position will work on the ESS (Enterprise Software Systems) team. The technical analyst will work on multiple and diverse projects across the ESS Data and shared services team, delivering technical specifications and working together with other teams. Bachelor's degree in information technology, or a related field or equivalent work experience

Technical documentation experience

This is a HYBRID position, which requires reporting onsite 2-3 times a week.

Essential Functions:

Provides direction to align technology with County strategies, priorities, and business needs; oversees the evaluation and redesign of business processes to enhance business functionality and efficiency; provides business and technical expertise on trends, external practices, and the application of new and existing technology to business practices; serves as agency’s point of contact to coordinate technology needs and requests; and evaluates, prioritizes, and educates others on the business and technical implications of requested changes and improvements on systems.

Manages business process activities for the systems development life cycle for new and/or existing complex systems; manages the development, implementation, interoperability, and security of systems; determines appropriate system life cycle techniques and methods for implementation; and serves as lead system administrator for multiple complex, inter-departmental systems in multiple environments and on a variety of platforms.

Develops processes to ensure compliance with established rules and regulations, policies and procedures; and identifies and maintains key performance measures for business processes associated with technical systems.

Manages functional testing during solution implementation; ensures solutions function correctly to serve user needs without compromising other system functions; and manages documentation of system requirements, specifications and changes.

Supervises the delivery of training classes to user communities; supervises the creation of user training manuals and lesson plans; selects training times/locations based on users’ needs; and answers questions and provides information during and after training.

Negotiates service contracts; prepares business and technical specifications and requirements; participates in negotiations of scope of services and fees for professional services agreements; makes recommendations regarding selection of vendors and awarding of contrac contracts; and monitors vendor performance and contract fulfillment

Maintains an awareness of new applications, technologies, technical methods, business trends, and advances in the profession; reviews professional publications, technical manuals, and websites to increase knowledge of network operations; and attends conferences, workshops, and training sessions as appropriate.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field required; five years of progressively responsible technical experience in a centralized Information Technology environment, to include lead or supervisory experience, and seven years of experience in the field; or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience which provides the requisite knowledge, skills, and abilities for this job.

Specific License or Certification Required: Must possess and maintain a valid Georgia driver’s license; Information Technology Infrastructure Library certification, Six Sigma certification, and Lean Six Sigma certification preferred.

The Specialist, Reporting and Business Analysis will be responsible for performing deep management requested and standard financial and data analysis of Revenue Pipeline (RP) information related to passenger revenues, commissions, rasm, yield, profitability, and contractual agreements for various customer groups including senior management.

Summary of Responsibilities:


Work with the Revenue Pipeline Solutions Center (RPSC) and various business customers and determine clear and actionable requirements for new or existing Revenue Pipeline reports while managing end-user expectations.
Design, develop, test, and document structured queries and reports to extract data from a data warehouse (Revenue Pipeline Analytical database; RPAD) and maximize the performance and accuracy of standard and ad hoc queries and reports.

Recommend business process and/or design enhancements to DL management. Work with the RPSC and/or Information Technology groups (IT) to analyze, design, build, test, and implement these enhancements.
Perform project management /product owner activities by proposing and reviewing the requirements for new Revenue Pipeline processes or modifications to RPAD. Document, test and audit the impacted RPAD activities.
Perform data validation and explain differences between Revenue Pipeline data and other sources of data to end-users.
Research and communicate answers to end-users’ questions about Revenue Pipeline data and reports, including data issues, interpretation of RP data, report availability, and post report delivery questions.
Prepare and facilitate Revenue Pipeline training sessions which explain Revenue Pipeline reports and data, or common end-user difficulties with RP data including general Brio query knowledge, general RP data knowledge, and complex Revenue Pipeline attributes.
Serve as a Revenue Pipeline Subject Matter Expert. Provide RP data, RP processes, Reporting Tools (Brio and SAS), and Delta business knowledge to other Delta organizations, and Delta Information Technology, for the purposes of analysis, report development, and training.

Job Description
Location:
Atlanta,GA,US
