Job Number:
R0185260



GIS Data Analyst

The Opportunity:

As an analytics professional, you love diving into data and turning it into meaningful insights. With the abundance of structured and unstructured data, you understand the importance of transforming complex data sets into useful information to solve challenges. As a GIS data analyst at Booz Allen, you can use your skills to support a mission and use data for good. We need a GIS data analyst like you to bring your knowledge to strengthen the nation's public health systems.


As a client-facing GIS data analyst on our Health team, you’ll work closely with your clients to understand their questions and needs and then dig into their data-rich environments to help find the pieces of their information puzzle. Not only will you extract and evaluate their data, you’ll also help your client interpret the information and recommend how it can be used to make an impact on the importance of geography and place in shaping health outcomes.

How You’ll Contribute:
As a GIS data analyst on our team, you’ll:

Use your technical knowledge to support client and stakeholder relationships supporting public health missions.
Research, develop, and test data methodologies, and generate cross-functional solutions through extraction, analysis, and visualization of large data sets.
Contribute to impactful work and guide decision-making across multiple organizations.
Apply your communication skills and analytical mindset by simplifying technical requirements and trends, based on audience.
Present data findings and recommendations to clients and stakeholders using your knowledge of databases, scripting languages such as SQL, ArcGIS, and Microsoft Office Suite.
Establish quantitative and qualitative metrics and key performance indicators to drive technical outcomes.
Apply data visualization through different formats such as Maps, Graphics, Tables, and other visualizations.
Grow your communication and technical skills by merging consulting and big data to create data-centric solutions in Public Health.

Work with us to help drive large-scale business and process decisions through data insights.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

5+ years of experience in working with GIS, cartography, geography, computer science, public health, or data analytics
Experience with Geographical Information Systems (GIS) and software, including ArcGIS, ArcGIS online, or QGIS
Experience with Structured Query Language (SQL) for data management and analysis
Experience with data visualizations for broad audiences
Experience in a built environment or environmental health
Experience in working with large environmental datasets
Ability to troubleshoot desktop, web, database, and server problems
Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust or Suitability/Fitness determination based on client requirements
Bachelor's degree

Nice If You Have:

Experience with software products, including SaTScan, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator or Adobe InDesign, Google Maps or Google Earth, and Microsoft Office Suite, including Access, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI, and Outlook
Experience with programming and scripting, including R, Python, or SAS
Knowledge of relational database concepts
Knowledge of public health, cartography, and environmental health
Knowledge of health equity or social vulnerability

Vetting:

Applicants selected will be subject to a government investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements of the U.S. government client.


Create Your Career:


Grow With Us
Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong
Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being
Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey
At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $45,300.00 to $93,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

EEO Commitment

We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Apogee Engineering is seeking a Maintenance Data Analyst to work in support of the C-5 System Program Office (Air Force Life Management Center [AFLCMC])/WLS) at Robins Air Force Base (AFB), GA.

Why work with us?

Apogee Engineering, LLC is a provider of research, engineering, operations, software, cyber, intel, training, technical services, financial and administrative expertise across an array of DOD and Federal Civilian customers. Our company was founded on the commitment of making a positive difference for our customers and our people. Apogee’s culture is infused with integrity and a passion for excellence, which has propelled us into the ranks of an elite small business company. Apogee is known for an unwavering dedication to our client's success, a warm and employee-centric work environment, and an enthusiasm to provide the right solution at the right time.

What you will be doing:

Perform data analysis and support sustainment of structures, systems, and zonal analysis tasks consistent with Maintenance Steering Group – 3 (MSG-3) philosophy.
Use tools/processes, including best practices from the commercial aviation industry and current Department of Defense (DoD) guidelines to preserve overall C-5 fleet reliability.
Review and generate Engineering Requirement Reviews (ERRs) for all MSG-3 tasks (both new and old).
Conduct investigations into C-5 fleet deficiencies and make recommendations to improve Reliability, Availability, and Maintainability (RAM).
Identify, collect, and analyze C-5 maintenance failure data, aircraft diagnostic data, RAM data, engineering disposition data, and deficiency reporting data.
Identify, evaluate, and resolve issues which may affect aircraft safety and operational capabilities as part of ERR Support Program.
Analyze C-5 parts supportability from suppliers, such as the Air Force Sustainment Center (AFSC) or Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) locations, and identify supportability issues that impact maintenance tasks.
Communicate with other Contractor and Government team members to coordinate approval of ERR Development Packages (DEV PAC).

What you'll need:

Minimum of 11+ years (12+ years preferred) experience performing aircraft maintenance or equivalent combination of education and experience
Knowledge and experience applying MSG-3 commercial best practices and Air Force Manual (AFMAN) 63-143 guidelines
Familiarity with various data analysis sources, such as G081, REMIS, ROCIT, MWR, AutoTAR, IES, AFIRM, FEDLOG, and D043
Demonstrated ability to perform analysis and make recommendations aligned with findings
Strong written and oral communication skills

Benefits:

Apogee offers two medical plans, a high deductible health plan with a HRA and a traditional POS plan with co-pays, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, PTO, paid holidays, parental, military and jury duty paid leaves. Regular part time employees scheduled for twenty-four or more hours per work week are eligible for benefits on a pro-rated basis.
This position is eligible for a discretionary annual bonus.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. The Genius Brand creates and markets premium supplements in the Vitamins, Minerals and Supplements category. As a digitally-native brand we operate in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment on a small, nimble team of high-energy creators and category disruptors. We are experiencing rapid growth and are looking to add a detail-oriented Web Analytics Analyst to our team.

Job Summary:
The Web Analytics Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data sets across multiple e-Commerce platforms to identify actionable insights. Under the general supervision of the Director of e-Commerce this newly created position will play a key role in developing the brand’s marketing investment strategy.

Our perfect candidate will be a self-starter able to work without direct supervision who is highly analytical, understands quantitative modeling, has experience with Google Analytics and data visualization platforms, knows how to leverage data to tell a story, has strong communication skills and collaborates well with internal and external stakeholders.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Analyze website and performance marketing data to provide actionable insights to management
Own brand performance analysis across all e-Commerce platforms
Provide insights on traffic, customer patterns, order behavior and product selection
Run descriptive statistical analysis to identify key trends in the customer journey
Conduct analysis on customer segmentations, forecasting, experience optimization, and A/B testing
Work with key stakeholders in defining testing protocols to derive insights for solving business problems
Define KPI’s for each platform and design the reporting format by which to track and measure
Create reports which provide rich insights for the intended audience and dashboards to track business performance “at-a-glance”
Convert statistical results into actionable business plans
Leverage data to build strong stories that are appropriate for the intended audience
Analyze data to improve business intelligence programs

Required Skills & Abilities:

Experience with Google Analytics
Experience with data visualization platforms such as PowerBI
Experience analyzing web and mobile data to make actionable recommendations
Expertise in common digital marketing experiments such as A/B testing
Strategic thinker with experience in solving customer-level business challenges
Highly analytical with strong mathematical and statistical knowledge
Self-motivated and accountable with keen attention to detail
Demonstrated ability to work within a fully distributed team
Exceptional leadership and cross-functional collaboration skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to prioritize and meet timelines in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Has a working knowledge of Snowflake, AWS cloud services and Google Cloud Platform APIs

Education & Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or related field
1-3 years of relevant experience

Ideal Profile:

A passion for and knowledge of the supplement category
Consumer products and VMS category experience a plus
Entrepreneurial-minded team player who thrives in a fast-paced environment
Able to successfully deal with ambiguity
Able to analyze data and trends and be able to extract the “so what?” from it
Proven track record of working independently and efficiently, handling time-sensitive projects, and prioritizing multiple objectives
A clear sense of ownership and personal accountability

Work location - Buford, GA or Remote

Employment Eligibility Verification

Must possess valid documentation to establish identity and U.S. employment eligibility.

Security Requirements

Submission to, and ability to pass, a thorough pre-employment background check by Catalyst is a requirement of employment.

The Genius Brand is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Under general supervision, the Data Conversion Analyst will work closely with a group of talented Business Analysts and Technical Specialists with the objective of extracting and transforming data from various ERP and related systems into Workday.

This is a time-limited, at-will employment position assigned to a project with an approximate 3-year life cycle.

•Develop/test/execute data conversion extractions, transformations, and processes within an established

conversion framework in a timely and accurate manner.

•Communicate effectively with management.

•Develop good working relationships with departmental staff in order to troubleshoot technical and

functional issues that may arise during the implementation process.

•Solid grasp of relational database structures and strong use of SQL

•Familiarity with a variety of database types and interfaces (Microsoft Access, Oracle, various text formats, ODBC).

•Solid understanding and usage of Microsoft Excel

•Positive, proactive, take-charge attitude and attention to detail.

•Strong time management skills with the ability to meet deadlines for multiple, concurrent projects.

•Ability to quickly gain working knowledge of product, interpret requirements, and recommend solutions.

•Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field from an accredited college or university AND One year of job-related experience.

•Experience with PeopleSoft, Oracle, Taleo, Workday or other SaaS and On-Premises ERP systems.

•Can work in a fast paced, fast-growth, high-energy environment and take care of multiple high priority

activities concurrently.

•Standout colleague who can collaborate and communicate optimally with all partners, i.e. developers,

technical operations, and customers.

•Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.

•Passion for data accuracy and completeness.

Provides administrative support to the Human Resources Functions related to the Employee Relations Department. Duties require the exercise of courtesy in speaking with hospital staff, visitors, and others to maintain sound public relations. Administers human resources policies and procedures that pertain to employee relations. Researches and analyzes data, provides management with reports on any employee relations issues and possible resolutions. Performs employee counseling, equal employment opportunity, disability services, and labor relations. Investigates and documents employee complaints and disputes and recommend appropriate course of action. Educates new and current employees on employee relations policies.
PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for handling any Employee Relations related inquiries, data entry, reporting and reconciliation tasks as appropriate.
Performs transactions related to Employee Relations with a high degree of accuracy and strict adherence to written procedures.
Maintains knowledge of organizational and departmental policies and procedures. Providing education on benefits, leave of absences, payroll, HR processes to new hires, employees and managers.
Responds to incoming correspondence/calls from employees for all Employee Relations related inquiries. References company policies and procedures to ensure accuracy of response and to offer all available information. Determines and addresses any unstated needs. Recognizes when escalation of a situation is necessary. Records the details of each call. Maintains confidentiality of all HR related information.
Manages and monitors multiple means of incoming communication/requests from employees, including but not limited to voicemail, email, USPS mail, fax, cases, etc.
Provides information related to HR operations and policy to employees.
Utilizes a system to document details of inquiries to include transaction type, troubleshooting steps, database management, and steps taken to meet the customer’s request. Utilizes the HR knowledge base and case management system and other tools to actively manage caseload in accordance with team production goals and established quality standards.
Utilizes the HR knowledge base and case management system to run reports that will identify trends of concerns.
Proactively escalates issues to ensure the timeliest service. Serves as a customer advocate and represents the company in a professional manner.
Practice proper safety techniques in accordance with Hospital and departmental policies and procedures. Immediately report any mechanical or electrical equipment malfunctions, unsafe conditions, or employee/patient/visitor injury/accidents to their supervisor.

High School Diploma or equivalent (GED).
Two (2) years of Human Resources OR customer service related experience.

Ability to work with many different people with different personalities.

JOB SUMMARY: Responsible for reviewing business processes and proposing technical solutions to solve business problems. Gain strong understanding of current procedures and identify improvements. Able to document the current state of business processes as well as the desired future state.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Demonstrates proficiency in requirements gathering, estimation, gaining customer approval, and delivery of requests.
Performs research and interviews business to determine business and technology requirements and then translate such into specifications for projects.
Performs feasibility analysis, scopes projects, and works with the applications management team and the Project Manager to prioritize deliverables, and negotiate on product functionalities.
Creates detailed Requirement Document with functional and technical specifications. Effectively communicates and documents business and technical information in line with agreed processes and procedures.
Provides analytic support by coordinating data interpretation. Partners with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions.
Develop test plans, participates in Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.
Analyzes, facilitate, model, and organize information in order to reconcile conflicts, elicit requirements and distinguish solution ideas from business needs.
Identifies process improvement opportunities. Develops business process models and documentation. Assists business in Change Management activities.
Provide guidance for business implications of various applications. Work with the technology development teams on project requests and production issues.
Balances technology and business issues as well as communicates appropriately with both technology and business experts.




MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: The requirements listed below are representative of the minimum knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business or IT, preferred.
5+ years of experience working as a Functional and Technical Business Analyst.
Advanced skills in MS Tools- Excel, Power Point, Project, Visio, and Outlook.
5+ years of customer interfacing experience – project oversight, customer presentation.
5+ years’ work experience in full systems development.
An overall general understanding of large operating business environments and projecrs, SDLC, Change Control, Desktop Support, Service Desks, Application Development, Release Management.



COMPETENCIES:

Customer Service: Displays courtesy and sensitivity; Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Meets commitments; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service.
Analytical Skills: Applies logic and complex layers of rules to analyze and categorize complicated information. Goes beyond analyzing information to develop a conceptual understanding of the meaning of a range of information.
Problem Solving: Tests proposed solutions against the reality of likely effects before going forward; looks beyond the obvious and does not stop at first answers.
Communications: Exhibits good listening and comprehension; Expresses ideas and thoughts in written form; Expresses ideas and thoughts verbally; Keeps others adequately informed; Selects and uses appropriate communication methods.
Accuracy and Attention to Detail: Diligently attends to details and pursues quality in accomplishing tasks.
Quality: Applies feedback to improve performance; Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Displays commitment to excellence; Monitors own work to ensure quality.
Teamwork: Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views.

None

Position Purpose:

A Data Analyst Supply Chain leverages technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. Responsible for working collaboratively with other analysts to apply established analytical processes on diverse datasets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. Also ensures that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are completed competently in a timely manner, continually seeking out opportunities to hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and learn new skills. Operates under the supervision and mentorship of more experienced managers and data scientists.


Key Responsibilities:
30% Executes existing reporting and analytical responsibilities
20% Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests
20% Ensures the quality of work output by displaying a keen attention to detail
20% Develops additional technical competencies and subject matter expertise within core functional group
10% Presents findings in easily understood ways, focuses on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture

B.S. in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Finance or related quantitative field

Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving.

Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on findings. A track record of taking complex results and communicating them in an easily understood way.

INPO sets the global standard in nuclear safety by demanding excellence of ourselves and expecting it of others. We recruit, develop, grow and retain passionate, driven people who make a meaningful difference across INPO and the global nuclear power industry.

Currently, the INPO Data Science department has an intern position that it seeks to fill with high caliber engineering students throughout the year. Ideally, participants in the INPO program enter in their second year of college. Assignments are challenging and build upon the work experience gained. This position is also made available to work on projects in the INPO Data Management and Industry Trends department. Participants gain a perspective of nuclear facility operations and events, regulations, and organizational challenges to supplement the technical knowledge gained through college.

Essential Functions

Performance indicator development and document production
Updating and maintaining quality assurance tools for INPO’s applications that create performance indicators
Updating and maintaining job aids and how-to documents that support development, use, and maintenance of INPO’s Plant Information Center and Industry Reporting and Information System
Supporting triage of industry service requests for INPO’s Plant Information Center and Industry Reporting and Information System

You know that true progress is made at the intersection of business and tech, and as a Technical Business Analyst, you will a key member of teams using cutting edge technologies to solve complex business problems. Empower change with us.

The People Data and Reporting Analyst plays a crucial role in providing data-driven insights and analytics that will enable our organization to make informed decisions related to human capital management. This role involves collecting, analyzing, and report development to support HR initiatives and drive organizational effectiveness.

How You'll Make an Impact

70% Data Collection, Analysis and Report Development

Gather, consolidate, and validate HR data from various sources. Ensure data accuracy and consistency by performing regular data audits and validation checks.

Generate standard and ad-hoc reports on HR metrics such as turnover, headcount, compensation, and benefits. Collaborate with HR team members to understand their reporting needs and requirements. Identify opportunities to streamline HR reporting processes and implement improvements.

Design and develop HR reports, dashboards, and scorecards using reporting tools (e.g., Excel, Workday, Tableau). Create visually appealing data visualizations to communicate data effectively. Work closely with IT and other departments to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

Provide actionable insights to support strategic HR decision-making.

Conduct ad hoc analyses to answer specific HR-related questions and provide data-driven solutions.

30% Compensation Support

Participate in the implementation of new Workday Compensation related features and functionalities, ensuring seamless data integration.

Maintains the compensation market pricing tool including the annual market pricing data refresh process, pay structure updates, reporting and data analysis.

Assist in development of standard compensation market data updates for ongoing HRBP client data needs. Provide technical support to resolve data-related inquiries and issues.

Maintain strictest confidentiality in all work aspects and ensure continuing data integrity.

Learn compensation fundamentals to expand knowledge outside of reporting and analytics

We’d Love to hear from you if: (Requirements section)

Must have:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, or a related field and three years of hands-on experience with HR data visualization and analytics, Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Excellent writing skills for generating clear, concise release notes and documentation
Project management skills; demonstrated ability to manage work across multiple projects with varying degrees of complexity and timing
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and data accuracy.
Effective communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

Preferred skills and experience:

Working knowledge of Workday HCM strongly preferred
Knowledge of HR processes, metrics, and best practices
Experience in HR reporting and data analysis.
Familiarity with HR compliance regulations and systems.
HCM analytics a plus.

Customer Focus: Proactively seek opportunities to leverage data and fact-based insights to serve customers and/or internal clients.
Drive Growth: Set aggressive goals and implement plans precisely.

JOB SUMMARY

This is an Operations position responsible for the implementation, upgrades, maintenance and training/support of all Operations department systems sites within a region. Must understand and recommend system enhancements to improve profitability and productivity. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to, validating the data produced and performing statistical analysis for the Operations Department Management and may also include providing management and direction to slotting staff.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Understands, utilizes and seeks continuous improvements in the use of all Operations information systems including, but not limited to, Sysco Warehouse Management System (SWMS), Sysco Order Selection system (SOS), Sysco Loading System (SLS), slotting system, cubing, load mapping, Sysco Transportation System (STS), onboard computer system, routing software, safe driver behavior modification management software, engineered standards, business metrics reporting, incentive pay reporting and SAP and/or other systems as identified.
Responsible for the accountability, inventory, and maintenance of all Operations systems hardware, software, and radio frequency (RF) equipment, ensuring the efficient operation of the department.

Develops and provides reports for management as directed.
Typical requests consist of consolidating information from various sources to provide executive summaries, trends, metrics, etc. (labor costs, accuracy, results, etc.)
Analyze data, identifies opportunities and propose actions to increase the effectiveness of the Operations departments.
Communicates with all other areas of the company as necessary and provides Operations information and reports as requested.
Collaborates with the Transportation Department and the Inbound and Outbound Warehouse management staff to maximize productivity.
Serves as essential personnel in times of catastrophic events and emergencies (hurricane, facility malfunction, etc.) locally and/or at other operating companies as required.
Performs management functions of staff selection, development, discipline, performance reviews and/or terminations if required.
Performs other duties as assigned by Management.
Complies with local, state and federal regulatory agencies (i.e. OSHA, FDA, USDA, etc.)

Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide into all units of measure; compute rate, ratio, and percent; uses whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals; demonstrates a general understanding of financial terminology and concepts.
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.

Demonstrates excellent subject matter knowledge of, experience with and ability to learn Sysco technology software and programs and/or equivalent products. (i.e. Sysco Warehouse Management System (SWMS), Sysco Order Selection system (SOS), Sysco Loading System (SLS), slotting system, cubing, load mapping, Sysco Transportation System (STS), onboard computer system, routing software, safe driver behavior modification management software, engineered standards, business metrics reporting, incentive pay reporting, spreadsheet software, word processing software, SAP and/or other systems as identified.
Proficient in the use of all tools of the trade.
Working knowledge of shipping procedures and practices; inventory control processes, procedures, and practices; and inventoried product line specifications (dimensions, weight, etc.)
Demonstrate knowledge of methods, techniques, and procedures involved in repairs and replacement of hardware, software, and radiofrequency equipment.

Ability to plan and organize own activities; analyze and disseminate forms; manage work time efficiently; follow procedures and policies; identify and solve problems; and manage multiple priorities.

Job Title: Sr. Business Analyst - Procure to Pay
Job Description:
The Sr. Business Analyst - Procure To Pay position will play a vital role in leveraging Oracle cloud suite of products and SaaS solutions to optimize our business processes and drive efficiency in the business-owned system requirements and partnership with the IT organization. This position must understand Accounting, IT, and business functions and processes. This individual must demonstrate strong problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as excellent communication skills when interfacing with both the business and the IT team.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Collaborate closely with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements specific to the accounting systems.
Work with cross-functional teams to design and implement effective solutions using Oracle Cloud modules, tailored to the unique needs of accounting operations functions.
Perform detailed gap analysis to identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations for optimizing business processes and system functionality within the Oracle cloud.
Translate complex business requirements into clear and comprehensive functional specifications, ensuring alignment with Oracle cloud capabilities.
Collaborate with the IT team to configure, customize, and implement solutions, while adhering to industry best practices and standards.
Conduct thorough testing and quality assurance activities to validate system changes, ensuring successful implementation and minimal disruption to accounting operations.
Provide end-user training and support to facilitate smooth adoption of new processes and system functionalities.
Helping the business to cost-effectively implement technology improvements and solutions.
Work with process owners to understand their requirements to improve and automate how these processes and procedures are performed.
Support vendor management as needed.
Participate in the project management of the implementation and enhancement of the Oracle Suite of products.
Serve as a subject matter expert on the Oracle cloud suite of products, staying updated with the latest features, enhancements, and industry trends.
Participate in system upgrades, patches, and maintenance activities, ensuring uninterrupted system outage.
Monitor and troubleshoot system issues, identifying root causes and implementing appropriate resolutions to minimize downtime and optimize performance.
Perform the role of SME for the SaaS applications owned by the business working with the vendor to solve any issues.
Manage all work in Smartsheet, with excellent attention to detail, to provide business and leadership with real-time status.
Manage business projects utilizing waterfall project plans and agile methodology while partnering with IT on project delivery.
Compliance: Ensure processes adhere to company policies, industry regulations, SOX controls, and best practices.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies related to OTC processes and suggest improvements accordingly.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS

4-year degree in Business Administration, or a related field required
5-7 years of proven experience as a Procure to Pay Oracle Business Analyst
Strong knowledge of Oracle cloud ERP accounting modules and their application within accounting functions

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, or ABILITIES

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into practical functional specifications.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Attention to detail and a focus on delivering high-quality results.
Project management skills and experience in process improvement initiatives.
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a complex and dynamic environment and work independently or as part of a team.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.

Job Description:

The Senior Investment Analyst – Strategy and Allocation provides a significant level of support (e.g., research, recommendations, analysis, etc.) for the Portfolio Managers (PMs) and the Managing Directors. He/She researches and analyzes data to support the senior Investments staff in making critical investment, portfolio management, and strategic planning decisions. This position researches and analyzes derivative strategies and structures and in support of portfolio management and due diligence activities and provides recommendations (e.g., investment strategies, managers, tools, etc.) to senior Investments staff.

The Senior Investment Analyst - Strategy and Allocation position is part of the Strategy and Allocation Team within the Investments Group and will support efforts related to strategic asset allocation, derivative overlay management, hedging, and risk management. The role provides support in all aspects of the Strategy and Allocation Team: data management, model construction and maintenance, portfolio construction, portfolio monitoring etc. The role provides opportunity to be creative and work on novel investment ideas and new data sources from professional publications and sell-side research.

This person assists with system testing and any other systems matters as delegated to them and will work significantly in a Salesforce data reporting environment.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:

Uses Salesforce to build and generate custom reports out of the state’s voter registration system
Analyze data reports to determine conclusions that can guide management decisions
Works with system vendors to create and design data reporting features in the state’s voter registration system
Trains county election officials on reporting features and answers data-related questions from county election officials
Communicates frequently with others of technical backgrounds and expertise about reporting and data requirements
Communicates frequently with county election officials and registrars to investigate and answer reporting and data questions
Oversees the process of fulfilling voter list orders for public customers and interacts with members of the public as needed
Involved in development of the Georgia Registered Voter Information System (GARViS)
Acts as point-of-contact for county liaisons and the Elections Division staff when dealing with data generation and analysis
Actively tests voter registration system reports to identify errors or defects
Writes or contributes to instructions or manuals that are specifically related to voter registration system data and reports to guide end users
Performs other related duties as assigned

About This Opportunity:
As a Systems QA Analyst, you will be responsible for monitoring the response accuracy and utilization of external vendors for the Fraud Department. This consists of reviewing samples of data and summary reports to confirm expected results are being met and providing regular updates to department leadership. You will also be responsible for ensuring appropriate configuration of new product set-ups and manage the change approval process for adjustments to configurations already in production. This position is based out of our Columbus, GA location.
Responsibilities:
Vendor Performance Assessments: Conduct thorough assessments of vendor performance, including Return on Investment (ROI) validation and effectiveness in fraud/false positive detection. Analyze data to provide insights into vendor performance and make recommendations for improvements.
Strategy Validation Assessments: Validate the efficacy of fraud prevention strategies, focusing on fraud detection rates and false positive impact. Utilize data analysis to assess the accuracy and efficiency of strategies, identifying areas for refinement.
Performance Reports: Generate weekly and monthly performance reports to communicate the outcomes of vendor performance assessments and strategy validations. Present findings to relevant stakeholders, providing valuable insights to guide decision-making.
Product Set-up QA: Ensure the accuracy and completeness of product set-up, particularly in relation to risk control configurations and related components. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to validate configurations and address any discrepancies. Document and maintain records of exceptions and exception approvals.
Qualifications:
Proven experience in system/automation quality assurance, fraud prevention, or related fields.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, detect patterns, and identify anomalies.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Excellent attention to detail and a meticulous mindset.
Familiarity with fraud detection strategies and concepts.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, cross-functional environment.
Strong problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to process improvement.

Job Summary



Responsible for connecting business units and technical teams by applying business analysis techniques and observing business unit practices to document and understand business functions and processes. Partners with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to identify and validate solutions to business unit requests and requirements. Assists with the evaluation and preparation of IT demands and/or project requests for prioritization and implementation.

Responsibilities



1. Researches, analyzes, and recommends changes to business processes to improve operational efficiencies, quality, and service

2. Identifies and maps related and dependent business processes within and across departments and divisions

3. Completes in-depth evaluation of related and dependent processes and applications to identify effects of process changes on other departments and divisions

4. Schedules, prepares, and facilitates fact finding and/or discovery analysis meetings with stakeholders and subject matter experts to understand and document current business processes and functions, pain points, assumptions, timeframes, and success measures

5. Identifies and analyzes business-critical process steps and the requirements/policies driving those steps

6. Consults with IT subject matter experts to design and make recommendations for standard, supportable ways to accomplish business-critical process steps

7. Identifies and documents business process inputs, outputs, and data elements required for optimal execution

8. Collaborates with business partners to confirm scope and objectives of the process analysis engagement and formulate a shared understanding of priorities for the engagement

9. Presents business process documentation to business and IT decision makers for evaluation and approval

10. Assists with identifying scope creep and collaborate with technical and functional teams to evaluate feasibility, effort, and project impact of scope changes

11. Identifies and validates technical solutions and implementation strategies to address business requests, needs, and/or issues based on understanding of Application portfolio and existing capabilities collaborating with UITS leadership and subject matter experts

12. Documents system processes and functionality and recommend improvements

13. Understands, analyzes, and communicates benefits of product features/functionalities and facilitate and document evaluation of go forward strategies and solutions

14. Designs user interface mock-ups to effectively meet business needs within native system functionality

15. Assists business areas with creating test plans and coordinating User Acceptance Testing documents

16. Plans and executes initial requirements validation against delivered product prior to business area User Acceptance Testing

17. Contributes to an issues log and collaborates with appropriate teams to identify and mitigate risks

18. Facilitates new project request evaluation with functional and technical team leads

19. Creates standardized templates for internal IT and Business Analyst processes

Required Qualifications



Educational Requirements
Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution of higher education or equivalent combination of education and/or experience

Required Experience
Two (2) years previous experience in business, systems, and/or process analysis

Preferred Qualifications



Additional Preferred Qualifications
International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA-CCBA) certification
PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA)

Preferred Experience
IT Project Management experience
Agile Facilitation experience

Proposed Salary



Pay Grade: Exempt 10

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities



ABILITIES
Able to produce quality results when provided an objective, assignment, or project with minimal supervision
Able to make sound and timely decisions as appropriate, and use good judgement to determine which decisions should be escalated
Able to anticipate and identify problems and proactively develop appropriate solutions
Able to appropriately assess and communicate risks, benefits, and alternatives to audiences with varying technical skill levels
Able to maintain control over assignments, projects, and responsibilities
Able to facilitate meaningful, productive conversations with stakeholders
Able to adapt to changes in environment
Able to identify and extract non-essential steps or activities in a business process
Able to work independently and with team members to ensure business requirements and needs are met
Able to build a strong rapport with both the technical and functional teams
Able to handle multiple tasks or projects at one time meeting assigned deadlines

KNOWLEDGE
Proficient at business process modeling and selecting appropriate tools and techniques to achieve goals
Understanding high-level technical concepts and communicate concepts to technical and functional teams with varying technical skill levels

SKILLS
Excellent interpersonal, initiative, teamwork, problem solving, independent judgment, organization, communication (verbal and written), time management, project management, presentation, attention to detail and accuracy and analytical thinking skills
Proficient with computer applications and programs associated with the position (i.e., Microsoft Office suite)
Strong attention to detail and follow up skills
Strong customer service skills and phone and e-mail etiquette

Internal Job Profile Summary

Demonstrates a basic understanding of pension plans, pension reporting process, and benefit calculations. Performs basic research, analysis and audits of varying retirement processes. Develops basic understanding and execution of software operations and performs basic testing tasks. Develops basic knowledge and understanding of applicable laws, rules, program regulations, user documentation and reports. Under general supervision, develops basic understanding of pension plan administration internal software and demonstrates ability to execute basic processes and transactions
Under general supervision, develops basic understanding of pension plan administration externally used website, and demonstrates basic execution of member and employer web transactions

Knowledgeable of location, types of content, and purpose of plan and process documentation

Overview:
Support Now is an essential sub-department of Field Operations. We provide support to our corporate users and quick-service restaurants by making it easy for our Operators, Team Members, and Staff to get answers, solve problems and identify opportunities. We measure success by the speed, accuracy, and experience we provide. The services we offer include general business support, IT and operation support, systems and application support, networking support, and many other technologies that are utilized by our Franchisees. We also focus on continuous improvement, strategy and insights to make things better for today and where Chick-fil-A is headed tomorrow.

The lead analyst will be responsible for providing meaningful insights to the Support Now, Field Operations team through the collection and usage of Restaurant HELP analytics data comprised of multi-channel service desk (phone, app, online, etc.) and Chick Fil A data sources. This role will work to ensure data and analysis requirements are met by properly applying data concepts, including data structures, collection and cleansing, structured and unstructured data analysis and reporting. This role will require analytical rigor, judgment, and ability to present a comprehensive 'data story' to multiple audiences. In this role the Lead Analyst will work with substantial latitude for action and decision making in the area of data analytics and visualization. This is a professional role and will report to the HELP Analytics Sr. Team Leader.

Our Flexible Future model offers a healthy mix of working in person and virtually, strengthening key elements of the Chick-fil-A culture by fostering collaboration and community.
Responsibilities:
Performs ad-hoc, strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources, supporting HELP call center analytics.
Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect, cleanse, and standardize data in order to generate insights and addresses reporting needs.
Defines data requirements, gathers and validates information, using judgment and statistical tests.
Utilizes programming and analytical tools, including open source programs including Python, R and SAS, SQL, Oracle, or similar relational database tools to formulate models and/or extract insights.
Well versed in knowledge of creating algorithms, identifying patterns and insights from structured and unstructured data sets utilizing graphs, trees and/or other data representation techniques as required.
Identifies and troubleshoots data integration and integrity issues in cooperation with the appropriate business units, designs workflows and procedures.
Identifies opportunities to maximize data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance.
Responsible for designing, building, deploying and maintaining dashboards that empower teams to make data driven and insights informed decisions within their respective business units.
Develops ad-hoc analytics and reporting based on analysis of existing data sources, utilizing a variety of tools (e.g., SQL Workbench, Tableau, Alteryx).
The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of call center operations.
No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.

Preferred Qualifications:

Position Purpose:

The Sr. Web Business Analyst Specialty Channels leads the design and implementation of the Homedepot.com web analytics strategy. In this position, you will analyze web analytics data as well as other offline data to evaluate site performance (capacity, customer experience, fall out points, etc.). You will collaborate with various departments to design and execute a fact-based continuous improvement / channel growth strategy using online and offline data analysis. The Sr. Web Business Analyst works with the Web analysts to analyze online data using various analytical tools to uncover trends and provide insight that will maximize HomeDepot.com online marketing efforts, as well as overall business objectives. You will work with the Web analyst to research and analyze business trends and customer behavior data to identify opportunities for website enhancements and new internet marketing initiatives. You will analyze and understand the key drivers of performance related to Homedepot.com's online objectives. You will analyze and provide insight on the HomeDepot.com website(s) traffic and conversion. Finally, you will work with the Web analyst to provide weekly Web Analytic dashboards to Management and the supporting teams.

Job Title: Data & Compliance Analyst

Department: Compliance & Quality Improvement

Reports To: Director of Operations and Compliance & Quality Improvement

Classification: Non-Exempt

Salary: $50,000/year


PURPOSE: Under the supervision of the Director of Compliance and Quality Improvement and Operations, this position: provides analysis and reports on data contained in various information systems; works with staff to maintain accurate data entry; provides quality control checks for accuracy and completion of all required data entry; and provides support to all CHGA departments to meet all city, state and federal regulations, requirements and compliance while adhering to industry best practices, CHGA’s policies and procedures, and Covenant House International’s (CHI’s) unifying policies and data standards.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Covenant House Georgia reserves the right to unilaterally modify, remove, or add to any of the following: Data Responsibilities:

Manage all administrative tasks within our Efforts-to-Outcomes (ETO) database software, including adding users, changing permission levels, creating touchpoints/forms, running reports, and cleaning data entry.
Create “how-to” guides and video tutorials on ETO and Client Track (HMIS database).
Provide training and technical support to all staff on ETO and Client Track.
Ensure that data entry processes meet timelines and benchmarks for grant, program, and departmental compliance.
Collaborate with all staff to advance data entry efforts, systems, policies, and processes to improve overall data quality.
Perform statistical analysis to generate comparative reports that display historical data and trends for grant proposals, tracking, and monthly and quarterly meetings.
Maximize the potential of ETO software, by ensuring data quality, advancing data collection methods, building reports, and conducting internal audits and analyses.
Create visually appealing and compelling dashboards and reports that predict trends and show patterns by using qualitative and quantitative data.
Serve as the CHGA’s point-of-contact for ETO and Client Track and other relevant database systems; Disseminate information to all staff on updates to each software.
Organize, craft, and manage surveys for staff clients, and stakeholders; collect and analyze results in a presentable and understandable report.
Work with ETO administrators from all Covenant House sites to advance and diversify data collection methods and ideas, including monthly virtual meetings hosted by CHI.
Oversee data cleansing processes within ETO and Client Track software, collaborating closely with program leadership to uphold robust data integrity, rectify inaccuracies, support departmental requirements, and optimize operational efficiency.
Plan, coordinate, and execute small and large group training sessions on ETO, Client Track, and any other relevant database systems on a regular basis.
Produce the bi-monthly CQI and Operations board report, collaborating closely with program leadership to validate data accuracy and maintain consistency in their board reports.
Compile and assess data to generate CQI and Operations monthly departmental reports, which is presented to the Senior Leadership team at least monthly.
Serve as the ClientTrack Administrator for the organization and on the Atlanta HMIS Data Quality Committee.
Frequently revise and maintain the Data Integrity Plan to establish, communicate, and uphold data entry and quality requirements in alignment with regulatory standards.
Plan, organize, and manage the annual Point-in-Time count data entry on behalf of CHGA.
Work in partnership with CHI to ensure timely, quality data analysis and reporting.

Compliance Responsibilities:

Assist the Director of Compliance & Quality Improvement and Operations with preparation for all audits from funders, regulatory bodies, and/or accreditation entities, including the creation of any necessary checklists and procedures.
Prepare accurate spreadsheets and reports on incidents, identifying any important trends, concerns, or problems that need to be considered.
Conduct at least quarterly random case record audits and other internal quality audits of assigned programs.
Prepare reports of internal audit findings with the analysis of trends and recommendations for corrective and preventive actions.
Act as the Compliance Officer for specified departments, as delegated by the Director of CQI and Operations. Responsibilities include monitoring and mitigating risks, conducting monthly risk assessments, and ensuring adherence to both regulatory and organizational requirements.
Assist with the development of new policies and procedures related to grants, program, and departmental compliance, and make recommendations that affect existing policies, procedures, and best practices.
Oversee all facets of the Language Access Plan (LAP), which involves administering an annual staff survey and updating the plan every three years.
Develop, implement, and oversee comprehensive measures to safeguard Protected Health Information (PHI) of young adults within our internal databases, ensuring compliance with HIPAA and other relevant data protection regulations.
Serve as a member of both the CHGA Safety and Policy Workgroups.
Manage the process of generating and disseminating employee identification badges, including capturing staff photographs, printing badges, and programming the badge into the corresponding system.

Site Child Protection Officer:

Serve as the backup Site Child Protection Officer (SCPO).
Serve as the site Ombudsman.
Maintain adherence to CHI's unified child protection standards as outlined in the CPS manual.
Perform investigations involving both youth and staff members.
Ensure all incidents are recorded and accurately classified within ETO.
Participate and take notes for all Serious Incident Review Team (SIRT) meetings.
Attend monthly calls with CHI and Child Protection Officers at each site within the federation.

Additional Responsibilities:

Uphold CHGA’s standards of conduct, policies, and procedures and CHI’s unifying policies at all times.
Model appropriate, professional behavior to establish and maintain superior services to youth in a safe and inviting atmosphere.
Participate in other CHGA programs and activities as required.
Establish and maintain an effective working relationship with co-workers, supervisors, representatives of other agencies, and the public.
Effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, with both internal and external individuals and/or businesses.
Respond in a timely manner to emergencies and resolve issues.
Demonstrate the ability to:
ability to work independently and as a team player.
work a flexible schedule as needed.
work standing, walking, and/or sitting a minimum of 8 hours per day/shift.
drive agency or personal vehicles to transport items and persons (valid Georgia Driver’s License with acceptable driving record required).
travel as needed for training or to fulfill job requirements.
Maintain strict confidentiality when working with sensitive information.
Perform all other duties as assigned.


SUPERVISORY DUTIES: Not applicable.




EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s degree in information systems, social or health sciences, or a related field; two years’ experience in quality improvement, program evaluation, and/or administration or prior experience reviewing case records and analyzing and reporting quantitative and qualitative data is required; Proficiency in Google, Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Internet and Database Applications. Experience working with youth, in a residential program, child protection, and/or as an Ombudsman is preferred.

Job Summary

As a member of the Professional Services team, the Business Analyst (BA) is an external-facing, project-based role, focused on the elicitation of Customer User Stories, their documentation and analysis, and the declarative configuration of the solution that results from this documentation. Note that the BA is the owner of all User Stories for a given implementation, whether the story work is declarative or custom. The Business Analyst collaborates with the Project Manager, Solution Architect & Developer roles, to ensure adherence to contracted scope and budget, and to affirm their solution design and configurations have been optimized for their customer's requirements and business operations. The BA also drives data migration activities, including object mapping and data validation (post migration). Additionally, the BA works closely with their Project Manager, to groom their backlog and validate quality/accuracy of any deliverables. This role is further responsible for documenting a customer's full software configuration/solution, providing demonstrations of configurations/solutions, and for end-User training and supporting the effort through deployment and go live.

Responsibilities

Facilitate customer meetings, either virtually or in person as required by the Project.
Lead requirements elicitation and User Story documentation.
Execute software configurations in alignment with the documentation and contracted scope/budget.
Create a backlog of Stories, by project, for review and collaboration with the Project Manager.
Work with the Solution Architect and Developer roles to document solutions
Develop test scripts and acceptance criteria for the user stories
Prioritize and assign user stories to the development team
Perform configuration of our application, including Salesforce configuration
Validate all customization work and provide Customer-facing demonstrations.
Prepare and analyze data conversion requirements; identify data gaps.
Collaborate with data architects for data migration activities.
Lead User Acceptance Testing, deployment and validation activities.
Complete required project documentation (configuration documentation, User Stories, functional designs, deployment checklists, support documentation, etc.).
Directly and effectively train customer's personnel in the use of the system.
Clearly and effectively communicate with team and with customers regarding status, technical issues, enhancements, and creative solutions
Maintain target billable utilization while providing quality work

Requirements

Minimum 3 years of experience working as an admin/analyst in Salesforce.com environment with external clients/customers
Salesforce admin (ADM201) certification
Knowledge of all aspects of testing end-user products: Functional, Performance, Security, Usability, etc.
Excellent troubleshooting, analysis, and problem-solving skills
Ability to effectively prioritize and escalate issues as required
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; adept at presentation to customers and senior management
Experience with Project Management tools such as Jira/Confluence or similar tools
Solid experience with the Microsoft Office Suite and Products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Sharepoint, Teams, Visio)
Ability to work remotely without direct supervision.
Occasional travel may be necessary as required by the customer.

Preferred

Previous experience or knowledge of working on Fonteva product/application
Experience with other CRM/Association Management Systems
Working knowledge of Salesforce.com administration, configuration, customization, and third-party integration or other CRM environment
Prior consulting experience
Additional certifications such as (PAB, DEV 1)

The Position

CallRail is looking for a business intelligence analyst to generate business insights and use data to inform decision making. This role will report to the Business Intelligence manager and partner with stakeholders including marketing, product, sales, operations and finance teams.

To be a great fit for this role, you'll have an analytical mindset with a deep understanding of the role data plays for a business. You'll have advanced knowledge of business intelligence frameworks, tools and SQL. The successful candidate will capture and report on KPIs in a useful way and communicate these findings to all stakeholders.



What You'll Do
Design and implement analytical solutions that track key business metrics and provide actionable insights utilizing business intelligence tools such as Looker.
Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible format to inform weekly, monthly and quarterly business reporting.
Perform large-scale data analysis and develop solutions for trending, segmentation, classification, optimization, etc.
Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business requirements, perform deep dive analyses and communicate the findings to help understand the value of the data.
Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results to cross functional teams.
Suggest improvements in the tools and techniques to help optimize and scale the team.

General knowledge of database concepts and data flow processes between systems.
Understanding of business intelligence and data warehousing goals and principles.

Experience writing complex SQL queries.
Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills; ability to effectively communicate with business and technical teams, including an understanding of the impact that data visualization and aesthetics can have on communicating value of data.
Excellent organization skills and the ability to multitask while efficiently completing high quality work

3+ years of experience in business intelligence or analytics; Looker and advanced SQL preferred.
Experience with Looker, GitHub, DBT and Redshift
Familiar with Python, R, AI/ML and AWS Lambda

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.

The Data Contributor Services organization is a team of Operations Consultants responsible for the intake and quality of all data within the USIS business unit of Equifax while serving as the relationship manager and SME for data furnishers across various data domains. As a Data Operations Analyst in this organization the ideal candidate should be willing to build and manage relationships with data furnishers, oversee ingestion of billions of rows of data each month and serve as the primary point of contact for their assigned portfolio of furnishers. He/she will monitor, research, and respond to data furnisher activity including credit reporting submissions, questions/inquiries, audits, and data furnisher onboarding/off-boarding procedures. He/she should be able to analyze large datasets, demonstrate technology savvy, and be knowledgeable of the FCRA regulations and Metro 2 reporting guidelines. He/she will thrive in a challenging fast-paced environment and is looking for an opportunity to develop professionally and technically.

What you’ll do

Serve as relationship manager for data furnishers (financial institutions, payment processors, fintech startups, etc).

Responsible for the oversight of billions of rows of data that come from data furnishers (consumer and commercial tradeline data).

Monitor, research, and respond to data contributor activity including file update submissions, data reporting questions/inquiries, audits, and onboarding/off-boarding procedures.

Ability to analyze large datasets, be technology savvy, and be knowledgeable of the FCRA regulations and Metro 2 reporting guidelines.

Facilitate on-site visits and annual data reviews with data furnishers.

Recognized as SME in data processing/cleansing technology, data exchange rules, and data reporting regulatory guidance.

Provides consultation and support to customers, sales, and other teams.

Understand internal system changes, business rules, and overarching data governance.

Stay abreast of external regulatory and industry reporting changes.

Consult with clients and prepare understandable messaging for the data furnishers to articulate how changes may impact them.

Works with customers and programmers to implement custom solutions that deliver data to customers to drive impactful decisions. Drafts the requirements and QC's work performed by programmers to ensure changes affecting production are properly implemented.

What experience you need

Bachelor’s Degree or Higher in Business, Computer Science, or related field

4 - 5 years of experience handling Big Data

Project management and relationship management experience

Comfortable using MS office, Google Workspace (preferred) and Salesforce

Data analysis and querying skills using language like SQL

Drafting technical instructions for IT programming/ implementation. BI skills a plus

Sort and identify patterns/anomalies in large data sets

What could set you apart

Knowledge of FCRA regulations and Metro 2 credit reporting guidelines and requirements is preferred

Familiarity with cloud based data visualization tools i.e: Looker, Data studio etc., a plus

Knowledge of electronic file transmission (SFTP/FTP/Internet) protocols/procedures

We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, 401k matching, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.

Job Description
Interactive Government Holdings (IGH) is seeking qualified, trained and capable individual to perform Data Analyst II / Future Operations Duties in support of the Georgia Army National Guard Recruiting and Retention Battalion. The Data Analyst II (Recruiting, Retention, and Attrition) evaluates trends in recruiting in order to establish new and effective means of hitting the target market. The data analyst is responsible for keeping the recruiters in R&R Command advised of current recruiting numbers, market trends, and possible weaknesses in order to increase current market share for the GAARNG.

Major responsibilities include (not all inclusive):

Provide Recruiting and Retention Command and Staff with current/historical custom recruiting reports and data trends as requested.

Provide Company Command teams current/historical custom recruiting reports data and data trends as requested.

Sort, download, and consolidate all accession spreadsheets into one report.

Consolidate IST/ISR additions and Data Warehouse accessions.

Provide “Block Mission” accession data.

Provide accession data for Battalion, Company, Section, and RRNCO levels.

Daily status board update: Utilizes daily accession data, convert to briefing slides, and post hard copies to the command status board.

MOS bonus list reports: Sort G-1’s raw bonus vacancies spreadsheet report into two specific reports, the commanders report (includes 100%+ fill, FWD/REAR report dets); GAARNG bonus section’s report (deletes 100%+, FWD/REAR dets).

Battalion Briefings Coordination.

Plans and schedules ongoing meetings as required for Commanders and Staff.

Recommend adjustments and transmits WARNORD for Battalion level briefings to accommodate resources and decision made at the higher level.

Conduct a wide range of activities related to staff work such as tracking progress of FRAGORD deadlines. Generates accession slides.

Perform scribe functions during the Battalion level briefings.

Weekly significant event reports:

Identify and provides the Battalion Commander, Executive Officer and Command Sergeant Major significant reports on Monday mornings that lists events pertaining to R&R and GAARNG for the next 7 days in detail, and then extensive information for the next two quarters.

Prepare reports that also include scheduled VTCs, meetings, MEPS schedule, Company drills, and mobilization readiness IPRs for Senior Leadership within the Battalion.

VTC coordination:

Coordinate and verifies rooms (IP address/bridge) with NGB video operations.

Ensure VTC location is reserved and equipment is operational.

Conduct communications check prior to VTC.

NGB DPRO reports: Provide technical knowledge to Battalion S3 and downloads, organize, consolidate, and archive Director’s Personnel Readiness Overview data which results in the independent compilation of data relevant to R&R program areas.

Generate R&R spreadsheets for annual ACoE submissions, to include training pipeline losses, accessions, end strength, and reenlistment to the Battalion S3 for distribution to higher.

Track, monitor, and update R&R’s E-mail distribution lists.

Update R&R maps.

Qualifications:

Individual must have a valid Secret security clearance (or higher) or be able to obtain one.

Extensive knowledge of the GAARNG Recruiting and Retention Mission is required.

Experience as an Army National Guard Recruiter is required.

Good presentation, written, and oral skills are required.

Applicant must have experience using Microsoft Excel and other data compiling platforms. Applicants must be able to present data in many different forms, such as tables and graphs.

Normal work week, normal office work hours. Occasional travel for training and/or conferences.

This position is contingent upon award of a contract.
