Description

PossibleNOW has an immediate opening for a junior to intermediate Business Analyst to join our Product team with good technical skills, particularly as it relates to developing software requirements.

This role will grow into a Product Manager role. So, prior experience on product teams developing user features, stories, including all of the technical artifacts that drive the product roadmap is a plus, but not required.

As a part of the product team, this person will have the opportunity to work across all departments including sales, marketing, professional services, and customer support

Outstanding documentation skills be key for building user guides, training materials, release notes, test cases, and presentations for both internal and external audiences.

Responsibilities

Developing detailed requirements in support of new product initiatives will be job one. Candidate must be able to operate sufficiently at a level of technical depth that allows for specifications that are “developer ready.”

These stories will primarily be focused on API and Web Application development. Prior experience working with APIs is a plus, but is not required, so long as the required technical aptitude is present, and the candidate has a willingness to learn.

Working closely with product team members to build a roadmap that increases the gap between PossibleNOW and competing offerings, designing training materials that can be used internally and externally for new releases and customer education will be a primary responsibility.

Any prior experience working on SaaS product teams in the Campaign Management, Consent and Preference Management, Journey Orchestration, Customer Data Platforms, and other marketing technology and fulfillment tools will be a big plus, but not a requirement.

Job Duties

Product owner for one or more software platforms.
Develop technical requirements in the form of complete user features and stories.
Must be able to work from start to finish on large initiatives.
Communicate the value, and educate on the use of, new product offerings to all parties involved with sales, implementation and support.
Play key role in UAT testing and validation of new products ensuring adherence to promised, expected functionality.

Must Have

Exceptional written and oral communications; to include designing and creating visual presentations using tools like MS Word, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.
Technical acumen, technical writing, and willingness to learn new technologies.
For candidates with prior industry experience, a stable job history will be very important.

Nice to Have

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or related field is highly desired. Relevant industry experience (3 plus years) acceptable in lieu of.
Demonstrable experience working with customers in all areas ranging from pre-sales to ongoing support.
Experience with APIs, Data Platforms, Integration Tools would be huge plus.
Cloud familiarity (Azure, AWS, Google) is a plus.
Experience planning and driving training curriculums.

About PossibleNOW

Founded in 2000 and headquartered in Duluth, GA, PossibleNOW is a successful, growing, family oriented, and private held company that is the industry leader for direct marketing compliance, consent, and preference management solutions via our SaaS technology and professional services offering. PossibleNOW solutions serve many Fortune 500 companies and thousands of the largest direct marketers in the world.

Compensation/Company Benefits

We offer a competitive base salary with opportunity to earn commission, plus benefits package, including paid holidays, paid vacation, medical/dental insurance, and a 401(k) plan.

To apply, please send your resume to: joinus@possiblenow.com

The Customer Master Data Analyst will be the subject matter expert and is responsible for maintaining the integrity of the customer databases in MDM, SAP and related systems. This individual will oversee various processes that feed data to and from designated vendors that will manage the daily data management. Much of the requirements for this role will be to ensure any changes or requested changes that are made to the data structure or systems will be reviewed thoroughly to understand full impact of downstream processes and systems. In turn this individual will be responsible for alerting management and other downstream stakeholders to potential issues prior to them occurring and providing solutions to help reduce any impacts that may be experienced by the business or customers. Assist in design, set-up and maintenance of customers and customer relationships in MDM and SAP ERP. Inaccuracies directly affect ability to pay the right customers the right amount of money. These issues will also affect the ability to pay our sales forces accurately for their incentive compensation. Total cost impact for both is over $500M. There are 5 species each with a different market model. They total over $2B in revenue an cover more than 30k customers in both direct and indirect customer master data management. The complexities of understanding how customers will need to be set up to meet business needs will be critical. This role will need to think outside of a template or data entry and think more holistically. Anticipation of impacts will be critical as there are overlaps of customers across businesses and each business is managed very differently. There are indirect, direct and varying combinations of both that will need to be reviewed when managing our customer master.As an employee of Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery, development and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage lie with our people. We support our employees in a number of ways to foster a healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion, mobility, networking and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees.

*Duties & Responsibilities
*

Internal Control & Audit / INTEGRITY, DELIVERY & PROTECT

Ensures adherence to risk control checklists, provides coordination and assistance for audits as they are performed.
Lead testing as needed.
Support process audit activities as defined by supervisor.
Be a role model for the department when adhering to guidelines and compliance principles.
Maintains customer data files, both electronic and hard copy, and comply with corporate retention guidelines.
Collaborate with fellow Customer Experience teams to ensure that Master Customer Data is up to date and accurate.
Ensures that all processes are accurate and up to date, including but not limited to alerting manager to any potential gaps or lack of processes that could lead to data quality issues.

CUSTOMER SUPPORT

Coaches fellow team members tasked with resolving customer issues and ad-hoc inquiries.
Develops documentation used to train and coach teammates on processes and issue resolution.
Follow approved processes and execute day-to-day activities accurately and efficiently.
Build business relationships to pro-actively identify potential issues that may impact customers before issues are identified by customers, improves technical expertise, and utilizes available resources in a rapidly-changing business and systems environment.
Responsible to ensure customer based touch points undergoes constant improvement measures.
Analyzes data and KPIs to proactively identify potential issues and leverages data to make recommendations to AD on process changes
Act as the subject matter expert for the Master Data Management team partnering with CX Support team to facilitate responses to various customer inquiries.
Direct Processes with distributors and external vendors to validate new reporting partners (including but not limited to historical data loads, product cross-references and sales invoice transactions reported by them).

COMMUNICATION

Communicates effectively with team members, management, high-profile customers and business stakeholders.
Leads through experience and knowledge of tools, systems, and internal solutions resources with team members to improve communication channel effectiveness to exceed customer expectations.
Understand dynamic customer challenges and identify effective solutions to pro-actively address customer concerns.
Direct team members to appropriate support resource for issue resolution to enable timely solution to customer challenges.
Provides guidance to AD on existing processes and ensures supporting documentation is kept current, readily available and leveraged in the day-to-day activities of the team members or for potential audit.
Professionally communicate and collaborate with fellow CX team members, internal business partners, sales managers, external data vendors and distributor channel partners as it relates to sensitive customer data.
Develop and maintain good working relationship with external business partners to support our mutual customers and facilitate issue resolution as needed.

*Additional Duties & Responsibilities
*

PROJECT SUPPORT

Lead projects and encourage team member contribution that effectively supports task enhancement of varied size and complexity to achieve overall objectives.
Delivers assignments on time, with quality, across multiple priorities.
Promote agility mindset to ensure that project progresses effectively. Lead testing initiative and ensure quality assurances are met, and verify information or data is accurate and due diligence is achieved.
Participate as a lead on strategic projects or sub-teams as needed to execute objectives.
Demonstrate core process knowledge to perform data verification and cross-checking activities to ensure high-quality data is leveraged for transactional processing validation activities.
Recommend process improvements, system enhancements and bug fixes to gain efficiencies. Launch new system functionality release cycles with IT, GBS and other groups as appropriate.
Provide and maintain process and system documentation to include integration with other systems.

LEADERSHIP:

Initiate projects to forensically investigate root causes of poor data quality, lead solution. implementation and provide status updates of progress to team members, management and business stakeholders.
Develop ad hoc reporting to evaluate potential process improvement opportunities and establish new ways of working to promote operational efficiencies.
Provide direction and guidance that will lead to improved operating efficiencies and enhanced user experience.
Provides guidance for team members/vendor partners to investigate potential enhancements to provide higher quality reporting deliverables.
Regularly audit vendor data to ensure compliance to processes and report any deviations identified to managment
Designs sophisticated queries, builds technically advanced reports, and influencing the design scope for automated reports.
Influence stakeholders and business partners to support vision and solutions.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution or equivalent work experience required.
Five-plus (5+) years of progressive experience in IT, Marketing, Administrative, Finance, Customer Service and/or relevant business experience.
Knowledge of one of the following is required: SQL, Advanced Excel skills, Alteryx or Python
Knowledge / work experience with ERP environments and Master Data Management including SAP.
Excellent computer skills (Microsoft office suite).
Strong knowledge of the Order to Cash Cycle.
Develop and maintain key relationships across the respective species sales and marketing teams.
Learn and build a strong operational knowledge of BI's systems, which include Master Data Management, Veeva CRM, Cognos, and CompMax.
Advanced ability to make quick decisions and prioritize for self and junior team members.
Strong communications skills.
Ability to lead without authority.

Expert analytical skills with very high capacity to translate data to the needs of the respective stakeholder
Ability to identify potential issues before they arise.
Process oriented individual with strong problem solving skills.
Ability to present to multiple stakeholder types.
Ability to convert tech speak into business speak.

Strong ability to think strategically.
SME for MDM.

Our technology organization is transforming how we work at WestRock. We align with our businesses to deliver innovative solutions that:


Address specific business challenges, integrate processes, and create great experiences
Connect our work to shared goals that propel WestRock forward in the Digital Age
Imagine how technology can advance the way we work by using disruptive technology

The Opportunity
WestRock has embarked on the One WestRock Business Systems Transformation initiative, a multi-year program aligned to our Path to One goals to become the world’s best paper and packaging company by 2025. The IT Business Analyst – Data Refinery position is a part of our IT and Digital Business Systems Transformation technology team responsible for the overall technology Data Refinery workstream.
This role will serve as a trusted partner, advisor and thought leader on the future state technology landscape (ERP and legacy systems environment), and systems implementation.

The IT Business Analyst will play an important role as a member of the WestRock IT Data Refinery and Harmonization team supporting and collaborating with the business and other Project teams, to ensure overall Data Quality, Standardization and Governance. The IT Business Analyst’s job will focus on solution-level decisions and analysis of their impact on the overall business goals and outcomes. The IT Business Analyst serves as the subject matter expert supporting multiple disciplines of Corrugated Applications, solutions design, implementations and Support.


This Role is a primary contributor to the Mach One – SAP implementation.
You will be working on a team of peers that will be responsible for the quality of data for the conversion process as we move to a new ERP system.
You will also participate in the design and implementation of an interim and ongoing data governance process.
This Role will also have impact on new process design and development as needed to support the Data Quality and Governance approach
This Role will work directly with Business Leadership and locations to ensure that Data Quality activities are being followed and executed.
Daily activities include ongoing communications with all locations, updates and progress reports.
Identifying Data Quality issues, designing and executing harmonization and cleansing plans.

How you will impact WestRock:
Participation with several other workstreams to ensure Data Quality and Governance aspects are represented
Partner with Business Leadership on Data Quality and Governance Vision
Plan and execute working sessions with Business and IT partners as needed
Develop end to end harmonization execution plans
Propose Scope of most impactful data elements to govern in legacy systems throughout interim state
Propose interim Governance Controls in specific legacy systems.
Assist with testing and implementation of new or enhanced versions of software
Develop detailed documentation/training material and provide training to end-users

What you need to succeed:
5+ years of solid hands-on experience in Corrugated or related industry or in a business analyst role
Understanding of current Legacy data - preferred
Able to navigate within legacy systems - preferred
Understanding of Industry segment processes and procedures - preferred
Proficient with Excel and pivots
Able to work independently to identify, develop and execute plans
Display ability to lead meetings and activities. Kaizen, Steering teams, Training sessions.
Ability to recognize, develop and present opportunities to leadership
Self-motivated, independent individual that promotes teamwork.
Demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills to build and develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to effectively address issues in collaboration with others as appropriate; ability to proactively anticipate problems and opportunities and confidence to use initiative to pursue solutions.
Ability to manage multiple priorities efficiently and effectively.
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work and collaborate with employees at all levels
What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability and excellence
Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities
An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies and potential
A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.

You must have a passion for data quality, working with large data sets, and experience in managing data quality standard processes.
Responsibilities:
This person will oversee all activities required to support the data quality requirements in the company:
Perform statistical tests on large datasets to determine data quality and integrity.
Utilize various scripting languages (i.e., SQL) to perform data cleaning, data analysis, and data quality control.
Participate in the design process where appropriate to ensure data quality deliveries.
Collaborate with database developers and data engineers to improve data collection and storage processes.
Assist in defining new and refining existing processes and procedures.
Reporting data analysis findings to management to inform business decisions and prioritize information system needs.
Document processes and maintaining data records.

At least 3 years of experience in data analysis, data engineering or related roles.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and other programming languages.
Experience with data modeling, ETL, data warehousing, and data lake architectures.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of data quality, governance, and security principles.
Excellent communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
Competencies:

Collaborate with Business Analysts, Engineering and Sales teams to resolve data integrity issues and ensure business intelligence are viable and consistent.
Conduct regular reviews of critical data master information and audit reliability and accuracy.
Create and execute automated verification scripts.
Communicate complex data in simple, actionable ways.
Utilization of analytical and problem-solving tools.

Job Title Data Analyst (NCIPC/DVP)




Job Summary

As affiliates of the PCI Federal Services group of companies, PCI Government Services LLC has a passion for our team members and their personal mission for success. We offer excellent insurance, leave and developmental benefits along with some flexibility for remote work opportunities. Come join our organization and be part of an exciting team supporting our Federal, DoD and Private Sector customers!




Job Classification

This position is classified as exempt.

Duties and Responsibilities

The Data Analyst will play a key role in supporting the Data and Vital Statistics Team of the Division of Violence Prevention (DVP) by responding to internal data requests, conducting verification analyses for scientific manuscripts, assisting with SAS-related tasks, and participating in the documentation of National Violent Death Reporting System (NVDRS) data management and quality assurance processes. This position is instrumental in ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data used in the division's critical research and scientific activities.

Duties:

Respond to internal data requests, primarily initiated by the Team Lead or on behalf of Science Officers. This may include fulfilling data requests for Senior Leadership and other stakeholders within the division.
Conduct verification analyses for scientific manuscripts, ensuring the validity and reliability of data used in research and publications.
Provide support and assistance related to SAS (Statistical Analysis System) for Science Officers, aiding them in data analysis and processing.
Help prepare customized NVDRS Restricted Access Database (RAD) datasets, making certain that data is appropriately tailored for specific research needs and access requirements.
Participate in documenting NVDRS data management and quality assurance processes, contributing to the maintenance of data integrity and adherence to best practices.
Job Requirements

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as statistics, data science, or public health.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in data analysis, including data collection, cleaning, and statistical analysis, preferably in a relevant field or industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, with a strong preference for experience with SAS.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to data accuracy and quality.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks.

Physical Requirements

The physical demands described herein are representative of those which may need to be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Employees must possess the ability to work in an office environment.

If required, employees must be able to operate a motor vehicle which may require sitting for prolonged periods of time to visit other company sites. Must have hearing and speech to communicate in person, before groups and over the telephone. Standing in work areas and walking between work areas may be required. This position may require an employee to bend, stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, climb or balance, reach, push, and pull. The employee may also be required to lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.

PCI Government Services LLC (PCI-GS) is an equal opportunity employer.

PCI-GS does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, national origin, religion, marital status, sexual orientation or identity, Veterans or Disability status.




Preference may be extended to qualified Native American Indian candidates

in accordance with applicable federal law.

Job Description:
Together we fight for everyone’s opportunity for a better financial future.
We will do this together — with customers, partners and colleagues. We will fight for others, not against: We will stand up for and champion everyone’s access to opportunities. Get to Know the Opportunity
Seeking highly motivated self-starter for an expanding team focused on investment pricing/valuation. Success in this role requires a strong analytical mindset and high attention to detail. You will have a visible impact on the investment data of the firm and is an integral part of Voya Investment Management’s data governance.
The Contributions You Will Make
Analyze and provide recommendations to improve on the processes and procedures for ensuring accurate, daily mark-to-market of customer and company positions
Review current processes and pro-actively make changes or propose initiatives to improve efficiencies in order to provide more effective pricing & valuation support to the business
Evaluate processes for gaps in quality controls and build controls to ensure accuracy
Communicate and work with external pricing vendors to challenge prices and understand pricing methodology
Research and review price movements and variances, considering root cause of whether fluctuation is appropriate. Additionally, review prices that remain stale
Monitor halted/suspended securities, notifying appropriate teams, when necessary
Ensure process reviews and supervision of process and outputs are conducted in accordance with valuation policies
Assist in preparing and presenting key valuation metrics to the valuation committee in a clear and concise manner on a recurring basis
Value and price private illiquid assets such as Commercial Mortgage Loans and Private Credit
Complete other projects as assigned to support ongoing business and readiness for new investment mandates
Approach recurring processes and project-based work with a control mindset
Build and maintain quality controls around key valuation processes and data points
Coordinate with additional teams, including Risk and Compliance, on proper procedures
Minimum Knowledge and Experience
Atlanta, Georgia is the preferred location for this role. Highly qualified candidates who are located in the New York City area and can come to a midtown Manhattan office on a hybrid basis may also be considered
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting or related field
Strong understanding of discounted cash flows associated with valuation of fixed income securities
3-7 years of investment industry experience
Minimum 2-4 years in investment valuation/pricing role
Understanding of nuanced asset types, including: Bank Loans, Commercial Mortgage Loans, Derivatives
Ability to communicate and interact directly with senior investment personnel in a manner that clearly articulates solutions and conveys confidence
Advanced proficiency in Excel; experience with SQL and VBA a strong plus
Familiarity with investment technology platforms and systems. Exposure to BlackRock Solutions Aladdin® and Bloomberg is a plus
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment under strict deadlines (e.g., month-end, & quarter-end)
Ability to independently and creatively resolve problems utilizing appropriate resources
Ability to keep pace with a rapidly changing business environment
Ability to juggle multiple priorities to support key stakeholders
Strong accountability and focus on execution
High levels of ethics, values, and integrity
Preferred Knowledge and Experience
Progress toward CFA Charter, MBA or Master’s in quantitative discipline desired

About Us

This team member will report to and work alongside the Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst in addition to other senior managers to effectively design, develop, test, deploy, and monitor standardized and ad hoc reports, dashboards, or data requests using the tools available within the company information systems and platforms. This position is a great opportunity for a self-starter with an interest in analytics to gain invaluable experience by learning and contributing to the structure, implementation & maintenance of a scalable data-driven analytic workflow within a growing company.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and develop innovative solutions that align with business objectives.
Develop a deep understanding of the existing KPIs for various departments and divisions and the data sources they are derived from.
Adhere to a cadence of routine checks on scheduled reports and dashboards to ensure all reporting mediums are running smoothly.
Assist other departments as needed with report or data-related projects and initiatives
Monitor, maintain, and refine data processes to support current and future company initiatives.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of security policies and procedure related to company information.
Assist in the clean-up, entry, and maintenance of both historical and current data across all information systems to ensure company information is up to date and accurate.
Provide support and backup as needed by serving as POC for data integration, analytic, and report related issues
Ensure data accuracy and reliability by conducting thorough data validation and contextualization.
Contribute to the design and ongoing development of our BI & reporting platforms, ensuring optimal performance, security, and usability.
Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences using professional verbal and written communication skills.
Assist with vetting and implementing integration opportunities among the company’s portfolio of data sources and applications.

Skills/ Qualifications

Bachelors Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Marketing, Computer Science or related field
Self-starter with a general knowledge of analytics and/or Business Intelligence tools (i.e. Tableau, Domo, PowerBI)
Intermediate experience in MS Office Products (Excel, Word, Power Point, Forms, Word etc). Heavy Emphasis on Excel
Working knowledge of financial terms and principles.
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Basic familiarity of SQL
Strong planning, organizational, and time management skills to accommodate working on multiple projects at once
Passion for continuously learning new technologies and developing own knowledge and expertise
Data-driven approach towards solving complex problems

Description:

BUSINESS ANALYST

Alexander Group: Decades of experience growing revenue for global companies

Alexander Group provides management consulting services to the world’s leading organizations. When clients need to grow revenue, they look to Alexander Group for data-driven insights, actionable recommendations, and most importantly, results.

Founded in 1985, we’ve served more than 3,000 companies around the world, across all industries. This experience gives us not only a highly sophisticated set of best practices to grow revenue — we also have a rich repository of industry data that informs all of our recommendations.

Our dedication to revenue growth and sales strategy has led to:

More than 70% of our clients being Fortune 500 corporations
Project work in more than 25 countries
Extensive industry experience in B2B markets

The Business Analyst works closely with an assigned Project Manager and becomes a fully integrated project team member in their first months of employment. The combination of on-the-job learning, classroom training and on-going coaching and mentoring enable Business Analysts to enjoy outstanding professional growth and career opportunities. The firm’s culture, built on teamwork and meritocracy, empowers our professionals to support each other in their career development.

The Business Analyst career track includes promotion to Associate Consultant to Management Consultant and beyond for individuals looking to develop a rewarding, long-term career in consulting with Alexander Group.

Responsibilities:

Apply logic and Alexander Group methodologies to provide recommendations to clients
Use and develop communication skills to communicate project findings, conclusions and recommendations with your peers and clients
Prepare initial drafts of high quality, error free deliverables
Participate in client meetings to review and present analytical approaches and interpret results

Positive attitude and strong willingness to learn from mentors and peers
Ability to travel (sometimes on short notice)

About Masco Support Services:

Masco Support Services, a division of Masco Corporation, is a dynamic team dedicated to exceeding our customer’s expectations. We are a group of customer centric organizations providing practical analytics, relevant customer insights, and targeted project execution. Supporting multiple retailers, we fully use our shared resources and processes to provide our Masco family of brands value driven customer support and coordinated service solutions.

Workplace and Culture:

Diversity is a core value of Masco Support Services culture. Our organization provides a competitive compensation and benefits package, along with professional career growth opportunities.

We believe a workplace that encourages different voices, perspectives, and backgrounds creates better teams and better solutions. We are committed to addressing the barriers and biases that affect people’s ability to fully access opportunities and bring their whole selves to work. We embrace diversity and recognize the importance of evolving our employees professional career development.

Work Responsibilities:

As the Sales Analyst, you will:

Assist internal and external customers with account management, including line reviews, sales performance, metrics, promotion, and inventory recommendations.

Work independently or with a cross-functional team to mine, collate, and analyze data to drive business decisions.

Act as the main point of contact between various departments within our retail and business unit partners.

Build and present in-depth monthly/quarterly business reviews for various partners.

Identify process improvement opportunities to better meet the needs of our customers.

Prepare action-oriented reporting to drive sales, identify opportunities and sales trends, and make recommendations for action based on analysis.

Provide first level support to business clients when issues arise.

Compile information, develop correlations on historical data, run regression analysis, and can measure impact on key KPIs across various business channels.

Prepare summaries of relevant data for distribution to appropriate end users.

Manipulate data in a fast-paced environment to gather quick insights, visualize the data, and generate interactive reports and dashboards for the team.

Develop a strong statistical background and keen analytical mind to provide insights from large and varied omni channel data sets to understand the impact on sales.

Prioritize effectively and work independently as well as be a strong team player.

Develop knowledge in business situations and company policies and procedures to advance in your career.

Diverse Skills and Experience That You Will Bring to the Role:

Bachelor’s degree with a concentration in a business-related field preferred.

1-3 years’ experience working in a data or analytics-based role required. Experience in supply chain or forecasting a plus.

Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, including skills with reporting software and business intelligence (Power BI, Tableau, Advanced Excel).

Ability to blend data from multiple data sources and build data visualizations from raw data.

Experience creating visuals, understanding what the data is telling and gleaning actionable insights, story-telling and presenting data to multiple levels of the organization.

Experience with retail metrics, math and/or predictive analytics is a plus.

Ability to build and foster strong customer relationships.

Excellent written and oral communication skills.

Strong attention to detail.

What We Offer:

Competitive salary plus bonus-earning potential
Paid Time-Off
Monthly cell phone allowance
Company laptop
Healthcare benefits such as medical, dental, and vision
401K saving plan with company match
Tuition assistance program
Profit Sharing

We are looking for active learners and people who care about taking advantage of the opportunities provided. We encourage you to apply even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements for this position.

After you have applied to our current posting, we will review your resume. If your resume is a match for our current opening, we will contact you to request an interview.

Job Title: Data Analyst IV (Healthcare Analytics) - Project Management / Lean Six Sigma
Job Description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.


Position Purpose: Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.

Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.
Lead the planning and execution of large-scale projects and new reporting tools, translating business goals into actionable solutions
Identify and resolve data, process, and technical issues and communicate root-cause with stakeholders as appropriate
Partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with business leaders to understand market-specific levers and constraints
Leverage enterprise reporting tools to rapidly deliver data-driven insights and recommendations
Research key business problems and proactively identify opportunities for cost and utilization improvements through quantitative analysis
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required
Mentor junior analysts on analytic best practices and business need fulfilment. Delegate tasks to junior analysts, providing guidance and validation where required
Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. Master's degree preferred. 5+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management or 3+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Experience with table creation and indexing, query optimization, and utilization of stored procedures. Working knowledge of SQL/querying languages. Experience with table creation and indexing, query optimization, and utilization of stored procedures. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools including Microsoft PowerBI

Provider: Experience in provider contracting, claims pricing, financial reporting/analysis, data modeling, statistical modeling, data science, or geospatial/reimbursement analysis preferred

Regional and HBR Analytics: Experience in emerging trend analysis, financial modeling, claims pricing, contract/network analysis, and/or ROI evaluation preferred. Familiarity with claims payment, utilization management, provider/vendor contracts, risk adjustment for government sponsored healthcare desired.

Clinical: Experience in public health (epidemiology, biostatistics), population health, social determinants of health, data science, social science, or geospatial/ROI/financial analysis preferred

Finance: Experience in Finance, Actuarial Science, or Accounting preferred. Experience using analytic techniques & tools to explore financial performance trends and/or reconciling financial data preferred.

Fraud, Waste & Abuse: Experience in fraud/waste/abuse identification and investigation, provider billing, or clinical coding preferred; Experience with data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence, or statistical modeling preferred

Risk Adjustment: Experience in risk adjustment, clinical coding, financial reporting/analysis, or CMS/State encounters and regulatory file submissions preferred; Experience with data mining, population health, and statistical modeling preferred

Quality: Experience with HEDIS, NCQA, Medicare Star Rating System, QRS, or other quality measures preferred; Quality auditing or analysis of call center performance preferred; Experience with data mining, population health, and statistical modeling preferred

Tools & Technology: Experience with report/dashboard development, data/report automation, self-service capabilities, data design and integration, or data quality and governance preferred


Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Job Title: Technical Data Analyst, CRM & Customer Analytics
Job Description:
We are looking for a Technical Data Analyst for our Cloud Datawarehouse which is built on data sourced from multiple Brands, data sources, and domains. In this role, the candidate, while collaborating with various stakeholders, will be responsible for ensuring that the data is meaningfully presented at the consumption layer of the warehouse. The candidate will be expected to be proficient in SQL with experience of working in technology platforms like Snowflake, Databricks, and SQL Server. She/he will be able to profile, analyze, and share results across the team. While the candidate will work closely with the Data Engineering team and the Product Owner, will also be collaborating with Data Governance professionals, Solution Architects, and QA. The Data Analyst will have well-rounded concepts of Data Quality and be able to create DQ rules for suggested implementation based on source system data analysis. The candidate will also be working with Data Catalog specialists to provide definitions, transformation rules, and business terms for updating the Enterprise Data Catalog.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Profile new data sources, primarily through SQL and open-source tools; Derive insights and share with the team
Identify edge use cases, data anomalies, and outliers as an outcome of Data Profiling activity
Capture definitions for all data elements being sourced and document them; Capture the grain of the data and work with Data Modelers to pass on the information
Create Source to Target Mapping across multiple layers of data propagation: source to canonical layer to semantic layer
Suggest DQ rules for implementation based on data analysis/data profiling performed
Support User Acceptance Testing before releases
Liaise with Product Owner for deployment co-ordination, business signoffs, and release notifications
Update the data dictionary in the Enterprise Data Catalog
Create and maintain business lineage maps in the Enterprise Data Catalog tool by working with the Data Catalog specialist
Co-ordinate with multiple cross-functional teams and have good inter-personnel skills


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum 4-year degree in computer science, data science, information science or related field, or equivalent work
Minimum 8 Years of Data Analytics experience
2-3 years of experience working in a data warehouse environment would be required. The candidate must have technical skills as contrasted from a Business Analyst with only requirement gathering experience.


REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, or ABILITIES

Experience working in a data warehouse environment along with experience in creating data mapping specification documents is needed
Understanding of Data Quality concepts- data profiling, data cleansing
Ability to propose DQ rules based on Data Profiling results
Ability to identify edge use cases, data anomalies, outliers
Should understand relational concepts in slowly changing dimensions in the context of Data Modelling
Good SQL skills required- the ability to articulate how real-time data scenarios can be analyzed with SQL
Skills in handling data from various sources in Excel, Access, and Word editors
Knowledge of working with and analyzing CRM data, Customer Data, Loyalty Programs, and 3rd party data enrichment processes is a big plus
Good communication and collaboration skills; Ability to work with multiple stakeholders in a dynamic large program
Experience in using a DQ tool is a plus

Title and Summary
Lead, Technology Risk Analyst (Data Management)
Overview

Monitors technology risk and compliance, and develops, delivers, maintains and monitors IT policies, standards, and best practices
Participates in demonstrating compliance and the implementation of design (up-to-date standard operating procedures) and operational (testing the validity of procedures periodically) effectiveness of required technology controls and associated evidence of compliance.
Manages an evidence repository and related policies and procedures enabling technology risk management to efficiently demonstrate Mastercard compliance with multiple stakeholder obligations.

Responsibilities

Implements policies and procedures to minimize exposure and drive the proper controls
Supports the management and facilitation of governance committees
Provides data analysis and strategy execution across risk areas, leveraging an understanding of risk and regulation
Supports the enterprise by enabling controls to be assessed once, with the resulting evidence applying multiple times.
Supports cross-functional initiatives to deliver on risk goals, policies and procedures
Develops and manages risk processes, especially collecting and reusing as appropriate evidence of compliance, including identifying and implementing best practices and ensuring all processes are documented, reviewed and updated regularly.
Identifies and manages the institutional knowledge of technology controls within Mastercard and constantly improves the efficient usage of that knowledge to demonstrate necessary compliance.
Design and implement policies and procedures to drive efficiencies across the TRM organization while relieving burden on Mastercard Technology subject matter experts.
Design and implement policies and procedures to improve the methodology for demonstrating Mastercard’s compliance with stakeholder obligations.
Work closely with colleagues across TRM to understand their needs to demonstrate evidence-based compliance while promoting a risk-based security environment.
Understand the role cyber and information security frameworks and standards play in enabling Mastercard to demonstrate its culture of security.
Deliver presentations and supporting messaging to senior leadership
Understand and support the Corporate Security risk strategies that maintain the status of industry compliance standards (e.g., PCI, ISO, CRI Profile and others) for applications that process, store or transfer credit card information and the enterprise infrastructure where they reside
Understand and support the Technology risk strategies that maintain the status of payment, financial and industry data standards accessible to Mastercard’s third parties according to Mastercard Technology Policies and Standards, performing critical vendor reviews and Mastercard subsidiary reviews globally
Understand and support the Technology risk strategies that maintain the necessary focus and quality of the due diligence and control validation functions within risk management
Understand and support the Technology risk strategies that maintain the status of the Stakeholder Assurance function that provides interface controls and expertise for responding to customer requests, RFP support and customer audit support

Experiences/Knowledge/Traits

Experience with compliance requirements, particularly technology/information security environments
Experience with Data Management and Utilization
Experience collaborating cross-functionally to identify and implement best practice risk processes and efficient evidence of compliance collection and distribution.
Enjoys learning
Works well as part of a team and willing to contribute for the benefit of all involved.
Willing to consider multiple points of view and work to find consensus.
Experience delivering presentations and supporting messaging with senior leadership
Experience advocating for improvement in policy and procedure when necessary
Ability and initiative to identify areas of improvement and drive constant improvement in themselves and others.
Advanced knowledge and demonstrated expertise in the areas of strategy, planning and project management.
5 to 8 years of experience with structured methodology and project planning tools.
Knowledge of Mastercard and the payments industry preferred.

Job Title: Pricing Analyst and Master Data Management
Job Description:
We are looking for Pricing Analyst & Master Data Management to join our team at Innomotics – A Siemens Business.

Your change engine.

Motors and drives are our business, redefining reliable motion from check-time per day to uptime per lifecycle, from simply on/off to everything smart in between. Our most powerful engine: more than 15,000 dedicated experts, doers, colleagues. For them, engineering the future means keeping businesses in motion – in e-motion. We are the “we” in power – and we can empower you.

15,000 and counting.

Are you looking for the stability of an established global player with the lean, innovative spirit of a mid-size hidden champion? That’s us! Are you looking to shape entire industries with a future-proof portfolio of more sustainable, energy efficient solutions? Deal, let’s go!

The role.

Innomotics LLC is looking for a multifaceted and motivated Pricing Analyst and Master Data Management Professional. This position supports the implementation of pricing strategies across portfolios and various master data management programs for the Innomotics Service business. The ideal candidate is highly analytical, detail oriented, and exhibits superb communication skills. Primary responsibilities include implementation and management of the annual pricing updates, pricing analysis for critical initiatives with portfolio managers and management of associated master data.

How You will Make an Impact

Activities include, but are not limited to:

Work in a team environment to drive improvement in pricing processes through tools/systems, automation, and standardization
Analyze pricing inputs such as vendor costs, labor quotes and/or actuals to resolve appropriate pricing based on pricing guidelines
Works with multiple collaborators to ensure integrity of pricing data across tools
Monitors compliance with pricing policies and strategies
Collaborate with multi-functional teams including sales, finance, and product management to gather insights and align pricing strategies with business goals, including setting list price and regional pricing
Makes recommendations to management team on sophisticated issues that involve SAP data, data migration and interface software programming.
Extracts and manages information from various sources such as SAP and other tools
Collaborates with finance team in ensuring pricing, discount levels and other critical master data elements are accurately maintained in SAP
Support business unit master data quality improvement projects
Support Material Master Data efforts by material master creation, updates and extensions
Support and enhance data governance rules, standard operating procedures (SOPs), naming conventions, and other enterprise data standards

Your profile.

What You will Need to Succeed

Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, statistics, or related fields
5+ years of experience in a similar role
Proficiency in business intelligence software such as Power BI, Snowflake, Tableau
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite (Advanced Excel skills are preferred)
Meaningful experience with pricing and master data management tools
Strong analytical and qualitative skills with ability to analyze, filter, and organize data to present different scenarios and recommendations.
Critical thinking, Superb communication skills and Attention to detail
Ability to work in a dynamic and flexible environment

Preferred Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience:

SAP and Win shuttle experience desirable
Experience with Statistical modelling
A master’s degree in business administration will be advantageous
Confirmed ability to analyze, evaluate and interpret sophisticated data

The pay range for this position is $71,300 - $122,300. The actual wage offered may be lower or higher depending on budget and candidate experience, knowledge, skills, qualifications, and premium geographic location.

What we offer.

At Innomotics, we are committed to an ownership culture, in which every employee takes personal responsibility for our company’s success. We apply lean principles and seek to continually improve our processes and customers’ experience.

Why you’ll love working at #TeamInnomotics

Competitive compensation based on qualifications
Medical, dental, prescription and vision coverage, first day of employment
Matching 401(k) (immediate employer match)
Competitive paid time off plan, paid holidays, and floating holidays
Career development opportunities
Education and tuition reimbursement programs available
Flexibility to work remote a few days a week
Paid parental leave

Who designs your future? You do.

Make your mark in our exciting world. #JoinReliableMotion #TeamInnomotics

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

Oldcastle APG, a CRH company, is a leading global supplier of building and landscaping products. Its product portfolio includes hardscapes and masonry, packaged cement mixes, lawn and garden materials, and composite decking sold through a variety of channels for residential and commercial use. Oldcastle APG is the leading producer of hardscapes in North America and Europe and the innovator behind many of the industry's well-known brands: Belgard hardscapes, Echelon masonry, Sakrete bagged dry mixes, and MoistureShield composite decking. With over 260 operating locations and approximately 8,500 employees, Oldcastle APG operates across 7 countries in the U.S., Canada, and Europe.

Job Summary

The Project Analyst is a key role within the logistics team and will be responsible for supporting logistics initiatives across Oldcastle APG with a focus on systems and technology. The position will coordinate with both internal and external customers to successfully manage and implement new or enhanced technologies impacting both our private fleet and third-party carriers in the areas of operations, safety and compliance.

Responsibilities

Lead/support logistics projects and initiatives including the development and management of project planning, team accountability and identification of potential gaps and roadblocks
Complete business process reviews including process mapping to understand current business state and identify opportunities and strategies for alignment to best practice
Act as a liaison between our vendors and internal partners to ensure technical and business requirements are met and continuous improvement opportunities are identified and implemented
Develop and coordinate training using multi- media sources to properly educate and train users in logistics technologies
Provide scheduled project status reporting to key stakeholders detailing timeline, completed and upcoming tasks and roadblocks
Prioritize and manage project issue log including ownership and accountability
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain Management, or related concentration preferred
1+ years of experience in logistics or transportation required
Planning experience in Oracle Transportation Management preferred
Strong organizational skills and ability to communicate effectively (both written and verbal) with key stakeholders
Ability to work independently with the strong prioritization and time management skills; must be able to work within tight deadlines
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite to prepare and analyze data, communicate electronically, and assist in the preparation of documents and presentations
Willingness to learn various programs and software to enable scalability and ability to create efficiencies across functions
Ability to travel up to 50%

What CRH Offers You

Highly competitive base pay
Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
Group retirement savings program
Health and wellness programs
A diverse and inclusive culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

About CRH

CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization.

You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.


Position summary: This position is responsible for the financial data analytic needs of the organization. The position will use a combination of financial analysis tools and techiques as well as data analysis tools and technologies to generate, analyze, report, and interpret financial and other data used across the organization.

Develop integrated revenue/expense analyses, projections, reports, and presentations


Create and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual reports and ensures financial information has been recorded accurately


Identify trends and developments in competitive environments and presents findings to senior management; strong process documentation skillset preferred


Perform financial forecasting and reconciliation of internal accounts


Support business initiatives through data analysis, identification of implementation barriers and user acceptance testing of various systems


Diagnose problems and identify opportunities for process redesign and improvement
Education: Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of statistical or data analysis experience. Experience with financial analysis focused on month end close, government reporting, and financial forecasting. General knowledge of analysis tools, SQL, and Microsoft Applications.


Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.


Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Major Duties and Responsibilities

This position performs financial analysis duties to assist departments in the preparation and execution of annual budgets. An incumbent in this position may be designated “Senior Budget and Management Analyst.”



Prepares and publishes the annual Budget Book summary document of the Adopted Operating and Capital Budgets.
Recommends annual operating budgets for assigned departments including anticipated revenue and projected expenditures.
Creates annual graphs, spreadsheets, tables, graphics, and summary text to provide information in regard to portions of the Annual Operating Budget.
Plans and performs trend analysis and revenue projects; determine financial and socio-economic indicators; performs analysis of operating position, debt structure, unfunded liabilities, and fund balance; calculates millage rate; designs and utilizes forecasting models and statistical techniques.
Analyzes monthly departments' funding requests; assesses needs with regard to stated Management Plans.
Prepares City Council agendas, CIP, travel, and commodity approval items as assigned; assists departments in the preparation of agenda items.
Performs special projects requiring research and written reports including responses to employee suggestions and inquiries from the public and management personnel.
Reviews and analyzes year-to-date revenue summary and expenditure summary for assigned departments; determine problem areas, contacts departments to initiate corrective action.
Trains others in various policies, procedures, and systems i.e. purchasing card training and financial or budget applications; assists with troubleshooting as necessary.
Analyzes and processes personnel action requests, such as promotions, separations, transfers, reclassifications, salary changes, etc.; assists with maintaining accurate position control information in all applicable databases.
Works with Human Resources to develop an annual salary budget; assist with analysis and implementation of proposed pay plan changes.
Attends meetings, executive sessions, audits, and committee meetings as needed; responds to questions.
Other duties include preparing overtime reports of budgetary issues and concerns for each assigned department.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Knowledge of the principles and practices of public finance, budgeting, accounting, governmental accounting, and auditing.
Knowledge of relevant federal and state laws, local ordinances, and department policies and procedures.
Knowledge of the methods and techniques of financial research, statistical analysis, and report presentation.
Problem-solving and decision making.
Gathering and analyzing complex data.
Oral and written communication skills, ability to instruct others, ability to interact well with others.

Minimum Educational and Training Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in a Business, Accounting, Finance, Management, or related field is required. Experience sufficient to thoroughly understand the basic principles relevant to the major duties of the position, usually associated with one to three years of experience or service.

Physical Requirements

Feeling – perceiving attributes of objects by touch with skin, fingertips.
Grasping – applying pressure to object with fingers, palm.
Handling – picking, holding, or working with whole hand.

Hearing 2 – receive detailed information, make discrimination in sound.

Repetitive Motion – substantial movements of wrists, hands, fingers.
Speaking – expressing ideas with spoken word, convey detailed, important instructions accurately, concisely.

Visual Acuity 2 - color, depth perception, field of vision.
Visual Acuity 3 - determine accuracy, neatness, observe facilities/structures.

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.

Equifax is looking for an experienced Salesforce Business Analyst to join our Sales Enablement Team. This Business Analyst role is responsible for the functional requirements of Salesforce–orchestrating the lead to cash process across the enterprise, defining business needs, business processes and business requirements. The Business Analyst is also responsible for identifying areas of transformation and standardization to enable enterprise processes via Salesforce and enable business value. The Business Analyst must assess inputs and outputs from the lead to cash process to enable seamless transition from marketing and sales, as well as, downstream processing.

The Business Analyst works cross-functionally and with multiple levels of the organization to ensure timely and quality design of end-to-end solutions. A successful candidate will be experienced and motivated, with a strong sense of urgency and solid understanding of the Salesforce platform and capabilities–specifically Configure Price Quote (CPQ). This position follows a hybrid framework and requires in-office presence at our Midtown Atlanta location .

What you’ll do

Collaborate with multiple levels of the sales, marketing, finance and operations organizations to understand current business issues and pain points

Identify opportunities to leverage the Salesforce platform to address pain points and drive business value

Partner with business stakeholders to understand current business processes, identify gaps between current processes and enterprise processes, define solutions to address gaps, document user stories and business requirements and associated business value

Support prioritization of user stories across multiple business processes and stakeholders

Design and implement business solutions to satisfy functional and non-functional requirements while ensuring quality, scalability and timely delivery

Create and maintain project deliverables to ensure business processes, use cases, business requirements, functional designs, test plans, etc are thoroughly and consistently documented using standard templates and centralized repository

Assist in designing the data and solution architecture to support business processes

Collaborate with Process Owner/Architect, Admins and IT partners on complex technical solutions

Document acceptance criteria and testing requirements for positive, negative and regression testing for user stories

Support Functional QA Leader to execute testing activities for use cases, including defect resolution (tracking, triage, resolve, re-test)

Provide content for end user training design, documentation and delivery efforts

Provide end user and production support

Embrace the Equifax single instance strategy for Salesforce.com by supporting governance processes and designing business solutions within the governance model

Maintain an understanding of the Equifax Salesforce.com platform and functional components, including functional data model, integration between components and impacts of process and functional designs with upstream and downstream processes

Establish and maintain positive communication and professional relationships with internal/external customers, team members and vendors/partner

Stay current on Salesforce.com functionality, best practices, releases, product roadmaps and 3rd party applications available via the AppExchange

Maintain Salesforce Admin Certification

Seek additional certifications as necessary

What experience you’ll need

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

Minimum 3 years in an analyst, operations, sales, customer support or related role

Proven experience defining business requirements, writing user stories, creating detailed functional designs and/or process documentation

Salesforce Admin Certification

What could set you apart

Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, Business Management, Industrial Engineering or related field

Masters or advanced degree

Experience in Configure, Price, Quote (CPQ) and/or Contract Lifecycle Management (CLM)

Deep understanding of Lead to Cash process flows on an enterprise level







We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, 401k matching, paid time off, and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.

Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!

Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

The Georgia Dept. of Transportation (GDOT) seeks a Business Analyst (BA) who will primarily assigned to compiling and documenting scopes of work to facilitate new IT procurements/contracts. The scopes of work define the applicable boundaries, requirements, activities/tasks, deliverables/milestones, terms and conditions, etc. for purchasing goods/services. The BA will incorporate or gather requirements and related exhibits/appendices. BA will collaborate with business, IT, IT Security, Legal, and Procurement/Legal stakeholders. BA will obtain and assess vendor provided agreements and related materials. BA will prepare any additional documents as needed to facilitate procurements. BA will facilitate reconciling any conflicting items between parties. BA will assist in gathering and documenting selection criteria for proposal evaluations. Consultant shall represent GDOT interests and comply with Ethics/Code of Conduct rules of the State of Georgia. Consultant will be preparing materials to support procurements but will not be participating in the actual GDOT evaluation, selection, or contracting processes.

As time permits, BA may be assigned to GDOT IT Project teams to gather and translate business needs into in-house custom developed product/solution requirements. The BA will work hand-in-hand with business, project, and management teams. BA will solicit, understand, and analyze business needs, data, objectives, and processes. BA will translate user need into materials for successful IT initiation, design, and development. BA will conduct user interviews and joint-application-development (JAD) sessions. BA will identify business “pain points” and rank user stories/use cases potential to improve business effectiveness/performance. BA will clarify and document IT project scope, current/future state, business/application workflows, functional/system requirements, system interaction diagrams, reporting and training requirements, data mapping, logical data models, metadata, screen mock-ups, and test cases. BA will actively participate in the software development life cycle (SLDC) and transfer information to IT Project teams. BA will be responsible for demonstrating requirement traceability within work products. BA will validate requirements were met within developed products and facilitate completion of user acceptance testing. BA will assist project manager in getting dates from business units to complete reviews.

Responsibilities:

Participates in the demand management process to assist the business in establishing business cases, scope, and requirements relating to requests for new systems or existing system changes
Primarily support IT acquisition of products or services by developing scopes of work
Consults with project teams and architects to identify currently know solutions or performs market research
Gathers information/documentation from vendors or contractors
Translates business needs into requirements and functional/non-functional specifications
Gather, clarify/define, and document scope, business scenarios, workflows, requirements, etc.
Conduct interviews, workshops, and JAD sessions
Analyzes and validates business requirements and processes, identifies opportunities for process enhancement to benefit the Department, identifies gaps in information
Uses a structured process to define priorities and opportunities and/or works with stakeholders to define the minimum viable product (MVP) and options for improvements via subsequent phases
Produces required work artifacts
Communicates and presents client’s business requirements to implementation teams
Creates systems models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and system architects
Works with the team to define acceptance criteria or other metrics/performance goals for the system
Provides status updates, completes weekly work time logs, updates work tickets weekly
Provide estimates and target dates for task completion for incorporation into project schedules or work tickets

Work Terms and Conditions: 8AM - 5PM 40 hrs. per week

GDOT has NOT specified a number of days onsite vs remote. However, local candidates (i.e. able to come in office) will be preferred over an out of state candidates (i.e. remote worker). GDOT prefers candidates who can demonstrate they have the capability to work a hybrid work schedule which is a combination of remote and in-office work. Candidate capacity (i.e. days they could come into the office) to work a hybrid work schedule will be discussed during interviews.
The consultant will follow all applicable State of Georgia and GDOT policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and accepted best practices.
The position end date is set for the end of the GDOT Fiscal Year. GDOT may exercise the option to renew contracts in one-year increments. Several successful consultants have continued working for several years with contract extensions. However, GDOT is under no obligation to extend contracts and may terminate employment at any time.
When teleworking or working remotely, consultant must have suitable internet connection and environment to comply with GDOT telework policies.
GDOT will reimburse authorized travel expense lodging and meals. GDOT will reimburse authorized travel use of a personal vehicle. Any travel expenses to start work or relocate to Georgia or will not be reimbursed.
All travel expense reimbursement shall be in accordance with State Accounting Office Travel Policy: https://sao.georgia.gov/state-travel-policy
The Department has 13 holidays, which consultants are not allowed to work nor make up any time for those holiday weeks without management's approval. Consultants are not to take extended leave during their first year of service (e.g. greater than 1 week).
Consultant must have cell phone which can be used for business calls.
GDOT does not provide free parking. All routine commuting expenses are the responsibility of the consultant.

Skill Matrix

BS/BA in a relevant discipline (Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, etc.) Required 4 Years
IT busines analysis work experience in software development, project management, or technology implementations/support Required 5 Years
Experience with Microsoft Office Professional, including Visio Required 5 Years
Experience with data and business process analysis Required 3 Years
Experience in developing statements/scope of work for contracting and procurement Required 3 Years
Work experience in reviewing software license, service, or support level agreements Required
Experience with procurements or solicitations, developing scopes of work or statements of work. Required 3 Years
Strong analytical/technical skills, able to provide impact/risk assessments Required
Excellent communication, teamwork, and collaboration skills Required
Strong problem solving and organizational skills Required
Detail oriented, analytical mindset Required
Able to manage multiple projects/tasks at once; Results oriented and highly organized; Able to work in a fast-paced environment Required
Strong interviewing, active listening, communication, presentation, moderating meetings, and interpersonal skills - influencing, negotiating, etc. Required
Strong written communication skills with the ability to prepare presentations and write scope/specifications for procurement/contracting Required
Able to provide portfolio or examples of scopes of work or statements of work they prepared. Required

Position Summary
Morehouse School of Medicine ( MSM ) is a place of distinction, serving as the nation’s leading academic medical center for vulnerable populations. It’s also a place for passionate individuals looking to join a dedicated community working today to help prepare tomorrow’s leaders.

With emphasis on people of color and the under-served urban and rural populations in Georgia, the nation and the world; we exist to:
Improve the health and well-being of individuals and communities;
Increase the diversity of the health professional and scientific workforce;
Address primary health care through programs in education, research and service;



At Morehouse School of Medicine, we’re leading the creation and advancement of health equity. You will find a fulfilling career at MSM !

The Office of Human Resources is seeking a dynamic Data Analyst, HR Analytics, Human Capital Insights and Reporting to join their team.

What You will Do for Us
This position will be part of the HR Technology and Operations Group. The focus of this role will be aimed at supporting implementation of an institutional strategy for HR Business Intelligence, driving key deliverables to execution such as HR dashboards and reports. The successful candidate shall possess experience in the areas of HR Reporting, Data Quality and Architecture, People Analytics, Project Management, Advanced Power Bi, Agile ( SCRUM ), Business Process Analysis and should display ability to influence and drive change in a global organization. The position works under the supervision of the AVP for HR Technology in partnership with internal and external stakeholders and leaders to develop creative solutions to current business challenges and drive insights through data.


Minimum Qualifications
Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or a related field required; from a regionally accredited college or university.

Experience: Must possess 2+ years of similar work experience in data analytics and visualization, statistical reporting, and/or quantitative analytics.

Must have proficiency with Business Intelligence software, data analytics and visualization tools, and/or database programming, such as Microsoft Power BI, Alteryx, Python, QlikView, Splunk, Hyperion or Cognos.

Experience with creating executive-level reports, decks and dashboards using PowerPoint and data visualization software in a way that requires the ability to analyze and synthesize information from a multitude of sources and develop appropriate and actionable recommendations for leaders that demonstrate ability to influence without authority.

Strong organizational skills with the ability to produce analyses and reports independently while managing multiple projects with limited supervision and making well informed priority trade-offs.

Ability to juggle competing priorities and work in a dynamic and changing environment.

Ability to pose questions and then devise strategies to analyze the data to answer them.

Ability to leverage data and analytical capabilities to create key decision support tools (executive presentations, business cases, white papers).


Preferred Qualifications
Education: MBA , Data Scientist or I/O psychologist preferred; from a regionally accredited college or university.

Experience: 5+ years of experience in the areas of HR and HR Reporting 3+ years of data quality and architecture, People Analytics, Project Management, Advanced Power Bi, Agile ( SCRUM ), or business process analysis.

Advanced capabilities in MS Excel and Power BI. Predictive Analytics Statistical Analysis Modeling Management Consulting experience preferred Project Management.

Ability to manage projects to ensure successful delivery (on time, within budget, meeting agreed upon success criteria), business case, develop and manage project plans, allocate resources, identify potential issues/risks, and develop contingency plans Core HR Systems, Alteryx and Tableau experience preferred

Yes
