Job Duties

Description of Job Duty
Empower and improve data environment, reporting, and processes while actively working across the larger team to ensure efforts are well understood across COE , HR Business partners, and mission area partner groups.

Act as internal business consultant by participating in the strategic reporting planning process with COE leaders and business partners and having a strong focus on synthesizing large data sets into actionable insights.

Supports the standup of new data infrastructure and automated reporting frameworks (including documentation for long term business continuity) that will enable leaders to make better decisions through analytics, reporting and consultative support across all areas of the COE as team scope expands and new programs are stood up.

Leverage basic understanding of people/HR analytics by turning large volumes of data into insights through SQL and data visualization tools.

Support various phases of the HR data analysis lifecycle – including extracting large and complex datasets through programs and queries; aggregating data into business intelligence tools; interpreting the results using statistical and strategic analyses; and developing/maintaining visually impactful reports, models, and executive-level presentations

DESCRIPTION

Analyzes all spatial and non-spatial data to ensure accuracy in accordance with established data standards and best practices. Performs computer systems analysis, database design, application integration, development, and maintenance on Geographic Information Systems (GIS)-related software and hardware, specifically within the area of Asset Management through specialized software platform(s). Works within the guidelines of Information Technology standard operating procedures, technical manuals, user specifications, and federal, state, city, and departmental policies and procedures. Reports to the GIS Manager or other designated person and works with co-workers, vendors, computer service personnel, employees, and government agencies to develop and support information systems.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

TYPICAL CLASS ESSENTIAL DUTIES:
Integrates data, transforms business processes into database design, and provides reporting for applications utilizing Augusta’s Enterprise Geodatabase. Conducts quality control and quality assurance on existing data, or assists in the creation of new data, including addressing, roads, parcel, and other data in Augusta’s Enterprise Geodatabase. Serves as GIS reviewing agent for electronic plan reviews process.
Maintains and performs syncing of multiple relational databases and corresponding ArcGIS Server Services for applications utilizing web services.
Installs, maintains, upgrades, and integrates GIS applications, trains users, and performs follow-up assessments.
Assist in generating GIS-related solutions (maps, web applications, documents, reports, forms) and other documentation in accordance with industry-recognized standards and best practices for departments that use GIS technology as well as the public.
Designs, develops, implements, and supports software systems for approved GIS, GPS, and aerial/digital orthophotography projects.
Evaluates needs of city departments, prepares analytical reports, and makes recommendations for implementation of GIS.
Researches, evaluates, and introduces new GIS and application technology to management.
Develops and supports documentation and procedural manuals.
Evaluates and reports project status to management.
Provides and maintains application security.
As Required Performs other duties of a similar nature or level.

POSITION SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES MIGHT INCLUDE:
Performs quality control of all data in Augusta’s Enterprise geodatabase and web solutions.
Gathering requirements for maps, designing layouts, and creating maps and GIS geodatabase exports for customers.
Training and assisting individuals or groups of end users or fellow staff members in GIS applications and technological concepts in which the employee has expertise or experience.
Support, Maintenance and Ongoing Development of the city’s GIS internet and intranet presence.
Troubleshooting GIS-related productivity and/or business software problems for customers.
Coordinates departmental efforts with vendors to implement GIS technology.
Working with a team to plan and execute a technological solution for our customers.
Trains other staff members (not necessarily subordinates) in GIS-related technology applications.



MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

REQUIRED MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education: BA/BAS degree in GIS, Geography, MIS, Computer Science, Business Administration, or other technology-related discipline, or AA/AS degree with 3 years formal training in GIS.

Experience: Two (2) years with Bachelor’s, or three (3) years with AA/AS in a GIS/GPS position or related experience in a position involving geodatabase, database design, or related experience. Experience with Relational Database Management, Scripting, and Design and advanced experience with ESRI platform and suite of products and solutions.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

ESRI suite of products and databases such as SQL and SDE
Local, state, and federal legal requirements and city and departmental policies and procedures.
GIS/GPS concepts, theory, and practices
Analytical skills for solving complex spatial relationships
Concepts related to Public Safety, National Emergency Number Association (NENA), FGDC Federal Geographic Data Committee, Next Generation 911
General surveying and mapping practices
Troubleshooting, problem solving, training, organization, and operation of GIS, web services, and GIS Centric applications.
Problem solving techniques
Principles and application of customer service

Skills:
Acquiring and maintaining skill sets on new and evolving programming GIS/GPS technologies.
Experience with Relational Database Management, Scripting, and Design.
Understanding of Asset Management Systems.
Troubleshooting, problem solving, training, organization, and operation of application systems.
Good communication skills, both oral and written.
Working with teams and independently.
Documentation of business processes.
Organizing and recording work for inclusion in departmental record-keeping purposes.


Licensing/Certification:

Geographic Information Systems Professional (GISP) Preferred but not Required.

Licensing: Possession of a valid driver’s license with good driving history. If State license is other than Georgia or South Carolina, applicant must obtain a license in Georgia or South Carolina within 30 days of employment.

PERFORMANCE APTITUDES:

Data Utilization: Requires the ability to evaluate, audit, deduce, and/or assess data using established criteria. Includes exercising discretion in determining actual or probable consequences and in referencing such evaluation to identify and select alternatives.
Human Interaction: Requires the ability to work with and apply principles of persuasion and/or influence over others to coordinate programs or activities of a project, and resolve typical problems associated with the responsibilities of the job.
Equipment: Requires the ability to operate, maneuver, and/or control the actions of equipment, machinery, tools and/or materials requiring complex and/or rapid adjustments.
Verbal: Requires the ability to utilize a wide variety of reference, descriptive, advisory and/or design data and information.
Math: Requires the ability to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division; the ability to calculate decimals and percentages; the ability to utilize principles of fractions; and the ability to interpret graphs.
Functional Reasoning: Requires the ability to apply principles of influence systems, such as motivation, incentive, and leadership, and to exercise independent judgment to apply facts and principles for developing approaches and techniques to resolve problems.
Situational Reasoning: Requires the ability to exercise judgment, decisiveness and creativity in situations involving the evaluation of information against sensory, judgmental, or subjective criteria, as opposed to that which is clearly measurable or verifiable.
Physical Abilities: Tasks require the regular and, at times, sustained performance of moderately physically demanding work, typically involving some combination of climbing and balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, and crawling, and that may involve the lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling of moderately heavy objects and materials (20-50 pounds). Tasks may involve extended periods of time at a keyboard or work station.
Sensory Requirements: Some tasks require the ability to perceive and discriminate visual cues or signals. Some tasks require the ability to communicate orally.
Environmental Factors: Performance of essential functions may require exposure to adverse environmental conditions, such as dirt, dust, pollen, odors, wetness, humidity, rain, heights, confined spaces, electric currents, traffic hazards, bright/dim lights, temperature and noise extremes, fumes, hazardous materials, machinery, vibrations, electric currents, traffic hazards, bright/dim light, toxic agents, disease, pathogenic substances

OTHER

This position requires staff call up in an emergency situation.

This position requires some travel from office to other locations.

Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments – creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them. You have an opportunity to personally thrive, make a difference and be part of a culture where individuality is noticed and valued every day.

Job Description:
Why Conduent:

You’ll have an opportunity to work on innovative technology while being surrounded by a culture that recognizes each person’s contributions. Each day you’ll feel challenged and know you are making a difference. At Conduent, we believe everything touches everything -and to that end we value our work and each other in the process, making it an award winning place to work. In 2021, we won Best Places to Work, Best Global Culture and Best HR Team.

You have an opportunity to personally and professionally thrive, make a difference, and be part of a culture where individuality and participation is valued.

We need someone who:
Must be able to work with the clients to create/gather requirements and document them according to standards
Must adhere to (or if needed, define) the processes for requirement solicitation, documentation and hand off
Should work closely with the IT development team to elucidate the requirements, enable constructive discussions / brainstorming sessions to implement the best in class solution.

Should be able to run queries and perform basic system analysis, RCA etc.,
Should be able to create mapping documents for the various interfaces and include business rules, transformation and DB mapping
Should work closely with the client and development team during the stages of development, and conduct demos at completion of milestone, track and close feedback from such demos
Must have excellent written and spoken communication skills. Should be able to multitask between internal team and clients based on priority tasks
Work Closely with Dev, architecture and Design teams to define the GUI view and platform requirements, which is the foundation of the product

Must have very good understanding of the healthcare payer space with a minimum experience of 10 years in the domain.

Must have good experience in Reference code/data sets required in Claims adjudication including not limited to CPT, CDT, HCPCS, and ICDs
Must have prior experience or understanding in configuring benefits or programs in claims system across various sub-systems.

Capability to think out-of-the-box to create new solutions as needed.
Prior experience as a IT QA or Developer in a healthcare system would be helpful though not mandatory
Ability to validate Test scenarios and test plans, test data.
Should be able to Review requirements, documentation and create Requirements Traceability matrix (RTM)
Should have excellent communication (written and spoken) skills to engage with different stake holders like QA/dev team, clients, end users of Clients and Business Units
Ability to assess current functionality available in a product Vis a Vis market trends, regulatory requirements to be implemented in future version of the product.
Ability to drive and share the requirements with Technical and Architects regarding product features to be implemented.
Optional Tools usage:
MS Visio to define the different views like System, technical, functional, and role-based view.
Awareness defect tracking and version control tools like Jira, TFM, DevOps Azure
DB client to write data queries to validate data updated in the database table.

Job Title: Data Compliance and Access Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The Global Security Organization provides industry-leading cyber-security and business protection services to TikTok globally. Our organization employs four principles that guide our strategic and tactical operations. Firstly, we Champion Transparency & Trust by leading the charge in organizational transparency, prioritizing customer trust, and placing user needs first. Secondly, we aim to maintain Best in Class Global Security by proactively identifying and reducing risks while enabling innovative product development. We constantly work towards a sustainable world-class security capability. Thirdly, we strive to be a Business Catalyst & Enabler by embodying the DNA of technical innovation and ensuring our Global Security operations are fast and agile. Finally, we Drive Empowered & Risk-Informed Decision Making by providing our leaders with the necessary information to make agile decisions based on risk. In order to enhance collaboration and cross-functional partnerships, our organization follows a hybrid work schedule that requires employees to work in the office for 2 to 3 days a week, as directed by their manager. We regularly review our hybrid work model, and the specific requirements may change at any time.

TikTok is seeking an Analyst for Access Approval Operations to be part of the Data Protection team and will be responsible for reviewing data access and data transfer requests to ensure they are in compliance with relevant company policy, geographical regulation, contractual commitments, and confidentiality requirements. This role reports to the Access Assurance Compliance Lead within the Global Security Organization.

Responsibilities

Understand the access management policies and procedures and the implications on TikTok's business model
Evaluate access request business justifications to align with the principle of least privilege and defined policies for access approvals
Understand defined data categories and data transfer rules, and the implications on TikTok's regional regulatory obligations
Evaluate business requests for data transfer based on interoperable needs, to align with regional legal and regulatory requirement
Serve as access assurance liaison and interact with cross-business line applicants to communicate access standards and/or gather required information
Implement new review procedures and continually update internal documentation involving new regulatory, company, and reporting requirements
Establish, track and report operational metrics to senior leadership
Serve in a rotating on-call process for emergency access related matters
Qualifications

Bachelors’ Degree or industry equivalent work experience
0-2 years experience working in cybersecurity or information security
Understanding of:
Data classification and concepts of data minimisation
Access management concepts, processes, and procedures
User access administration, role and policy-based access controls, including identity management, provisioning and de-provisioning access
Identity and Access Management (IAM) tools
Metrics and reporting, including dashboarding, Microsoft Excel and SQL
SLA management
Familiarity with regulatory privacy landscape (e.g., GDPR, CCPA)
Ability to adapt to changing requirements or non-standard situations
Ability to serve in on-call rotations to ensure timely incident response
Ability to communicate and work closely with colleagues in different time zones

Genuine Parts Company (“GPC” or the “Company”), founded in 1928 and based in Atlanta, Georgia, is a leading distributor of automotive and industrial replacement parts and value-added services. The Company operates a global portfolio of businesses with more than 10,000 locations across the world. GPC has approximately 50,000 global employees with operations in the United States, Canada, Mexico, Australia, New Zealand, Indonesia, Singapore, France, the U.K., Germany, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Spain, and China.

Position Purpose:

Leverage information as an asset by generating insights and delivering solutions that lead to business outcomes connected to key initiatives
Serve as a subject matter expert on best practice uses of business intelligence (BI) platforms and enterprise data warehouse (EDW) assets
Partner with stakeholders to drive product development, strategic projects, and other delivery commitments
Serve as a data evangelist and facilitate the alignment of analytics across the organization

Demonstrated and advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office products (primarily Excel)

The State Accounting Office (SAO) provides accounting and financial reporting expertise for the State and is statutorily responsible for statewide financial reporting. The SAO also provides enterprise oversight and management of the State’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system, accounting policy development, financial business process improvement recommendations, and management of the payroll and accounting shared service centers.

Position Description:




The State Accounting Office (SAO) of Georgia is currently transitioning to the Workday system. SAO is looking for seasoned Workday Financials business analyst who can craft system solutions and the associated business procedures needed for introducing new or updated system functionalities. We invite functional Workday experts with a strong background in Workday Financials Accounts Payables (AP) to be a part of our IT Financial Systems Unit. The business analyst will conduct detailed problem-solving and analytical tasks for intricate business and system functions, address intricate application problems and user inquiries, record business operations, support the transition from the existing PeopleSoft to the Workday system, and act as a liaison between our team and the customer. The business analyst must be able to work effectively with a diverse team of project stakeholders, including clients, project managers, internal staff, and consultants. The candidate must be able to collaborate with the team to ensure that projects stay on schedule, the work is completed as scoped, reporting is accurate, and escalations are initiated quickly when needed.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:




Administers Workday financials training for business users
Analyzes information to determine nature and extent of customer Workday requirements and concerns
Assists in the development of standards and procedures used in development of new or enhancement of existing A/P systems
Consults with vendors or technical staff to ensure that functionality of Workday system is consistent with adherence to laws, regulations, and best practice standards by users
Develops change management plans for transition to new A/P systems
Documents business processes for users of new or upgraded Workday system
Participates in evaluation of new technologies or solutions to improve service and efficiency of systems
Participates in the establishment of standards and procedures to be used in the development of systems
Provides customer support in the use of systems
Researches and analyzes system/user problems by applying a variety of analytical and research techniques
Tests or coordinates testing of system modifications
Executes routine production system processes
Provides resolution for simple application issues
Identifies and documents business, functional and system requirements



Skills and Competencies:

Must have two or more years of experience with workday
Strong Accounts Payable experience is essential
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work closely with customers to resolve production support issues
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team to identify and refine business requirements, create functional designs, and perform all expected functional procedures
Familiarity with full lifecycle development processes is required
Personal commitment to serve the customer with excellence, competence, proficiency, and courtesy is essential



Minimum Qualifications:




This position will be filled at a level commensurate with the selectee's education and experience at one of the following levels:




IT Enterprise Business Analyst 2

Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Two years in a related position OR Associate's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Three years of related experience, Two years of which in a related position OR Two years of experience at the lower-level IT Enterprise Business Analyst 1 (ITP180) or position equivalent.

IT Enterprise Business Analyst 3

Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Two years in a related supervisory position OR Associate's degree in a related field from an accredited college or university AND Three years of related experience, Two years of which in a related supervisory position OR Two years of experience at the lower-level IT Enterprise Business Analyst 2 (ITP181) or position equivalent.

Preferred Qualifications:




Preference may be given to applicants who, in addition to meeting the Minimum Qualifications, possess the following:




7+ years of hands-on experience with Workday Financials
Knowledge\experience in Workday is required
Working knowledge of report writing, Enterprise Interface Builder (EIBs) and calculated fields
Experience in Accounts Receivable, Budgeting, General Ledger, and/or Procurement is a plus
Experience being a part of a Workday implementation within a large organization
5+ years of experience working in the public sector
Knowledge\experience in PeopleSoft Experience with preparation and leading system, integration, and user acceptance testing
Experience on projects during design, configure/build, implement and stabilization phases
4+ years working in an IT organization performing requirements gathering, development of requirements, testing and delivery of new or modified system functionality by following system life-cycle development methodologies



Application/Resume must clearly describe relevant qualifications and experience.




Important Notes:

The SAO offers flexible work hours in a hybrid in-office/remote work environment.

Candidates interested in employment with the SAO must:

Successfully pass a background check; including, criminal background/records check, employment and education verification, employment reference checks, credit evaluation and professional license checks, where applicable;
Upon, and throughout, employment, both reside and work in the State of Georgia; and
Be legally authorized to work in the United States; the SAO does not offer sponsorships for current or future employment visas (e.g., H-1B employment visa)

All qualified applicants will be considered but may not necessarily receive an interview. Selected applicants will be contacted by the hiring agency for next steps in the selection process. Applicants who are not selected will not receive notification.

Job Title: SAS Program Management Lead Analyst/Data Analyst - Hybrid
Job Description:
This is a hybrid role and will require the ability to work in person.

Role Summary:

Data Analyst for our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program. This position will provide the technical component of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program in development, implementation, production monitoring and maintenance of our internal PrePay edits. Individual will work with our matrix partners to evaluate edit ideas and use business requirements to develop the technical processes to obtain desired results. Strong technical coding experience will be needed to be successful in this role.

Responsibilities:

Act as technical analyst for Proactive Claim Intervention projects and daily tasks for all aspects of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Data Analyst for the development, installation, execution and maintenance of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Develop and maintain editing on regular and ad-hoc basis, primarily using SAS, Microsoft SQL Server and internally developed ARM application.
Responsible for data mining activities and technology integration of Pre/PostPay Correction Program to support our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Evaluates and appropriately utilizes various approaches to data mining to narrow in on trends and drivers that directly impact outcomes.
Makes well-thought-out decisions on complex or ambiguous IT architecture issues.
Participate in all phases of Pre/PostPay Edit program IT architecture process testing and implementation
Ensures that system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency.
Works closely with matrix business partners to define data needs, opportunities for improvement and effectively communicates results of analysis and solutions.
Acts as a resource for mentorship, training and guidance for junior staff.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree or higher strongly preferred in business, technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required.
5+ years of SAS coding experience required with proficient skills Microsoft SQL Server.
5+ years of experience in health care/managed care with proficient skills in medical analysis and project management.
Solid Excel experience preferred.
Strong data investigation skills to mine healthcare data required.
Strong data analysis skills with the ability to analyze large amount of healthcare data required.
Strong project management skills and comfort in ability to create and achieve success in highly matrixed environment.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to research, problem solve, trouble shoot, influence and partner across the organization to a drive toward resolution for the client, provider and organization.
Strong presentation skills. Able to prepare, deliver, and ensure understanding of information regarding any customer-related or process improvement topic across audiences.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and drive to objectives.



If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 70,800 - 118,000 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Koch Capabilities is seeking multiple Finance Data Analysts to join our Data Management, Enablement and Transformation team ! Our vision is to develop a long-term sustainable capability utilizing data and technology to transform finance , while focusing on safeguarding Koch Finance Data Assets . We aim for our products to be easily reusable, highly transferable, and readily available in centralized and standardized formats.

The ideal candidate is self-motivated, works well through ambiguity , is a creative problem solv er with the aptitude to drive change and partner with customers .

What You Will Do In Your Role

Partner with multiple business groups to understand how they are able to leverage data for their finance processes and help determine how to utilize that data for enterprise-wide data reporting requirements
Partner with multiple business groups to assist them in developing data quality business rules of their own
Develop key performance indicators at the product level to ensure ongoing and consistent data management
Partner with customers to understand data problems to support insights and analysis to drive business decisions
Standardize and format data from multiple business groups into an enterprise data platform
Lead and manage the development by supporting ongoing data demand signals and use case requirements
Ensure our data products are updated to meet changing requirements such as evolution of audits, regulatory/government requirements, compliance, etc.
Facilitate and support testing, identify ingestion errors, surface bugs and defects, and partner with the SMEs to support testing
Collaborate and knowledge share across other data products to determine where consistent processes should exist
Responsible for documentation to support the Data Product including: the data governance model, requirements, decisions, process flows, end user support, etc.
Design, execute and seek continuous improvement of data products, along with identify other Finance processes or groups with opportunities to leverage the data, share value of data products to other teams and processes and influence change
Act as a change agent related to business and technical changes within the environment as related to data product

The Experience You Will Bring

Accounting, tax, and/or finance domain knowledge
Enterprise-wide data management and analytics experience
Experience partnering and collaborating with multiple business groups or departments to drive results
Experience communicating and presenting to various levels within an organization

What Will Put You Ahead

Specific domain knowledge (master data, sales, intercompany) with a strong understanding of how the data is used in various accounting, finance, and tax processes
Scrum frameworks and methodology
Experience building business knowledge through meaningful partnerships at the individual contributor and leadership levels
Excellent attention to detail and ability to create synergies/draw connections across multiple platforms/disparate systems to drive consistency and reuse in data
Demonstrate deep curiosity and willingness to trace gaps in metadata (and ultimately quality) back to the originator to address and resolve issues proactively at the source
Understanding of the data development life cycle and data management principles (ETL/ELT process, PDLC (product development lifecycle), metadata management, data quality, etc.)
Experience in understanding and correcting data discrepancies, identifying data anomalies, and root cause analysis
Experience working in finance systems such as ERPs, Alteryx, AtScale, SQL, Tableau, tax provision tools or consolidation tools

Job Title: Operations Analyst, W&S Utility Customer Operations
Job Description:
Salary Range: $58,662-$94,446 FLSA- Exempt


Essential Functions:

The following duties are normal for this position. The omission of specific statements of the duties does not exclude them from the classification if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment for this classification. Other duties may be required and assigned.

Creates and recommends schedules to support call volume and optimize performance; generates and evaluates call volume reports; and employs available technologies to enhance call center service levels.

Determines measures, baselines, tolerances and normal variability for performance indicators; analyzes reports and key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify business trends; and presents findings to supervisors and others as requested.

Utilizes business intelligence and other resources; develops analytic reports on a regular and ad-hoc basis; analyzes data and work processes; reports deficiencies, gaps, and opportunities to improve processes; makes recommendations for efficiency improvements; and initiates department projects and other County-wide performance improvement initiatives.

Assists in directing, developing and implementing strategic initiatives to improve and enhance performance and services; and works with division leadership to improve work quality.

Assists with and coordinates large-scale technology initiatives; develops and implements internal management information systems and telecommunications systems; and makes recommendations regarding telecommunications and information systems technology upgrades.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Statistics, Information Systems, or closely related field required; three years of experience in call center operations, data analytics, information systems, or closely related field; or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience which provides the requisite knowledge, skills, and abilities for this job.

Specific License or Certification Required: Must possess and maintain a valid Georgia driver's license; and possession and maintenance of Project Management and Six Sigma certifications are preferred.

Summary:

The Business Intelligence Analyst II provides data analytics and visualization services to Harbin Clinic. The analyst is responsible for creating interactive visualizations, reports and dashboards to support business decisions using a range of technology tools for many basic and routine requests. This role will collaborate with cross-functional units within the organization to include operations, financial, clinical teams, care coordination and data analytic resources. Reports directly to the Business Intelligence Lead.


Job Responsibilities:

Responsible for creating various reports and dashboards using business intelligence platforms, such as Tableau and MS Excel.
Follows the established process for analytics requests, communicating effectively with requesters to ensure that the requirements are documented and understood, including the business purpose of the analysis.
Completes thorough peer review ensuring accuracy and validity of work.
Manages multiple priorities in a fast paced and deadline-driven environment.
Identify inconsistent practices within the organization and provide corrective guidance to maintain the integrity of systems.
Identify and work with directors, and/or managers on opportunities for continuous improvement and business enhancement.
Assist the organization in special projects, such as evaluation of the financial impact of new programs or physicians; formulating financial forecast and modeling; preparing projections for new building projects; preparing analysis of new acquisitions; rate analysis and other projects as may be assigned.
Conduct high level analysis of metadata to identify areas of opportunity for utilization, performance improvement associated with initiatives, metrics, measures, or outcomes in the organization.
Support completion of forecasting, annual budgets, operational improvement projects, surveys, and other initiatives as needed.
Works collaboratively with other analysts to achieve department and organizational goals.


Education Requirement :

Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Accounting, Business, Computer Science, Finance or Health Administration (or related field) required.
2-3+ years of decision support or financial analysis experience preferred.

Skill Requirements:

Must have strong computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Excel and in practice management billing systems. Basic understanding of Microsoft Access preferred.
Working knowledge of SQL required, knowledge of Tableau (or comparable BI tools) and data visualization experience required.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills required. Ability to work independently, multi-task, exercise judgment, make decisions and provide recommendations. Strong attention to detail and critical thinking skills with the ability to prioritize.
Superior interpersonal skills, including excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to listen, research and determine root cause of issues.

Job Title: Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Job Description:
Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Work Location: Atlanta, GA
Employment Type: Full-time regular
Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding environment where you will work alongside the industry’s best and most talented, with the opportunity to have a front row seat in planning analyses and decisions for the public and private sector? If so, you have found the perfect opportunity! Walker Consultants is seeking a seasoned individual to assist our planning, operations, and technology practice as we serve our clients throughout our southeast US market share. Our services apply decades of best practices that enhance the users’ experiences and advance the owners’ goals.
Our primary objectives always focus on achieving the following:
Make it easier for people to reach their destinations
Support and encourage transportation mode of choice
Optimize parking and transportation customer service and bottom lines
Improve quality of lives through economic growth and built environments that work for people
Perform due diligence services helping gauge market risk and upside potential
Responsibilities
At this continuing developmental level, this role performs:
Conduct extensive research and analyze data in specific or general parking, mobility, and transit areas using a variety of methods.
Define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Write and present formal and technical reports, working papers, and correspondence.
Identify common problems, issues, and opportunities based on observation, research, and data analysis.
Develop strategies, actions, and projects to address identified issues consistent with community goals, best practices/standards, and applicable regulations.
Develop recommendations and implementation strategies.
Prepare information (i.e. project fact sheets, display boards, slides, online platforms, etc.) to explain projects to and gather input from stakeholders and the public.
Work with and communicate effectively with a broad range of team members, clients, review agencies, and others as appropriate for a range of project types.
Participate in a range of challenging parking, mobility, and transit projects including strategic urban plans, corridor and curb management studies, feasibility studies, and alternative analyses.
Support development of planning, operations, and technology documents with a primary focus on research, data collection, field assessment, data analysis, mapping, writing, and editing reports.
Prepare information to explain projects clearly and succinctly to stakeholders and public, as well as gather feedback and input from community members and stakeholders.
Assist with coordinating projects among team members, clients, and external consultants.
Communicate and interact with team members, clients, and review agencies.
10% travel required - overnight and air travel to client sites.
Qualifications
Two years demonstrated proficiency as an entry-level analyst or planner, or
Master’s degree in business, marketing, planning, architecture, engineering, or other degree appropriate to the area of concentration (mobility and parking planning, parking operations, parking technology, etc.), or
Five years transferable experience in parking, mobility and transportation industry, and
Appropriate verbal, writing, analytical and/or software skills for the specialty area.

Benefits of Joining Walker
As a skilled member of the Walker family, you will be given the opportunity to grow and develop your skills surrounded by committed, talented and enthusiastic co-workers. In addition to competitive compensation, as a full-time employee, Walker offers vacation retreats, tuition and professional certification reimbursement, professional organization membership reimbursement, 401(k) match and HSA employer contribution, commuter benefit accounts, medical, dental, vision insurance, flexible work schedules, and more!
Who We Are
Walker is a 100% employee-owned company of many capabilities offering professional services to clients in the private and public market sectors. Walker maintains a strong foundation as an industry leader in all aspects of parking planning, design, engineering, restoration, and consulting that encompass operations, technology, and mobility solutions engaging a wide spectrum of specialists and renowned experts who have been advancing standards in the industry for several decades.
Walker works collaboratively as a national team to provide sustainable planning and transportation solutions. From small towns to large urban metros and transit agencies, we help our clients build communities that are places people want to live, work, and have fun. For every project, we develop creative strategies that both put people first and are rooted in data and in line with overall goals for transportation, economic development, climate, and land use. We are focused on the future, and our plans and policies are shaped by technology, data, and infrastructure that optimize current and future investments.
You’ll join a dedicated team working with a variety of clients (cities, transit agencies, metropolitan planning organizations, hospitals, airports, universities, developers, and others) on cutting edge projects to plan for the future of transit, manage curb space, and provide more sustainable mobility options for people. This includes planning transit around a system of solar microgrids to power electric bus fleets and local resiliency/mobility hubs.
You’ll have an opportunity to directly test ideas, shape policy, and see your plans implemented. At Walker we go beyond planning, we guide implementation.
Walker Consultants is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We invite all qualified applicants to apply and do not discriminate against individuals because of their race, color, religion, national origin, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or age.

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you. Equifax is seeking a Business Intelligence Lead to join our team within Consumer Regulated Systems (Information Technology). This is a hands-on technical role; you will also lead and coach several junior BI developers. You will report to the Sr Director of Data Engineering and Analytics.

What you’ll do

The BI Lead is a hands-on senior BI developer/analyst role with a strong focus on end-user experience.

You will play an active role in setting BI standards and best practices in the frontend BI and reporting space of the DEA team. 20-30% of your time will be spent leading and coaching the rest of the team (3-4 junior developers).

The role is focused on the design and implementation of BI self service reporting and Data Analytics frameworks to scale development and deployment of data explores across the DEA organization. You will develop semantic layers/data models using LookML.

Build complex Data Explores and integrations to deliver data from upstream Equifax cloud systems such as Firestore/BigQuery in Looker.

Create reports, dashboards, and scorecards to enable robust decision making for our business users.

Enable new data service methodologies and support the data needs of self-service capabilities to enhance functionality of our DEA data platform

The BI lead will test both functional and non-functional aspects of the Data explores built in Looker and work closely with Product Owners, Data Engineers and other BI Developers to speed up the efficient data delivery mechanisms via Self Service Reporting models.

The BI lead will be responsible for active participation in the Agile methodologies such as backlog grooming sessions and sprint deliveries making sure that the end to end Datasets are thoroughly tested as per the guidelines defined by the DEA Team so as to support the release cadence.

Monitor data quality for accuracy, completeness, consistency, credibility, correctness, accessibility, compliance, confidentiality, efficiency, precision, traceability, understandability, availability, portability, and recoverability within the established data management policies

Collaborate with subject matter experts, functional owners, data owners and analysts to define and implement data strategy, policies, controls, and programs to ensure key enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable

Coordinate all data activities with other organizational governance teams, working within established protocols and policies

What experience you need

Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field

At least 5 years of experience working in BI, analytics, data architecture, or a related field

At least 2-3 years of experience working in a GCP big data environment (or another comparable cloud environment, i.e. AWS Redshift).

Experience building complex data explores, Look ML models and self service reporting solutions using two or more of the following - BigQuery, Looker

Experience with Dashboarding, KPI building and Data Analytics life cycle projects is a plus

Proficiency in traditional report development methodologies

Professional experience with SQL

Strong understanding of BI and data warehousing principles and best practices, including data modeling and data integrations

Proven ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

What could set you apart

Excellent communication skills

Willingness to learn

Team Player

Displays ownership, responsibility, and a sense of urgency

Curious & Proactive

Collaborative in a global team environment

GCP Certification is a plus

JIRA & GitHub experience is a plus

We believe that when we’re at our best, we can do our best. Equifax offers policies and programs that support our employees’ financial and personal wellbeing with additional leave days, hybrid working environment, employee assistance program and organizational growth potential through our online

learning platform with guided career tracks.

We offer comprehensive compensation and healthcare packages, on-site doctor, paramedics service 24/7, life insurance, gym facilities, collaborative workspaces, free transportation and parking, subsidized cafeteria, solidarity association and organizational growth potential through our online learning platform with guided career tracks.

Are you ready to power your possible? Apply today, and get started on a path toward an exciting new career at Equifax, where you can make a difference!

Equifax is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Fiscal Policy Analyst

The Office of Planning and Budget (OPB) exists to serve the Governor and the state in five primary ways:





Work with the Governor each year to develop a budget recommendation for the upcoming and amended fiscal years that is based on agency requests and that will be presented to the General Assembly
Provide research and analysis to the Governor’s Office and other state agencies related to budgetary items as well as to produce an efficient and effective state government
Review the agencies’ annual operating budgets to ensure that spending plans comply with the approved appropriations act, sound fiscal stewardship, and the Governor’s goals
Develop the state’s strategic plan, outlining the Governor’s vision for the state and how agencies can best support that vision
Supply official demographic and statistical data about the state of Georgia

OPB Fiscal Policy Analyst assists in the development and monitoring of agency budgets and policies for executive and legislative review. OPB analyst analyze laws proposed by the General Assembly and respond to inquiries from the public, legislators, and state agencies. Analysts monitor expenditures as compared to budget and appropriations and perform detailed and complex revenue and expenditure projections.

This posting is for the: General Government Division
Job Duties and Responsibilities:

Fiscal Analyst

Analyze annual agency budget requests and prepare recommendations for OPB leadership
Analyze and review agency budget spend plans, including complex revenue projections, to compare current and projected expenditures monthly or quarterly
Conduct and review multi-year financial trends and monitor performance of agency programs to align with agency strategic plans
Analyze and review agency allotment requests for approval
Perform analysis of complex data sets to support recommendations and approvals
Monitor and analyze state and federal legislative and policy proposals for fiscal and operational impacts
Conduct research on budget and policy priorities to prepare presentations, white papers and policy briefs on budget recommendations, operational efficiencies, streamlining of government, and program reviews.
Research assigned agencies to gain understanding of agency programs and initiatives to support reporting and recommendations

Position: Legal Staff
Seniority: Associate

Position Summary

Help make the American dream come true for immigrants! This is an exciting opportunity to grow your career with one of the largest law firms in the United States. Ogletree Deakins is an international law firm with 55 offices throughout North America and Europe. We have one of the largest business immigration practices in the United States; our immigration practice group consists of experienced and dedicated immigration lawyers and paralegals who work with domestic and international corporations and businesses in developing appropriate strategies to facilitate the international transfer of skilled employees.

Our Raleigh office has an opportunity for a Business Immigration Operations Analyst to join their fast-paced business immigration practice! The Immigration Operations Analyst will be responsible for reviewing company data from existing reporting platforms. Based on the findings, they will recommend programs on improving the company’s performance metrics. They will develop supporting documentation for reporting as well as best practices on maintaining data integrity. Based on client/business needs, this role will be responsible for specific modifications in the case management system.

We offer a collegial, collaborative, challenging, and growth-focused work environment with innovative technology, customized resources and processes, and continuous skill-based training and professional development.

Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with the Fair Chance Ordinance.

This position may be remote, but the successful candidate must reside in a state where we have a physical office.

Essential Functions
Meet with employees across departments to ensure data policies and procedures are being followed consistently.
Recommend ways to improve efficiency and data integrity.
Develop and maintain supporting documentation related to the reporting platform and data practices.
Create and maintain visual diagrams that communicate process/data flows effectively.
Explore and analyze data using Visualization Software such as PowerBI and Tableau.
Collaborates cross-functionally and meets with Business Partners across the organization to gather requirements.
Generate ad-hoc reports for clients from multiple data sets with tight deadlines.
Perform data quality control reviews and data assessments to identify trends and anomalies.
Assist with modifications to the case management software where it relates to business process requirements or client specific needs.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree and 2+ years of data analytics experience required.
High proficiency in Excel is required. Experience with an immigration law practice and business reporting, analytics, or metrics highly preferred.
Expert in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Data visualization tools experience is highly preferred, specifically PowerBI and Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
SQL and Sharepoint experience preferred.

Please note, we are not working with outside recruiters for this position.

Benefits

In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the expected salary range for this Colorado position is between $60,800 and $97,900. In accordance with New York City’s Wage Transparency Law, the expected salary range for this New York City position is between $60,600 and $99,300. In accordance with California’s amended labor code as stated in Senate Bill 1162, the expected salary range for this California position is between $55,500 and $119,400. In accordance with the Washington Equal Pay and Opportunities act, the expected salary range for this Washington position is between $62,000 and $101,400. Actual pay will be adjusted based on experience, geographic location, and other job-related factors as permitted by law. This position qualifies for the benefits below.

Ogletree Deakins offers a robust suite of benefits for our Staff including Paid Time Off, Sick Time, a 401(k) matching program, Profit Sharing, Paid Holidays, Paid Parental Leave, affordable Health and Life Insurance including Dental & Vision coverage, Health Savings Account /Flexible Spending Accounts to help offset the cost of dependent care and/or health care expenses, Teladoc (24/7 access to a doctor by phone or online video), Tuition Reimbursement and an Employee Assistance Program.




Assistance
If you need assistance submitting your application, please e-mail Ali Gardiner at ali.gardiner@ogletree.com with “Raleigh – Business Immigration Operations Analyst” in the subject line.



Applications submitted via e-mail will not be considered.

About Ogletree Deakins
Firm Overview

Ogletree Deakins has one of the largest Business Immigration practices in the United States and provides a wide range of legal services for employers seeking temporary business visas and permanent residence on behalf of foreign national employees. We provide comprehensive immigration services to clients of all sizes, including numerous Fortune 500 companies. Our practice is designed to provide superior client service at competitive fixed fee rates. Our attorneys are proactive in handling client matters, from case initiation to case strategy/planning to the successful completion of the case, always remaining accessible to all of our clients.

We are fully committed to the importance of diversity within the legal profession, as well as all workplace environments and strongly encourage the interest of diverse candidates in the firm.

Equal Opportunity Employer.

EyeSouth’s affiliate network consists of 40+ practices with approximately 2800 employees and over 300 doctors providing medical and surgical eye care services at approximately 175 locations including 20 surgery centers throughout Georgia, Texas, Louisiana, Florida, Tennessee, Ohio, Kentucky, Pennsylvania, Alabama, Illinois, North Carolina, and South Carolina.
Position Summary:
A role you will love:

Strong verbal and written communication skills as they relate to presenting complex, fact-based analyses.
A willingness to work independently and as a part of a team to obtain optimal results.

Knowledge of Azure / cloud infrastructure.
Strong written and oral proactive communication/collaboration skills.
“Self-starter” attitude with the ability to excel in dynamic work environments.

Knowledge of the healthcare industry.

Project management knowledge

FPL Food, LLC is seeking an Inventory Data Analyst to work at the Augusta, Georgia facility. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting with a minimum of 2 years accounting experience in a manufacturing environment. This position will report to the Augusta Facility Plant Controller.

SUMMARY OF POSITION:

Prepare daily inventory reports and be a backup to both plants’ cost accountants/financial analysts; Be able to balance and reconcile records and be able to research and resolve any issues related to inventory; Work with facilities personnel to continuously improve the reporting system; Support analysis requirements from Management.

________________________________________

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

1. Prepare daily inventory reports.

2. Maintain accurate inventory records for raw material and finished goods and reconcile monthly inventories at all locations with the general ledger.

3. Run various reports to verify totals on weekly production summary, investigate and resolve differences.

4. Provide backup to the plant cost accountants/financial analysts in preparing the daily and weekly gross margin reports for facilities. The reports include raw material and finished goods inventory analysis, reconciliation of raw material cost, and sales revenue actual vs. forecast.

_________________________________

Education Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting

________________________________________

Experience 5 to 7 years accounting or financial background with minimum of 2 years accounting experience in manufacturing environment, Protein Processing environment preferred.

________________________________________

Must have strong technical skills involving inventory reconciliation , costs analysis and month-end close.
Possess solid decision-making skills and the ability to exercise independent judgement.
Must have the capability to prioritize and plan work activities efficiently to meet deadlines.
Work on multiple tasks and projects simultaneously and see them through to completion.
Must be able to deal with changes, delays, or unexpected events in a calm and timely manner.
Must be able to work in a team environment with varied departments and diverse personalities.
Must be detailed oriented with excellent oral and written communication skills.
Must be proficient in MS Word, MS Outlook, and intermediate to advanced in MS Excel programs.
Must have the ability to learn new programs quickly.

________________________________________

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement inventory control procedures to ensure accurate tracking of inventory levels and transactions
Monitor inventory levels and usage patterns to ensure that inventory is maintained at optimal levels
Work closely with production, purchasing, and accounting departments to reconcile inventory records and identify discrepancies
Prepare inventory reports and analysis, including inventory turnover, stock-out rates, and obsolete inventory levels
Perform periodic physical inventory counts and reconcile discrepancies
Develop and maintain relationships with vendors and suppliers to ensure timely and accurate delivery of goods

Ensure compliance with all inventory-related regulatory requirements and standards

Experience with inventory management software and systems
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Detail-oriented and highly organized

Description:

WHO IS HEALTH ONE?

Created by Georgia providers, HealthOne (HOA) is a not-for-profit organization that seeks to improve access to affordable and quality health care. Initially started as a Preferred Provider Organization that was leased by major employees, HealthOne has expanded its offering to multiple lines of health insurance for individuals/families and businesses. In 2020, HOA expanded into ICHRA administrative service for employers and their employees. HOA is proud to call Georgia home and is fiercely committed to our community. This unwavering commitment continuously seeks ways to develop and expand services throughout Georgia.

WHY HealthOne?

HealthOne is guided by a cultural framework that embodies our values and drives our decisions.

As a company our PURPOSE is to care for people by connecting them to resources that help protect them in health related situations. We fulfill our purpose by filtering our decisions through a PRIORITIES lens of asking, “Is what we are about to do ethical, empathetic, economical, and efficient?”. By caring for PEOPLE, we are welcoming, authentic, truthful, consistent and humble. We are continuously looking for ways to improve our PROCESS and how we get things done.

HealthOne seeks individuals with integrity and heart to embody our values. Whether you’re starting your career or looking to develop additional skills to reach your full potential, HealthOne provides the means to help you achieve your goals.

JOB PURPOSE

The Benefit Plan Configuration Analyst position specializes in the analysis and application of intermediate level benefit plan design requirements. A successful Analyst will ensure a high level of quality and accuracy through benefit configuration, test execution and validation efforts while serving as a subject matter expert on benefits and claim adjudication system coding setup.

Requirements:

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

Analyzes new business requirements for benefit design changes to establish the appropriate solution.
Complies with standards set forth regarding benefit design and configuration including but not limited to Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) and National Council for Prescription Drug Programs (NCPDP).
Maintains technical documentation based on standard operating procedures.
Partners with various teams to analyze customer specific requirements and configuration and translate those into technical design specification and data flow from which programs are developed and coded.
Actively participates in and contributes to daily communications, team meetings and project/issue resolution.
Responsible for accurate management of plan benefits coding changes, test execution and validation efforts of plan benefit design requests.
Maintains documentation that validates configuration.
Efficiently and effectively distributes tasks, using clear and concise instructions and expectations.
Completes deliverables independently and within an agile team setting.
Assists with the dictionary/master file maintenance such as research, set up and maintenance of all Diagnosis, CPT and other medical code sets
Assists with updates and maintains adjudication system with defined code sets in logical order
Coordinates with internal departments to ensure data accuracy
Supports maintenance of group/benefit additions, terms, changes
Runs existing testing scripts for new and existing plans
Assists in the on-going evaluation of the benefit configurations within the core claim processing system for new and existing benefit plans
Documents the configuration of new plans as well as changes in existing plans
Provides feedback to Configuration Analyst II regarding feasibility and requirements for enhancements to benefit configuration
Provides research assistance for the resolutions of benefit issues
Serves as a liaison of benefit configuration to external departments
Collects and analyzes data to evaluate operational difficulties and makes recommendations to solve problems
Supports the work to troubleshoot and resolves claims that suspend in work queues for configuration intervention in the claims processing system
Audits files and/or batch load entries for accuracy
Performs a variety of tasks related to the on-going maintenance and set up of client configurations with the core administrative system
Assists with client implementations, system upgrades and projects to improve performance
Participates in problem solving of provider, client, reporting or system issues
Potential to rotate through configuration support functions across key system areas and lines of business with the ability to develop subject matter expertise
Performs special projects as needed and other duties related to system and report data integrity
Regular and predictable attendance
Consistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice
Maintains work area in a clean and orderly condition and ensures safe operating conditions within area of responsibility
Works to encourage and promote Company culture throughout the organization
Other duties as may be assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Up to 2 years of experience in benefit plan configuration/analysis.
Experience with adjudication processes, analyzing benefit plan design and system application.
This role requires strong attention to detail, critical thinking and analytical skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, changing environment.
Ability to identify and resolve process and/or systems issues.
Strong sense of urgency leading to the timely completion of all projects, training and assignments.
High School Diploma or GED required
Associates or Bachelor's degree in a business or computer-related field preferred
Knowledge of ICD-10, CPT4 Coding, HCPCS and medical terminology
Three or more years of Healthcare experience
Three or more years of working around claims implementation and analysis and/or claims configuration experience in any one of these areas: Provider/Provider Contracting, Clinical Benefits, Enrollment and Billing
Coding Certificate preferred

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Moderate to significant amount of stress in meeting deadlines and dealing with day-to-day responsibilities. Must be able to drive a vehicle and daytime/overnight travel as required.

BENEFITS

401K (4% Match, Immediate Vesting)

Accident insurance

Competitive salary

Critical Illness Insurance

Dental Insurance

Employee Assistance Program

Flexible Spending Account

Health & Wellness Program

Health Savings Account

Life & AD&D Insurance

Long Term Disability

Medical Insurance

Paid Time Off

Pet Insurance

Short Term Disability

Vision Insurance

PRE-EMPLOYMENT SCREENING

Drug Screen and Background Check Required

HEALTHONE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, disability, sex, age, ethnic or national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or presentation, pregnancy, genetics, veteran status or any other status protected by state or federal law.

Portfolio Business: Huber Engineered Materials

J.M. Huber Corporation is one of the largest privately held, family-owned companies in the United States. Established in 1883, we are a diversified, global supplier of specialty and commodity chemicals, hydrocolloid solutions, engineered wood products and natural resources to customers spanning a wide variety of industries. With approximately $3 billion in sales and 4,000 employees worldwide, we have a material presence in more than 20 countries.

Position Summary

As a Senior BI Technical Data Analyst, you will be responsible for maintaining, designing, developing, optimizing the ETL and data model architecture to support the end user dashboard and reporting needs. You will be the expert who can synthesize Oracle EBS, Oracle Cloud applications and external data into the data warehouse and data model. Must have hands on experience and strong appetite to continuously learn and develop expertise in Oracle EBS & Oracle Cloud application data models (particularly Sales, Finance, order to cash and procure to pay areas). Desirable to also possess strong data discovery skills; the ability to identify and utilize both external industry and internal data. Familiar to the concept and ability to design data schemas for data discovery purposes. You will be the go-to person for internal report writers if they have any questions or issues with data accuracy and model. Work will be both independent and collaborative in nature. You will engage in data exploration exercises with a variety of complex business intelligence tools, requiring knowledge of relational database structures.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities
Serve as the conduit between HEM’s global business users and the Technology teams.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Design and develop complex analytical data models based on gathered requirements using HEM’s BI tools - Business Objects Webi, MS Power BI and Oracle Cloud Analytics.
Use advanced ability to problem-solve creatively and analyze processes and systems.
Demonstrate analytical ability required to gather data, perform transformation, perform complex analysis, solve both business and technical problems.
Diagnose reporting issues in real-time and provide guidance with metrics and visualizations.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements. Deliver functional requirement documents and obtain end-user sign-off.
Understand business objectives, collect business requirements and translate them into ETL and data model requirements.
Schedule and deploy business intelligence components in accordance with supplied standards and best practices and completing accurate and timely documentation.
Work seamlessly with the BI Manager, BI Analyst and BI Technical Architects to recommend solutions for process improvements within existing environment.
Collaborate with business and IT departments to understand system data and its use, participate in data analysis and validation, and provide support around the data and how it is integrated.
Mentor, train and assist business users to develop a deep understanding of the data, its use, and the structure of reports and dashboards.
Work and communicate effectively with a variety of business users and levels to review and discuss their reporting needs.
Self-starter and ability to work effectively with minimum supervision.
Specialized/Technical Knowledge or Required Skills
Bachelor’s degree.
5+ years of experience as a technical data analyst, using SQL/PLSQL, designing ETL, data model, data architecture, data warehouse.
Familiar with creating reports and visualization using Oracle Analytics Cloud, Power BI or a similar BI tool.
Strong hands-on knowledge and background in Oracle EBS or other ERP data models (particularly Sales, Finance, order to cash and procure to pay areas).
Ability to utilize expertise in Oracle EBS or other ERP processes and data models to understand user requirements, identify the tables involved, document and communicate those requirements to the development team.
Ability to assist and support business users in various areas to research and investigate data issues in the reports against the general ledger or subledgers.
Knowledge of core business processes (Manufacturing, Cost Accounting, Logistics, Order management and/or Procurement) obtained by directly working in one of these functions is preferred.
Familiar with business intelligence concepts, ability to collaborate with end users to define metrics and business requirements.
Experience with the concept and design of data schemas utilizing different cloud tools such as Azure, GCP, AWS, Snowflake, etc.
Strong desire to grow and learn new business processes, technologies and ERP data models
Proficiency and fluency in financial data
Intermediate SQL skills.
Knowledge of dimensional modeling and ETL processes and tools.
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to promote positive working relationships.
Ability to effectively manage multiple demands in a rapidly changing, team-based environment.
Experience in the training of end-users in new and/or modified system environments.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

About IFG Companies

IFG Companies, founded in 1985, is one of America’s largest privately held, property and casualty A-rated insurance groups in the United States. As a private company, IFG is focused on profitable growth through superior underwriting of a range of products and service to its producers and insureds.

LOCATION

IFG Companies is hiring in Arizona, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, New Jersey, North Carolina, and case-by-case in New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Texas and Virginia. Applicants must reside in one of these states to be hired. Remote and flexible work arrangements are provided to all employees based on manager approval.

SALARY RANGE

The expected salary range is $115,000 to $130,000 and subject to change at any time at the discretion of the Company.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst will assist business stakeholders and operations gain data driven insights. Partner with underwriting, operations, Actuarial and marketing to develop and provide insights and analysis on trends and facilitate our business, including development and maintenance of underlying data tables. Designs and program new processes and dashboards following corporate data governance model.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES

Work with business partners through the analysis of quantitative and qualitative data using data querying.
Develop Quality Control measures for the reports and dashboards.
Designs and develops new reports, dashboards, data tables, etc. to provide speed-to-data insight
Enhance the efficiency, automation, and accuracy of existing reports by using standard data definitions as per business community.
Work with Business community to define standard definitions of data elements. Build and maintain data dictionary.
Follow best practices in data querying and manipulation to ensure data integrity.
Effectively communicate information to technical and non-technical audiences.

Job Purpose: The Import Planning Analyst will support the various analytical and data needs of the Planning team. This position is responsible for maintaining appropriate in-stock levels in a rapidly growing and ever-evolving business. The Planning Analyst will work cross-functionally with Sales, Customer Care, Operations, Purchasing, and other groups to identify opportunities and support key initiatives.


Duties and Responsibilities:

Responsible for providing a monthly purchase plan to the import purchasing department to support sales in the core business along with supporting any league requirements. This work is done using a combination of M3 ERP systems and Logility Supply Planner system.
Provide weekly expedite report for imported finished goods to maintain the highest service levels and to ensure on-time delivery of customer orders.
Provides guidance to Sales and Customer Care on the availability of product by analyzing incoming receipts against demand.
Manages system parameters to control desired stock levels at each DC and accurate supplier lead times in receiving warehouses.
Manages system parameters to control back order date reporting in the event we are OOS or the customer order is more than our current availability.
Works cross functionally to support business initiatives and service objectives including but not limited to new style launches, league opportunities, large special orders.
Analyzes production data, including Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and takes the actions required to meet departmental and company goals.
Maintain the appropriate in-stock positions and manage inventory across multiple distribution centers.


Skills/Qualifications/Education/Licenses & Certifications:

Associate’s Degree in Business or related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and training that provides the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to perform the job.
Skilled user of Microsoft Office applications. Advanced knowledge of MS Excel preferred. (pivot tables, nested “if” statements).
Ability to meet aggressive deadlines; supporting multiple projects in a fast-paced, dynamic, and team-oriented work environment.
Must be results-driven, adaptable, detail oriented and organized.
Demonstrates the ability to analyze data, identify root causes, opportunities, and concerns.
Exhibits excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Oral and written fluency in Spanish preferred.


Competencies:

Teamwork: Working as a productive member of a cohesive group toward a common goal, and contributing to team development and effective team dynamics.

Customer Focus: Knowing the (internal and external) customer business needs and acting accordingly; anticipating customer needs, and giving high priority to customer satisfaction and customer service.

Problem Solving: Having the ability to identify problems and issues of varying complexities and to find effective solutions with few guidelines.

Adaptability: Maintaining effectiveness in reaching set goals by adapting to changed circumstances, tasks, responsibilities, and people.

Initiative: Spotting opportunities within a circle of influence; anticipating threats and acting on them; self-starting rather than waiting passively until the situation demands action.


Teamwork: Demand Planning, Product Development, Manufacturing, Purchasing, Import Planning, Engineering.


Physical Demands: No physical demands.


Work environment: hybrid – will work 6 days per month in our Grovetown, GA office, while working other days from home.
