Position Purpose:

A Sr Data Analyst Supply Chain leverages proven technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. Responsible for working collaboratively among other talented analysts to apply established and create new analytical processes on diverse datasets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. Also ensures that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are completed competently in a timely manner, continually seeks out opportunities to learn new and hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and operates under minimal supervision and mentorship of more experienced managers and data scientists.


Key Responsibilities:
30% Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests
20% Executes existing reporting and analytical responsibilities
20% Ensures the quality of work output by displaying a keen attention to detail
20% Presents findings in easily understood ways, focuses on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture
10% Develops additional technical competencies and subject matter expertise within core functional group

Direct Manager/Direct Reports:
This position reports to Manager or Sr Manager
This position has no Direct Reports

Travel Requirements:
Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

Physical Requirements:
Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles.

Working Conditions:
Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.

Minimum Qualifications:
Must be eighteen years of age or older.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Preferred Qualifications:
2-4 years work experience in data mining, statistical analysis, auditing, and/or forecasting.
An intermediary understanding of SQL or working directly with MS Access joining relational tables together and/or some knowledge of one other scripting/compiled/statistical programming language (e.g. VBA, Python, R, SAS, .NET, C++, Java, etc.)
Experience building reports/analyses with analytical tools (e.g. Excel, JMP, SAS, Mathematica, SPSS, Tableau, etc.)
Prior direct experience in analyzing the relevant subject matter (e.g. Supply Chain, Merchandising, Operations, etc.)
B.S. in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Finance, or related quantitative field.
Work experience with MS Excel, MS Access, SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or comparable database systems.

Minimum Education:
The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.

Preferred Education:
No additional education

Minimum Years of Work Experience:
2

Preferred Years of Work Experience:
No additional years of experience

Minimum Leadership Experience:
None

Preferred Leadership Experience:
None

Certifications:
None

Competencies:
Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving.
An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying story being told within the data.
Strong written and verbal communications skills. Ability to persuade, inform, and influence others based on findings. A track record of taking complex results and communicating them in an easily understood way.
Superior interpersonal skills and ability to collaborate actively and work in a team environment.
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies, tools, and techniques.

Responsibilities:
Provides administrative support to the Human Resources Functions related to the Employee Relations Department. Duties require the exercise of courtesy in speaking with hospital staff, visitors, and others to maintain sound public relations. Administers human resources policies and procedures that pertain to employee relations. Researches and analyzes data, provides management with reports on any employee relations issues and possible resolutions. Performs employee counseling, equal employment opportunity, disability services, and labor relations. Investigates and documents employee complaints and disputes and recommend appropriate course of action. Educates new and current employees on employee relations policies.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for handling any Employee Relations related inquiries, data entry, reporting and reconciliation tasks as appropriate.
Performs transactions related to Employee Relations with a high degree of accuracy and strict adherence to written procedures.
Maintains knowledge of organizational and departmental policies and procedures. Providing education on benefits, leave of absences, payroll, HR processes to new hires, employees and managers.
Responds to incoming correspondence/calls from employees for all Employee Relations related inquiries. References company policies and procedures to ensure accuracy of response and to offer all available information. Determines and addresses any unstated needs. Recognizes when escalation of a situation is necessary. Records the details of each call. Maintains confidentiality of all HR related information.
Manages and monitors multiple means of incoming communication/requests from employees, including but not limited to voicemail, email, USPS mail, fax, cases, etc.
Provides information related to HR operations and policy to employees.
Utilizes a system to document details of inquiries to include transaction type, troubleshooting steps, database management, and steps taken to meet the customer’s request. Utilizes the HR knowledge base and case management system and other tools to actively manage caseload in accordance with team production goals and established quality standards.
Utilizes the HR knowledge base and case management system to run reports that will identify trends of concerns.
Proactively escalates issues to ensure the timeliest service. Serves as a customer advocate and represents the company in a professional manner.
Practice proper safety techniques in accordance with Hospital and departmental policies and procedures. Immediately report any mechanical or electrical equipment malfunctions, unsafe conditions, or employee/patient/visitor injury/accidents to their supervisor.

Required:
High School Diploma or equivalent (GED).
Two (2) years of Human Resources OR customer service related experience.
High degree of emotional intelligence.
Strong communication and organizational skills.
Strong customer services skills and attitude.
Ability to work with many different people with different personalities.
Strong multi-tasking ability and ability to work through ambiguity.
General knowledge of Human Resources policies and procedures and Healthcare compliance.
Ability to work with a team to create effective departmental strategies and meet team goals.
Strong personal computer skills, including spreadsheet and database usage, Excel and Microsoft Word. Must be technology savvy and highly organized.
Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings &/or weekends.
Ability to work well with others in a team environment.
Competent with Microsoft Office Tools and type 40-wpm.
Preferred:
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university.
Two (2) years of HR Shared Services experience, representing HR/Health insurance industry.
Competent with Microsoft Excel.

As the Technology Support Lead Analyst, you will join a team of professionals charged with managing support services for Chick-fil-A's corporate staff. We serve over 4,000 people through a managed service provider, offering service desk, walk-up support, and laptop delivery. Responsibilities include setting strategy for support services that scale with business growth, reviewing interactions to enhance customer experiences, and managing the service provider to ensure effective daily operations and continuous improvement. This role combines strong technical skills and leadership responsibilities with an emphasis on delivering a high level of customer service.

Design and constantly refine service desk support function to provide excellent user experiences.
Partner with service provider to explore opportunities to improve the support services by collecting customer feedback, analyzing performance metrics, and researching industry best practices.
Hold service provider accountable to negotiated service levels and address performance issues, as needed.
Proactively determine recurring customer issues and work with stakeholders to ensure appropriate resolution.
Cultivate and encourage the creation of a robust set of documented knowledge base articles for supported services and devices to ensure Service Desk agents can respond to our users' needs.
Cross-train and assist in other functional areas including Executive Support, laptop depot, and walk-up support.
Forecast future business needs and develop strategies to support company growth.
Serve as an escalation point for support issues beyond the service provider.
Ensure a consistent customer experience by establishing key partnerships with other support teams within the technology department and throughout the business to develop and maintain support policies, procedures, and processes.
Ensure escalation groups are held accountable to resolve issues following agreed-upon support policies, procedures, and processes.
Remain knowledgeable about emerging technology trends by attending conferences, pursuing certifications, establishing personal networks, and benchmarking.

Experience with ServiceNow platform
Project management experience
ITIL Foundations

HR Technology Analyst - (23000819)
Description


A Career at Rheem: Where Comfort Is Your Calling

At Rheem, we’re dedicated to bringing comfort to people’s lives. And, as a leading global manufacturer of heating, cooling and water heating equipment, we’re innovating all-new ways to deliver just the right temperature while saving energy, water and supporting a more sustainable future. It’s an exciting challenge that requires a team of talented, passionate people with a diverse set of skills. From engineers to accountants, sales professionals to support experts, Rheem depends on people to power our innovations. Join Rheem and help shape the future of products that impact people’s lives—every day.

The HR Technology Analyst is responsible for configuring, implementing, and delivering Oracle Fusion HCM solutions and extend HCM functional support to achieve business goals. This role also supports Rheem’s global and business wide HR projects and provides solutions to optimize implementation and HCM support. Reporting to the Senior Manager of HR Technology at Rheem, this position is located in Atlanta, Georgia.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

Perform operational and support activities on Oracle Fusion HCM required to enable, leverage & manage the global workforce
Design, develop, test, and implement innovative solutions in Oracle Fusion HCM to provide superior HR functions
Manage and maintain global employee footprint
Collaborate with stakeholders and perform requirements gathering to ensure that HR functions meet Rheem’s business objectives
Set up, document, and test the Oracle system; understand and apply Oracle methodologies
Stay in the know on leading industry trends and new Oracle HCM features and seek out the best solutions for Rheem
Produce operational and ad hoc reports and dashboards of varying complexity for Rheem’s HR applications to review and analyze data and provide trends and insights
Ensure data integrity and confidentiality within HCM modules and integrations
Complete data entry and loading of data as needed
Support technical processes related to all Enterprise HR programs (merit, bonus, benefit execution, payroll, talent, performance, recruitment, reporting, integrations, security, learning management, employee listening/surveys, etc.)
Engage externally and internally to share best practices


Qualifications


WHAT YOU NEED

B.S. required, preferably Computer Science, Mathematics, Human Resource Management / Human Capital Management or related fields.
5+ years of experience in Oracle Fusion HCM at a large organization throughout full delivery life cycle
Experience through organizational change, with a demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity, and innovation, including evidence of solution design
Excellent problem-solving skills
Project management skills; demonstrated ability to manage work across multiple projects with varying degrees of complexity and timing
Hands-on experience with HR data visualization and analytics, HCM analytics a plus



HOW TO STAND OUT

Oracle Cloud Certification in:
Human Resources (Core HR) Cloud
Payroll Cloud
Recruiting Cloud
Compensation Cloud
Talent Management Cloud
Experience with UKG Dimensions - Pay Rules, Accrual Rules, Attendance Policies, and Time Clock support

ADP is hiring a Business Analyst.

Do you enjoy using data driven analysis to solve problems across people, process and technology?
Are you looking to join a fast-paced, inclusive environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging?
Do you enjoy collaborating with different stakeholders and team members while staying aligned to team objectives and goals?

ADP is hiring a Business Analyst for the HRO Operations Business Transformation Team to apply analytical, technical, and business management skills to support projects from end-to-end strategy through execution in an internal consulting role. The Business Analyst must have a foundational understanding of business and technology and be willing to learn and adopt business transformation methods for project deployments. Strong communication skills, critical/strategic thinking and problem analysis are a must. Reporting directly to a Director or Sr. Manager of Business Transformation, this person will be a key member of the team with experience working collaboratively across multiple stakeholder groups, organizational levels, and functional areas to achieve results. This role has no direct reports. The ideal candidate may find themselves asking the questions "how can I make this even better" and relishes the thought of driving change to make a meaningful impact to the organization.

A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now!

WHAT YOU'LL DO: Responsibilities

You are:

A graduate with a Business, Information Systems, or Analytics background with the ability to support and execute programs by leveraging people, process, technology, and data to achieve desired business results. You are a highly motivated self-starter inspired by working with cross-functional teams to successfully deliver and deploy top executive initiatives from strategy through to execution. You possess capabilities in the areas of problem solving, strategic thinking, and business analysis.

What you can expect on a typical day:

You will:

Execute projects related to change management, org design, op model design, data analysis, and tech adoption across HRO and be willing to learn areas outside of comfort zone
Possess strong written and verbal communication skills and problem-solving analysis skills
Analyze data and recognize patterns; be able to connect the dots
Have the desire to improve and transform work and be open to new ways of doing things as well as learning about business transformation capabilities
Have strong time management skills and the ability to prioritize, multi-task and address issues quickly as needed to meet deadlines
Create and own business transformation strategies and plans for the projects you work on with guidance from senior team members
Use MS PowerPoint and Excel proficiently when building solutions. This includes putting together presentations for different audiences to using v-look up functions and creating pivot tables as needed to create meaningful and easy to understand insights

TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Required Qualifications

Business Transformation Competency:

Learn proficiently or understand change and adoption methodologies such as leader alignment, stakeholder analysis, change impact assessment (tech and business process), communications, training, change measurement and adoption tracking, survey development and data story telling
Experience in business analysis and creating reports and presentations for senior leaders focused on telling the story
Business Process improvement and analysis experience, business case analysis and development is a plus
Understand patterns between people, process, technology, data and products and how they all fit together
Experience in rolling out large-scale technology adoption/implementation transformation efforts
Technical training development and execution, as needed as related to new technology and processes

Behaviors:

Strong attention to detail
Strong time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
Ability to structure and manage project work and own the work you do
Open to learning and taking guidance from senior team members
Analytical mindset
Strategic thinker
Action and solutions-oriented
Strong cross-functional and team collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills

BONUS POINTS FOR THESE: Preferred Qualifications

Big-4 management consulting and/or Fortune 500 internship experience
Knowledge of Salesforce and Tableau is helpful to create meaningful dashboards, insights and interpret data
Industry knowledge of all pertinent HR, Payroll and Benefits policies and procedures

YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:

Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights.
Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences.
Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment with plenty of opportunities to progress.
Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner.
Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones.
Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life.
Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another.
Join a company committed to giving back andgenerating a lasting, positive impactupon the communities in which we work and live.

We are looking for an intelligent, passionate, and data-driven Senior Analyst to join our Intelligence team full-time. The Marketing Analyst will work with our marketing teams to drive in-depth insights for marketing campaigns. The Senior Performance Marketing Analyst will be responsible for leading analysis, reporting, and processes related to insights that help drive marketing decision-making and strategy. The role is both data and insights-driven, with a focus on improving Paid Media campaigns and channels through ongoing optimization and technology enhancements. The ideal candidate will have direct experience with similar marketing analytics positions on cross-functional marketing teams.

Nebo is a human-centered agency built on a culture of respect, professional growth and care for every employee. With numerous perks, including hybrid in-office/remote work or fully remote work options designed to fit your needs, unlimited PTO, and free attendance to local marketing events, join this fun-loving team that occasionally talks Slack Smack.

Senior Performance Marketing Analyst Duties

Lead exploratory projects to understand new sources of data and new tools
Develop new methods for analysis based on shifting media and technology landscapes
Build and own analytical tools and solutions addressing our client’s business needs and enable better decisions by leadership
Lead complex analytics requirements conversations, communicate with stakeholders to plan analysis approach and guide key decisions
Join paid and web data to create full-funnel customer analytics across channels
Unify data and tell data stories using large datasets in easily digestible ways
Translate complex business questions into sound data analysis for marketing and non-marketing stakeholders
Ability to provide a point of view on marketing performance, optimal spend allocation, actionable insights, and business decisions based on campaign performance
Develop analysis methodology, mine, and analyze data and provide recommendations and insight around specific marketing questions

Business Intelligence and Automation Analyst (BI Analyst)




Find your more with Mohawk!


At Mohawk Industries, we’re committed to more – more customer solutions, more process improvements, more sustainable manufacturing, and more opportunities for our people.





As a Fortune 500, global flooring leader with some of the best-known brands in the industry, Mohawk is a great place to start or develop your career with an emphasis on more of what’s important to you. Come find your “more” with Mohawk!




What we need:




Mohawk is looking for BI and Automation Engineer to develop automation, analytics and BI solutions for our North American Customer Experience team.




This role will perform statistical analysis using data from multiple sources, utilizing Python, R and/or Power Automate to automate highly manual and error-prone process to improve downstream execution, reduce process variation, improve reliability of data, and reduce back office waste. The BI and Automation Engineer will also create visualization tools and dashboards to guide business decisions.




What you’ll do:




Design, develop and maintain scalable, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc.

Maintain and add to existing automation framework for Data, API, Web and other applications

Develop and execute comprehensive suites of automation test plans, test cases for inclusion in regression, automation for newly integrated features, and development of tool sets to augment QA and Development testing

What you have:




Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics or related field

1+ years of experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into operational/business planning

Experience with Power BI, SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), SAP ECC, MS Azure and with SAP C4/HANA (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Commerce Cloud, Customer Data Cloud) (preferred)

What you’re good at:




Exercising independent judgment and demonstrating solid time management and organizational skills, including the ability to meet tight deadlines and schedules

Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Mohawk’s vertically integrated manufacturing and distribution processes provide competitive advantages in the production of carpet, rugs, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone and vinyl flooring. Our industry-leading innovation has yielded products and technologies that differentiate our brands in the marketplace and satisfy all remodeling and new construction requirements. Our brands are among the most recognized in the industry and include American Olean, Daltile, Durkan, IVC, Karastan, Marazzi, Mohawk, Mohawk Home, Pergo, and Quick-Step. During the past decade, Mohawk has transformed its business from an American carpet manufacturer into the world’s largest flooring company with operations in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Europe, India, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Russia and the United States.

The Senior Analyst, Promotion Operations will lead analytics involving the U.S. Animal Health Business encompassing roughly $2B of revenue and over 30k customers. The individual will need to support the ED, Pricing and Promotions - in leading the Indirect Transaction Processing team on day-to-day processes, but also cover on ad hoc projects where needed. This role will act as a floor leader and interpret technical issues into business speak to help provide clarity to management on current issues and proposed solutions. The individual will be expected to identify potential cross team process opportunities which will increase efficiencies and accuracy across the business. The individual will be responsible for both written and verbal communications to the business and customers which will be customized to the recipient. As an employee of Boehringer Ingelheim, you will actively contribute to the discovery, development, and delivery of our products to our patients and customers. Our global presence provides opportunity for all employees to collaborate internationally, offering visibility and opportunity to directly contribute to the companies' success. We realize that our strength and competitive advantage lie with our people. We support our employees in several ways to foster a healthy working environment, meaningful work, diversity and inclusion, mobility, networking, and work-life balance. Our competitive compensation and benefit programs reflect Boehringer Ingelheim's high regard for our employees.

Duties & Responsibilities

Continuous Improvement / DELIVER & SEEK:

Follows and updates approved processes.
Provides input on opportunities to improve current processes and procedures.
Analyzes data and interprets trends.
Identifies potential issues via analysis to help avoid larger issues downstream.
Displays agility to run forensic analysis on ad hoc issues to identify root cause issues and solution.
Develops and reports on key operational performance measures to monitor processing level of effort, accuracy, and compliance.

Internal Control & Audit / INTEGRITY, DELIVERY & PROTECT:

Ensures adherence to risk control checklists, provides coordination and assistance for audits as they are performed.
Leads testing as needed.
Supports process audit activities as defined by supervisor.
Role model for the department when adhering to guidelines and compliance principles.
Maintains customer data files, both electronic and hard copy, and comply with corporate retention guidelines.
Collaborates with fellow Commercial Excellence teams to ensure accurate and timely execution of responsibilities.

CUSTOMER SUPPORT:

Provides guidance to coach fellow team members tasked with resolving customer issues and ad-hoc inquiries.
Provides information support and customer service within a timely manner.
Follows approved processes and executes day-to-day activities accurately and efficiently.
Builds business relationships to pro-actively identify potential issues that may impact customers before issues are identified by customers, improves technical expertise, and utilizes available resources in a rapidly changing business and systems environment.
Ensures experience through customer-based touch points undergoes constant improvement measures.
Serves user community and builds relationships to understand the business needs.
Acts as the subject matter expert, partnering with Commercial Excellence Support team to facilitate responses to various customer inquiries.
Coordinates and collaborates with internal partners (e.g., Marketing and sales) and external customers (e.g., distribution) to effectively perform tasks.

SYSTEM AND DATA ANALYSIS:

Provides understanding of systems and business data to management via support of technically advanced or escalated ad-hoc requests.
Designs sophisticated queries, builds technically advanced reports, and influencing the design scope for automated reports.
Validates completion and accuracy of information provided on fulfilled requests by team members.
Encourages team members to investigate potential enhancements to provide higher quality reporting deliverables.
Initiates projects to forensically investigate root causes and leads solution implementation of team members, management, and business stakeholders.
Coordinates research of business reported discrepancies to seek resolution of issues.
Develops ad hoc reporting to evaluate potential process improvement opportunities and establish new ways of working to promote operational efficiencies.
Serves as a Key User for the Vistex System.

Additional Duties and Responsibilities

COMMUNICATION:

Communicates effectively with team members, management, high-profile customers and business stakeholders.
Shares experience and knowledge of tools, systems, and internal solutions resources with team members to improve communication channel effectiveness to exceed customer expectations.
Understands dynamic customer challenges and identifies effective solutions to pro-actively address customer, marketing and sales opportunities.
Directs team members to appropriate support resource for issue resolution to enable timely solution to customer challenges.
Ensures that existing processes and supporting documentation is kept current, readily available and leveraged in the day-to-day activities of the team members or for potential audit.
Professionally communicates and collaborates with fellow Commercial Excellence team members, internal business partners, sales managers, marketing teams, external data vendors and distributor channel partners as it relates to sensitive customer, sales and/or pricing/promotion information.
Develops and maintains good working relationship with external business partners to support our mutual customers and facilitate issue resolution as needed.

PROJECT SUPPORT:

Leads projects and encourages team member contribution that effectively supports task enhancement of varied size and complexity to achieve overall objectives.
Delivers assignments on time, with quality, across multiple priorities.
Promotes agility mindset to ensure that project progresses effectively.
Leads testing initiative and ensures quality assurances are met, and verifies information, calculations or transaction data is accurate and due diligence is achieved.
Participates on strategic projects or sub-teams as needed to execute objectives.
Demonstrates core process knowledge to perform activities and cross-checking activities to ensure high-quality deliverables are created.
Recommends process improvements, system enhancements and bug fixes to gain efficiencies in Vistex.
Launches new system functionality release cycles with IT, GBS and other groups as appropriate.
Provides and maintains process and system documentation to include integration with other systems.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience.
Five to seven (5-7) years progressive experience in IT, Marketing, Administrative, Finance, Accounting, Customer Service and/or relevant business experience.
Advanced ability to make quick decisions and prioritize for self and junior team members.
Strong communications skills.
Ability to customize communications both verbally and written for respective recipients.
Ability to lead without authority.
Demonstrated ability to organize, prioritize and balance multiple tasks simultaneously.
Expert analytical skills with very high capacity to translate data to the needs of the respective stakeholder.
Evidence of a focus on Continuous Process Improvement for use in problem solving of software issues, pricing / program calculations, and process flows.
Demonstrated understanding of the push/pull model behind discounts and rebates strategy, as well as the legal and compliance risks associated with such programs.
Process oriented individual with strong problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated understanding and ability to apply principles, concepts, practices, and standards including knowledge and use of Animal Health data with willingness to stay current on business and industry.
Ability to extract and manipulate data from multiple data sources (i.e., SQL databases, delimited text files, Excel, Access, etc.) and integrate them into a single source view/report.
Advanced report development and analytical skills using Excel including the ability to utilize functions is required.
Previous knowledge of reporting and data visualization applications such as Cognos, Tableau or Qlik highly preferred.
Strong working knowledge of databases, data extraction (SQL) and master data management practices required. Experience in Oracle, ModelN, GBSMDGx, SAP ERP, SAP S/4HANA environments highly preferred.

Experience and aptitude in subjects including distributor channel sales, inventory, transaction processing, contract pricing, rebate programs, incentive compensation, master data management and data stewardship practices highly preferred

Job Title: AP Analyst - Travel Card & Expense Reports
Job Description:
To support the functions and assist in administering the Wells Fargo Corporate Card program, the Purchasing Card program and the T&E expense report program, as well as, other Accounts Payable functions, including monthly reconciliations, fraud detection and corporate card misuse and monthly reporting.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Assists in managing the purchasing and travel card programs

Responsible for processing, paying and reconciling all card transactions and ensuring all process and program controls are adhered to consistently

Reviews corporate card exception and delinquency reports; Maintains and assists in enforcing company rules in accordance with the corporate travel card and purchasing card policies

Performs key department system and process reconciliations, system controls functions and exception identification and resolution in accordance with department policies and procedures

Liaison to the Bank Representative for the Purchasing and Travel card programs to support routine reporting requirements and implementation of new processes

Audit, verify, and import expense reports for Operations and Support Center Employees; Ensures appropriate support is submitted in accordance with Company Travel Policy; Escalate and report abuse of policy as necessary

Provide high level of customer service and support to all internal departments and external customers and act as a key liaison for the Accounts Payable department

Ensure that enrollment forms and employee agreements are completed correctly and filed appropriately and authorize, issue, and terminate cards

Maintains I-Expense templates, categories, mileage rates, and expense types; Responsible for working with IT for system issue resolution

Communicate with various levels of employees regarding I-Expense processes and procedures; Train new users on I-Expense for initial set up and functionality; Set up bank information so employees may be paid via Direct Deposit

Work with IT to resolve approval and Oracle related issues within I-Expense

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS

Four year bachelor's degree, Accounting/Finance degree preferred

1 to 2 years of progressive AP Experience in a high volume environment with exposure to Full Cycle AP processes preferred

P-Card and I-Expense (or equivalent) experience preferred

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS or ABILITIES

Ability to work in restaurant or multi-unit retail systems

Demonstrates a high ability to communicate effectively with people inside and outside the organization, including operations, support center, and vendors

Has demonstrated positive leadership skills and a commitment to company objectives

Proficient in Excel, Word, and Database applications in a windows environment

Ability to interpret and analyze data and make recommendations based on findings

Plans and completes work effectively and efficiently, meets assigned deadlines, and makes sound decisions

Ability to multi-task and shift priorities

Must be detail oriented


Inspire Brands is a multi-brand restaurant company whose portfolio includes nearly 32,000 Arby’s, Baskin-Robbins, Buffalo Wild Wings, Dunkin’, Jimmy John’s, and SONIC Drive-In restaurants worldwide.


We’re made up of some of the world’s most iconic restaurant brands, but we’re much more than just a restaurant company. We’re a team of hundreds of thousands who individually and collectively are changing the way people eat, drink and gather around the table. We know that food is much more than a staple—it’s an experience. At Inspire, that’s our purpose: to ignite and nourish flavorful experiences.

At Kids2, we’re really good at what we do. And when we’re great at our jobs, we help parents be great at their jobs.
Parenting is demanding, and that’s where we come in. We want to reimagine how brands can make it easier for early stage parents – not by just selling them products, but by providing holistic solutions that transcend borders, categories and aisles.
No matter our title or department, at Kids2, our job is to create more tiny wins for parents, so they can create bright futures for their little ones. That’s a big task!
We’re serious about what we do, AND we love to have fun. Our team is hardworking, entrepreneurial, and passionate about helping families create millions, if not billions of tiny wins.
SUMMARY
Support the Account Team to drive sales and long-term initiatives with customer interaction and communication. The sales analyst provides sales reporting and data analytics for the account team to drive key decision making and success measurement of the business relative to sales. The Sales Analyst creates and maintains weekly and monthly reports regarding sales trends including point of sale data and customer inventory metrics. Sales Analysts play a key role in the monthly forecast consensus process by providing key inputs to the forecast. The Sales Analyst is expected to maintain the account business plan and provide forecast and planning guidance to the sales and demand teams based on the most up to date data and customer intelligence.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Holistically support account team with data, reporting and regular analysis to identify and execute business opportunities
Maintenance of the account business plans for account responsibilities
Weekly reporting/tracking using customer POS data: Sales, Inventory, Promotions, New Items, etc
Prepare monthly segment trend, competitive analysis, and promotional analysis along with insights using POS and syndicated data
Generate item level and account-level forecasts for assigned accounts
Review forecast exceptions weekly to ensure forecast and orders are in-sync
Work with sales managers to ensure all set quantities, promotions, item expansions and exits are captured in the forecast
Generate trend reports and analysis to help determine changes to replenishment strategies, determine necessary forecast changes, and recommend changes to the assortment as necessary
Review and compare customer forecast and Kids2 forecast to identify key differences, determine reasons for differences, and drive to a consensus forecast
Interaction, Communication, and Collaboration with the account (Buyer, Replenishment team, Inventory Analyst)
Monitor and influence demand forecast for account responsibilities
Gather and analyze data to understand problems and address them proactively
Provide Ad-hoc support and analysis as needed
Maintain technical skills on appropriate software applications to provide optimum level of support
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Retail and Analytics experience preferred
Demonstrates ability to analyze data and make appropriate recommendations
Demonstrates business curiosity, drive for results and learning on the fly
Advanced Excel experience with pivot tables, graphs, and reporting
EDUCATION & SKILLS
4-year college degree in business, engineering, or related field
English-conversational and writing
Retail Link and other retail portals
High level of organization and detail-orientation
Plans and manages effectively.
Critical thinking and problem solving
Focuses on the customer.
Communication: Internal and external
Excellent communication skills and working with cross functional groups and customer
Ability to consult with account teams and proactively identify appropriate
Communicate and work collaboratively internally and customer
Demonstrated ability to work independently
Service oriented
Learning agility
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS
None required.
COMPUTER/TYPING SKILLS
Must be proficient in PowerPoint, Excel and Word
PHYSICAL DEMANDS
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; have flexible use of hands; and talk or hear.
The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and color vision.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
General office environment.
We offer competitive pay, flexible hours, and generous benefits. Plus, to keep things fun (because we are all kids at heart), we offer a host of team member activities and philanthropic efforts throughout the year and company-wide awards and recognition for a job well done!
Check out our website at www.kids2.com and our social media pages on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram for more information and open positions in the career section.
Drug Free Workplace M/F/D/V

Who We Are

Cadence is committed to serving the lifelong needs of our customers. That’s a commitment made possible by our exceptional teammates. Our team members are what set us apart. What The Role Is
The Senior Risk Business Analyst will assist with all of the monitoring of the Company’s enterprise risk management tracking and facilitation of reports, to include maintaining policies, procedures, reports and meeting minutes or notes, participating in risk assessments, and assisting in preparing meeting packets for internal management and board committees. This position is hybrid.





How You will Make an Impact

Function as a contact for Model Risk concerns within the ERM Department of the Company.
Maintains up-to-date Model Risk Management Policy and provides updated information to the Model Risk Manager for reporting to Committees.
Provides Model Risk Management Policy to appropriate staff /departments as policy is revised and reaffirmed.
Provides support and guidance to staff / departments / model owners relative to the correct application of the Model Risk Management Policy as it applies to respective model operations within each business line.
Maintains and updates the enterprise-wide Model Inventory as well as the Non-Model Sophisticated Spreadsheet Inventory and circulates updated information to Internal Audit for use during audits of model owners.
Conducts validations of statistical models.
Participates in the solicitation and evaluation of model validation proposals from suitable vendors for those models targeted for external validation.
Tracks model validations (internal and external) to determine each model is validated at the frequency indicated within the Model Inventory. Obtains copy of validation report, management’s response to findings (if applicable) and support documentation on each validation.
Tracks all model validation findings and performs follow-up reviews to confirm resolution actions taken by model owners to address noted findings are well documented and complete.
Performs and documents routine quarterly reviews of each model operation to determine appropriate ongoing monitoring procedures are in place, support documentation evidence monitoring has been performed, and frequency of tests are appropriate for the respective model being reviewed.
Conducts an annual enterprise-wide Model Risk Assessment in consultation with model owners.
Assists in other ERM projects as assigned.
Reports any observed illegal or unethical behavior, violations of the Code of Conduct, or any known weaknesses/breaches in internal control.



Who You Are

Master's in a quantitative discipline with 3-5 years experience or PhD in a quantitative discipline with 1-2 years experience
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Suite; knowledge of database infrastructure is a plus (Microsoft SQL preferred)
Quantitative, analytical and/or statistical skill-set is desired.
Ability to evaluate processes, identify risk, and evaluate controls.
Excellent documentation and organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Must be a team player.
Must be a self-starter and excel at time management.

This position will be responsible for supporting the financial and budgetary planning functions at MSM. The Financial Analyst will possess a broad knowledge of financial analysis and management skills. The Financial Analyst is responsible for developing financial data and analysis to inform the department/unit’s leadership on operational, financial, and strategic decision-making.
Responsibilities/Duties:
Consolidate and analyze financial data.
Provide creative alternatives and recommendations to reduce costs and improve financial performance.
Assemble and summarize data to structure sophisticated reports on financial status and risks.
Develop financial models, conduct benchmarking and process analysis.
Conduct business studies on past, future and comparative performance and develop forecast models.
Identify trends, advise and recommend actions based on sound analysis.
Track and determine financial status by analyzing actual results in comparison with forecasts.
Reconcile transactions by comparing and correcting data.
Consult with management to guide and influence long term and strategic decision making within the broadest scope.
Drive process improvement and policy development
Propose improvements to systems and methods of work and analysis and contribute to ensuring that they are continuously adapted to business requirements.
Monitors the data integrity of service line profitability reporting and the decision support system.
Develops revenue/expense projections based upon financial factors.
Prepares various analytics, feasibility studies, ROIs, and leadership reports as needed.
Develops/recommends improved monitoring and reporting operation methods and quality performance data.
Supports the annual budget process with volume and financial projections.
Collects and analyzes data and coordinates the reporting of key financial metrics on a monthly and ad hoc basis.
Analyzes new opportunities/relocations in consideration of business objectives, space, and capital requirements and ROI projections.
Reviews actual vs. budget performance monthly and assists with budget variance explanations for needed Service Lines.


Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or a business-related discipline from a regionally accredited college or university is required; and
Minimum of five (5) years of progressive experience in business operations or relevant work experience; and
Strong interpersonal and communicative skills; and
Ability to convey and explain complex information in a simplified way to others; and
Proficiency in multi-tasking, time management, and in establishing and organizing priorities;


Preferred Qualifications
Master’s degree in business or healthcare administration is strongly preferred; and
Prior work experience in an academic, clinical, and/or research institution is strongly preferred; and
Experience in implementing the strategic mission of the institution.
Supervisory experience a plus.

Company Description
At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care.
Job Description

Primary Function of Position:

The Sr. Commercial Technologies Business Analyst works closely with stakeholders across the company to enhance and maintain the Salesforce CRM platform that helps drive global market penetration of Intuitive’s product portfolio. The organization will depend on you to understand the evolving needs of the business to improve collection, accuracy, and processing of data to support the strategic analysis of this data resulting in increased competitive strength of the company. In this role you will partner with leaders, business process owners, and users to optimize the processes, workflows, and functionality of our tools to maximize value. With a solid understanding of the business and future direction, you will recommend and implement key enhancements, drive training and change management, and ultimately change behaviors.

Roles & Responsibilities:

Serve as the Salesforce business knowledge consultant for 6,000+ worldwide personnel
Manage and enhance the enterprise-wide Salesforce customer relationship management (CRM) platform to drive adoption of Intuitive products
Improve system operating efficiencies, configuration, and accuracy of critical data
Ensure data hygiene by driving predictable outcomes and repeatable processes
Enhance Salesforce CRM usability and functionality
Manage all user profiles and interfaces, conduct system setup and customization
Design and develop solutions with the larger IT team by analyzing impact on interface integration including SAP, HANA, BOXI, Tableau, etc.
Support third party integration tools, including but not limited to Apttus CPQ, Tableau, TaskRay, Seismic, Qualtrics, Marketo
Execute Project Management activities for required platform defects and enhancements
Perform acceptance testing and sign off for enhancements and defects in testing sandbox and production environment
Create functional specification documentation for new functionality and maintain functional specifications for existing functionality
Maintain global standardization and identify opportunities to improve processes
Support Salesforce on new releases and quarterly updates
Evaluate new technology and add-ons to Salesforce platform
Using Email-to-Case provide first/second level support for user issues and ideas
Identify areas for platform improvement through case analysis
Develop processes & maintain data integrity and performance
Assist in enhancing mobile technology to save users time and energy allowing sales to focus on customer interactions
Define and collect business requirements from end users to meet evolving corporate needs and functionality gaps
Maintain ease of use and data integrity to allow for systematic, accurate sales targeting
Import/export data, conduct mass updates or deletions of data elements
Upload quarterly quotas, territory alignments, and supporting security settings
Maintain Data Privacy and comply with government regulations
Roll out new functionality and train business process owner/stakeholders
Introduce new hires to Salesforce best practices with sales training team
Qualifications

Skills, Experience, Education, & Training:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree or higher
A minimum 3+ years of experience as a Salesforce Business Analyst, Salesforce Administrator, or Salesforce Consultant
Salesforce Sales Cloud Certified strongly preferred
Experience successfully managing Salesforce.com within an organization, preferably 1000+ users
Extensive experience supporting various Salesforce.com Standard Objects including Accounts, Contacts, Opportunities, Products, Price Books, Cases, Leads, Campaigns, Forecasting, Reports and Dashboards
Ability to troubleshoot issues within Custom Objects, Custom Fields, Page layouts, Custom Tabs, Workflows, Triggers and various other components
Experience supporting Salesforce.com features including user management, case assignment configuration and approval processes
Ability to create Reports and Dashboards for end user consumption based on sales team needs and privacy requirements
Ability to work independently in a dynamic environment with minimal supervision
Excellent communication skills, attention to detail, and capability to support multiple projects concurrently
Demonstrate good interpersonal skills, ability to work with others in international team environment, effective interactions in cross department teams
Fluent (C1 minimum) in written and spoken English
Computer efficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required
Data Privacy experience preferred
Additional Information

Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases.

Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques

Preferred Requirements

Experience in data mining and sentiment analysis of social media datasets.

SUMMARY OF JOB PURPOSE:

The Southern Regional Education Board seeks to hire an Analyst II in their Data Services area. This person understands the importance of education in improving the economic mobility of students and, in turn, the vitality of the region. They will be responsible for conducting a variety of tasks in support of research projects, policy analysis and SREB commissions or initiatives aimed at providing policymakers with reliable data to inform sound policies.

SREB works with states to improve education at every level, from pre-K through Ph.D. Our vision is that all students in the SREB region will have high-quality educational opportunities that build on the rich diversity of the region and lead to productive, meaningful lives and robust economies.

SREB is a nonpartisan, nonprofit, organization based in Atlanta. We are an organization of professionals committed to our mission: helping states and educators improve student access and achievement to improve the social and economic vitality of the SREB region.

If you want to be a member of our team, we want you to apply!

What does an Analyst II do?

Collects, compiles and analyzes data.
Reports and/or presents results of analyses.
Assists with the development of research plans and data tools.
Produces literature reviews.
Interprets results of data analysis and communicates findings.
Responds to inquiries from stakeholders.
Monitors and interprets legal and regulatory requirements and other relevant issues pertaining to programs and initiatives; evaluates their impact upon the organization and stakeholders.
Develops surveys, conducts individual and group interviews and collects data through observations according to established research methods.
Focus of responsibilities may be research or policy.
Maintains timely and accurate documentation.
Assists with a variety of projects and initiatives related to department activities.
Contributes to the efficiency and effectiveness of the unit's service to its customers by offering suggestions and directing or participating as an active member of a team.
Represents the organization with dignity, integrity, and a spirit of cooperation in all relationships with staff and the public.

What does it take to be an Analyst II?

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in social sciences, education or a related field; AND four (4) years of professional research experience in an educational or public policy environment; OR an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.

Required Knowledge and Skills



Principles and practices of qualitative and quantitative research.
Advanced Excel skills.
APA writing style.
Data sampling and statistical analysis techniques.
Functions and operations of postsecondary institutions..
Principles and practices of project management.
Computer applications/software related to the work (e.g., project management or analytics software).
Record keeping practices and techniques.
Correct business English, including spelling, grammar and punctuation.
Principles and practices of reviewing documents for completeness and accuracy.
Skilled in interacting with a variety of individuals from various socio-economic, ethnic and cultural backgrounds, in person and over the telephone.
Using software to analyze data including statistical analysis (e.g., SPSS, STATA) and data analytics (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, SAS Visual Analytics).
Compiling and reviewing data and scholarly publications.
Interpreting, applying and explaining applicable laws, codes and regulations.
Preparing accurate and timely reports.
Performing accurate calculations.
Working without close supervision in standard work situations.
Use of a variety software packages to perform job duties.
Using initiative and independent judgment within general policy guidelines.


For this opportunity, we seek candidates who have the following attributes:

A passion for education.
Dedicated to improving the economic mobility of students.
Strong work ethic with a focus on continuous improvement.
Experience with workforce data
Experience in coding in R.
Ability to work collaboratively and independently.
Respect for inclusivity, demonstrating a commitment to equality and fairness.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, enabling effective collaboration with individuals from diverse backgrounds.
Successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.
Valid Driver’s License.
Ability to work a hybrid schedule in mid-town Atlanta
Occasional overnight travel may be required.


SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY

No supervisory responsibility.


Our commitment to our team members:

Compensation

To support SREB’s top priorities, compensation decisions balance internal equity and external competitiveness within the boundaries of financial feasibility. Salaries for new employees will be established at levels that recognize the individual’s skills and experience while considering the salary levels of current employees within the same job title and those performing comparable work within the parameters of discipline, function, and individual effectiveness.

Starting Salary Range: $60,973 - $ 68,595
Collaborative culture.
Environment that supports work life balance.
Opportunities to collaborate with diverse people, leverage their varied skills and experiences, and foster a culture of inclusivity.
Hybrid schedule.
Medical, dental and vision insurance.
Life and short-term disability insurance.
Flexible spending and health savings account options (FSA/HSA).
Health reimbursement account (HRA).
Additional voluntary life and long-term disability insurance options.
Very generous leave programs.
Outstanding 403b retirement plan.
Following employment, employees remaining in this position will be eligible for salary increases within the salary grade range up to $76,216. Employee tenure, performance, and organization compensation practices will impact earning potential.

Job Overview

Under minimal direction of their Manager, the Lead Software Compliance Analyst will support Software Asset Management (SAM) compliance activities related to identifying, building, and analyzing qualitative and quantitative data. The Lead Software Compliance Analyst will recommend, develop and implement comprehensive analyses to support SAM audits related to business process requirements for ensuring compliance. This work will cover both the server and the client software environments. The Lead Software Compliance Analyst will be the technical resource for the SAM team on the maintenance and enhancement of the SAM system in Service Now. The Lead Software Compliance Analyst will support and mentor other Analysts with any audit, compliance and process improvement activities. Additionally, the Lead Software Compliance Analyst will assist with Infrastructure process and policy improvements and other general compliance activities. Perform other duties as assigned. meaningful ways to

Understanding of multiple license types and software suites that allows for reporting and metrics development.

Track purchase records within the SAM tool to ensure data is accurate for license compliance analysis.
Collaboration with software suppliers and VARs on validation of software purchase history and entitlements.
Facilitate the business’ needs for ongoing technical support and upgrade protection on selected products by ensuring that maintenance, support and upgrade protection renewals are managed/handled/ordered in advance of their expiration.
Identify savings opportunities for renewals, software licensing, and support services.
Partner with Strategic Sourcing to maximize value creation and costs for software licensing, maintenance, and service offerings.
Collect information for budgeting, software compliance & inventory, contract summaries, and cost comparisons.
Introduce new ideas and processes which improve performance and productivity.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree required and 5-7 years of experience in Software Asset Management
We encourage candidates with either a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field to apply.
Knowledge/experience with programming desired

Role/Title: - Business Analyst 2 - Project Initiation
Onsite, Atlanta , Georgia
Agency Interview Type: Either Web Cam or In Person

This position is Hybrid (Remote and Onsite). The candidate first day is onsite and onsite on demand basis. Preference will be given to candidate local to Atlanta Metro area / State of Georgia. Indicate if candidate has full-time residency within the Atlanta Metro area, within the State of Georgia, or if candidate resides outside of the State of Georgia.

General Description
Under general supervision, the IT Business Analyst (BA) analyzes enterprise-wide customer business needs and participates in the planning, design and implementation of new or enhanced systems or reporting/analysis on multiple IT development projects.

Job Description
Seeking a Business Analyst (BA) who will primarily assigned to compiling and documenting scopes of work to facilitate new IT procurement/contracts. The scopes of work define the applicable boundaries, requirements, activities/tasks, deliverables/milestones, terms and conditions, etc. for purchasing goods/services. The BA will incorporate or gather requirements and related exhibits/appendices. BA will collaborate with business, IT, IT Security, Legal, and Procurement/Legal stakeholders. BA will obtain and assess vendor provided agreements and related materials. BA will prepare any additional documents as needed to facilitate procurement. BA will facilitate reconciling any conflicting items between parties. BA will assist in gathering and documenting selection criteria for proposal evaluations. Consultant shall represent GDOT interests and comply with Ethics/Code of Conduct rules of the State of Georgia. Consultant will be preparing materials to support procurement but will not be participating in the actual GDOT evaluation, selection, or contracting processes.
As time permits, BA may be assigned to GDOT IT Project teams to gather and translate business needs into in-house custom developed product/solution requirements. The BA will work hand-in-hand with business, project, and management teams. BA will solicit, understand, and analyze business needs, data, objectives, and processes. BA will translate user need into materials for successful IT initiation, design, and development. BA will conduct user interviews and joint-application-development (JAD) sessions. BA will identify business pain points and rank user stories/use cases potential to improve business effectiveness/performance. BA will clarify and document IT project scope, current/future state, business/application workflows, functional/system requirements, system interaction diagrams, reporting and training requirements, data mapping, logical data models, metadata, screen mock-ups, and test cases. BA will actively participate in the software development life cycle (SLDC) and transfer information to IT Project teams. BA will be responsible for demonstrating requirement traceability within work products. BA will validate requirements were met within developed products and facilitate completion of user acceptance testing. BA will assist project manager in getting dates from business units to complete reviews.

Responsibilities:
Participates in the demand management process to assist the business in establishing business cases, scope, and requirements relating to requests for new systems or existing system changes
Primarily support IT acquisition of products or services by developing scopes of work
Consults with project teams and architects to identify currently know solutions or performs market research
Gathers information/documentation from vendors or contractors
Translates business needs into requirements and functional/non-functional specifications
Gather, clarify/define, and document scope, business scenarios, workflows, requirements, etc.
Conduct interviews, workshops, and JAD sessions
Analyzes and validates business requirements and processes, identifies opportunities for process enhancement to benefit the Department, identifies gaps in information
Uses a structured process to define priorities and opportunities and/or works with stakeholders to define the minimum viable product (MVP) and options for improvements via subsequent phases
Produces required work artifacts
Communicates and presents clients business requirements to implementation teams
Creates systems models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and system architects
Works with the team to define acceptance criteria or other metrics/performance goals for the system
Provides status updates, completes weekly work time logs, updates work tickets weekly
Provide estimates and target dates for task completion for incorporation into project schedules or work tickets

Work Terms and Conditions

8AM - 5PM 40 hrs. per week

GDOT has NOT specified a number of days onsite vs remote. However, local candidates (i.e. able to come in office) will be preferred over an out of state candidates (i.e. remote worker). GDOT prefers candidates who can demonstrate they have the capability to work a hybrid work schedule which is a combination of remote and in-office work. Candidate capacity (i.e. days they could come into the office) to work a hybrid work schedule will be discussed during interviews.

The consultant will follow all applicable State of Georgia and GDOT policies, procedures, standards, guidelines, and accepted best practices.
The position end date is set for the end of the GDOT Fiscal Year. GDOT may exercise the option to renew contracts in one-year increments. Several successful consultants have continued working for several years with contract extensions. However, GDOT is under no obligation to extend contracts and may terminate employment at any time.
When teleworking or working remotely, consultant must have suitable internet connection and environment to comply with GDOT telework policies.
GDOT will reimburse authorized travel expense lodging and meals. GDOT will reimburse authorized travel use of a personal vehicle. Any travel expenses to start work or relocate to Georgia or will not be reimbursed. All travel expense reimbursement shall be in accordance with State Accounting Office Travel Policy: https://sao.georgia.gov/state-travel-policy

The Department has 13 holidays, which consultants are not allowed to work nor make up any time for those holiday weeks without managementand#39;s approval. Consultants are not to take extended leave during their first year of service (e.g. greater than 1 week).
Consultant must have cell phone which can be used for business calls.
GDOT does not provide free parking. All routine commuting expenses are the responsibility of the consultant.

Job Title: Inventory Management Analyst, June 2024 Executive Development Program
Job Description:
QUESTIONNAIRE-3-152
03

Serving the needs of all families with young children, Carter’s Inc. is the largest North American apparel retailer exclusively for babies and young children, encompassing Carter’s, OshKosh B’gosh, Skip*Hop and Little Planet brands. Meaningful work, constant learning, genuine people, and a community guided by core values that promote inclusion and innovation is in everything we do. There are many reasons to build your career at Carter's.

This role is responsible for optimizing the distribution of inventory to each store to maximize sales and profitability. The allocation analyst must be highly organized, attentive to detail, self-directed, and possess strong analytical skills as well as an innate sense of curiosity.

This role typically reports to the Sr Analyst / Manager, Inventory Management, and is based in our Buckhead office in our hybrid work environment (4 days/week in-office)

30%: Execute the inventory allocations for each item, multiple times/week
30%: Use analytics and critical thinking to shape the inventory strategy, being flexible to course correct and make data-driven decisions
Analyze store inventory at the style/size level, identify over and under performers and provide suggestions to improve
Ensure inventory is balanced across stores, considering sales volume, store type, and capacity of each store (weekly)
Ad hoc analysis to Planners identifying opportunities and risks(e.g. lost sales); markdown recommendations; and future buy recommendations (e.g. buy quantities, assortment)
20%: Create, build, and maintain partnerships with all levels of the organization
In partnership with the Planner, determine how much inventory of each item to allocate to stores (weekly) based on assortment/planning strategies
Manage weekly/monthly replenishment forecasts to the DC/Store Ops teams to help with workflow planning
Partner with OML team and assistant buyers on Order Management activities
Act as liaison to the field through proactive communication and addressing concerns
10%: Responsible for creating, managing and analyzing inventory purchase orders for both ecommerce and brick & mortar stores
Validate, write and troubleshoot POs for seasonal buys
Recommend inventory sharing opportunities across channels during product lifecycle
Report out on inbound receipts to cross-functional partners
10%: Summarize and communicate findings, insights and reporting to leadership

We’d Love to hear from you if:

Must have:

Detail-oriented
Ability to finish tasks on time with accuracy and consistency, easily recognize mistakes, and produce high quality work
Analytical / genuine curiosity
Ability to analyze data, and communicate key findings effectively to business partners and leadership
Can review multiple metrics and identify outliers when analyzing business opportunities
Creates strategies or solutions based off multiple data points
Strong communication
Able to share inventory concerns with business partners (e.g. Planners)
Communicates ideas or strategy clear and concisely
Can identify what and when information should be communicated to the leadership team and does so in a succinct matter
Knowledge of allocation/inventory principles, retail fundamentals, ad hoc reporting/analysis
Bachelor’s degree
Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 (3.2 GPA or higher strongly preferred)
Required to have graduated within 6 months of class start date
Must be able to start in the role full time by January 2024

Preferred skills and experience:

The ability to prioritize effectively while balancing feedback from multiple stakeholders
Proficient in developing strong relationships with all levels of the business
Ability to synthesize and communicate results clearly and effectively
Energetic self-starter
Highly organized with a strong attention to detail
Adept in diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues
Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills (Pivot tables, Vlookups, etc)
Retail store experience and/or knowledge of distribution and replenishment systems a plus

OUR Team Members:
Lead Courageously: Have a strong sense of personal values that align with our Company values
Collaborates Broadly: Build cooperation, trust, and thrive in a consensus driven environment
Customer Focus: Proactively seek opportunities to leverage data and fact-based insights to serve customers and/or internal clients
Drive Growth: Set aggressive goals and implement plans precisely
Cultivates Innovation: Respectfully challenge the "we’ve always done it this way" mentality and explore new ways to achieve desired outcomes
Make a career at Carter’s:
Career Development: Success starts from within, and we have several paths from which you can choose to enhance your career evolution. From Carter’s University to Toastmasters to mentorship programs and more, we encourage you to utilize these tools to elevate your professional prowess.

In order for your application to be complete, you must complete an assessment. This assessment should take about 10-15 minutes to complete. Please note: Your application will not be fully submitted until the assessment is complete.

Job Title: Office of Transportation Data- Transportation Specialist 2- TRP051- PG L- HPMS Senior GIS Statistical Analyst
Job Description:
Proficiency in GIS Software, Esri ArcGIS Suite REQUIRED

STATE PROFILE SUMMARY

Under general supervision, provides working level professional support in one or more of the following areas: OMAT, maintenance, construction, intermodal, planning, utilities, surveying, transportation data, environmental or traffic.




JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Under general supervision, manages the collection, processing, and reporting of transportation related data including traffic, traffic fatalities, GPS data, along with HPMS data for Federal Reporting to FHWA.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

The selected candidate must meet the advertised minimum qualifications to include State Entry Qualifications as well as Agency Specific Qualifications




STATE ENTRY QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in a related field AND Six months of related experience

OR Associate's degree in a related field AND One year of experience

OR One year at position equivalent.




AGENCY SPECIFIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Ability to read, interpret, and explain technical journals/manuals, program documentation, aerial photographs, maps, graphs, and charts, preferably with a demonstrated knowledge of but not limited to: FHWA's Traffic Monitoring Guide, FHWA’s Highway Performance Monitoring System, FHWA’s Highway Functional Classification Concepts, Criteria and Procedures
OR Three years of professional related experience in a related transportation field.
Ability in the use of GIS software, specifically the ESRI ArcGIS Suite, preferably with proficiency in ESRI ArcGIS analysis tools. Examples would include but are not limited to linear referencing toolbox, statistical analysis tools, table analysis and data management tools.
Knowledge of policy and procedures governing data collection technologies, data collection, coding requirements, and reporting procedures preferably in transportation data.
Knowledge of equipment and hardware/software used to collect and process data, preferably transportation data
Ability in the use of MS Office Suite including Word, Excel, and Access; preferably with proficiency including but not limited to: Pivot Tables, nested if statements, VLOOKUP, SQL, querying, table joining, etc.
Ability to identify and solve problems as well as apply innovative solutions to make organizational improvements.
Ability to work with staff, consultants, contractors, managers, and other department personnel in a professional and cooperative manner.
Displays a high standard of work ethics and commitment toward work.
Ability to effectively communicate, both in writing and verbally, ideas and facts to groups and individuals.
Committed to providing quality customer service and public service.



AGENCY PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, engineering, GIS, or related field.

OR Master’s degree in any field which included at least two courses in statistics or research methods.
