Benefits We Offer
Team members enjoy an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with employer match, paid time off, and sick leave, plus home and mortgage discounts. We also offer competitive salaries with the potential for discretionary bonuses and/or commission structure (depending on the position).

We Hire The Best
Our mission of building, financing, and insuring A Home For Every Dream™ is only possible with the best talent in the industry. If that’s you—if you’re a self-starter, changemaker, and thoughtful collaborator ready to take their career to the next level—then apply today!

What You’ll Do:
The Land Acquisition Analyst supports the Land Acquisition team with all aspects of land acquisition, from identifying potential land prospects to closing land transactions.

Your Key Responsibilities Include:

Finance/Market Feasibility Analysis
Prepare financial proformas and competitive market analyses to assist the land acquisition team to determine the viability of proposed land acquisitions.
Work with the entitlement and development teams and consultants to determine budgets and schedules to be used in proformas.
Coordinate with multiple departments to understand home construction costs and buyer preferences in proformas.
Review and analyze due diligence information for potential land investments.
Extract and analyze data from various sources, including the MLS, company databases, Metrostudy, LandVision, Zonda, and other external websites.
Prepare pre-acquisition investment summaries and related support material.
Post-acquisition – maintain financial proformas and competition analyses to assess ways to enhance existing communities' performance and report actual performance.
Land Proforma Submissions
With the guidance of Land Acquisition leadership, prepare detailed proformas and land packages with relevant support data for submittal to the Corporate Land Committee to seek approval of new land acquisition transactions.
Prepare follow-up analysis and forms necessary to transact said acquisitions.
Land Search Function
With the market priorities defined by Land Acquisition leadership, actively research, analyze, and identify potential land acquisition targets by extensively utilizing mapping and market data software.
Maintain a database and prepare reports that identify each acquisition target and track the status of each.
Perform preliminary feasibility/financial analysis on identified acquisition targets and present weekly updates and recommendations to Land Acquisition leadership.
Market Transactional/Entitlement Monitoring
Responsible for weekly monitoring of land transaction and entitlement activity in the Division's core markets to include weekly summary and update of notable residential land transactions and notable entitlement activities occurring in the Division's core markets.
Ad Hoc Projects
Assist Land Acquisition leadership with ad hoc projects as needed.
Market Strategy
Assist the Land Acquisition team in preparing the Land Acquisition Strategy annually.
Perform other duties as needed or assigned.

What You Have:

Highly organized with the ability to manage and prioritize workload.
Must be proficient in MS Office, especially Word and Excel, with exposure to GIS, Metrostudy, LandVision, and Zonda helpful.
Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills are a must.
Proven ability to multi-task required.
Strong desire to work in land acquisition.
Ability to analyze, interpret, summarize, and report data
Must be dependable, self-motivated, and proactive.

Your Education and Experience:

A Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent experience
A background in real estate or market research is desirable and professional knowledge of the home-building, and land brokerage industry is highly preferred.

Job Description

The Business Analyst is ultimately responsible for the facilitation and elicitation of requirements and documentation of those requirements for a specific project initiative. The Business Analyst creates/defines the business and functional requirements. The Business Analyst reviews test plans and verifies system functionality delivered for the project.

Responsibilities:

Lead the capture, review, and update business requirements
Produce deliverables based on IT Lead and SME guidance
Capture business capability matrix, detailed requirements, user stories, business rules, etc.
Create communication and training materials, as needed
Enforce Business Analysis standards, templates, and processes
Support the delivery of the Business Architecture by partnering with stakeholders and functional lead(s) to identify business process issues and capability needs
Liaise between technical and non-technical resource team members to answer day to day business questions either directly or indirectly as supported by the Business Leads and SMEs
Conduct walkthroughs with project team members and business leads
Understand and manage to defined project scope
Work with QA and Business SMEs (UAT) to ensure requirements traceability and coverage within test cases
Promote change management principles with executives, senior leaders, managers, and supervisors to influence, build relationships, and manage resistance
Provide support during end user training, prior to production deployments, and post production deployment, as needed

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business or Computer Science preferred
5+ years of Business Analysis experience preferred
3+ years of Commercial / Specialty Insurance industry experience preferred
3+ years of Duck Creek Policy (or similar PAS systems) experience preferred
Experience with Microsoft platforms including Microsoft Dynamics and SharePoint preferred
1+ years of Structured Query Language (SQL) experience preferred
Proficiency with software/systems commonly used to manage Programs/Projects (MS Word, Excel, MS Project, PowerPoint, Visio, TFS, Azure DevOps, JIRA)
Experience with Reinsurance is a plus
Experience developing Business Requirements Documents (BRDs), process diagrams, storyboards, use cases, and presentations
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently in person and remotely
Dedicated and detail oriented
Collaborative and conscientious team player
Excellent Analytical skills
For this position, we currently expect to offer a base salary in the range of 90k - 105k (GA). The specific salary offer will be based on an assessment of a variety of factors including the experience of the successful candidate and their work location. In addition, all employees are eligible for competitive incentive targets, with awards based on overall corporate and individual performance. On top of this, we offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes medical plans for employees and their families, health and wellness programs, retirement plans, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, and much more.

General Summary
The Dollar Tree / Family Dollar Import team manages the movement of all products sourced internationally. Logistics Analysts assist in the movement of containerized freight sourced globally for both Dollar Tree and Family Dollar brands. The primary goal of the Import department is to optimize the international and domestic supply chain while ensuring freight is received timely to support sales.
In this role, the Logistics Analyst will focus on Destination Operations, which includes overseeing the delivery of 80,000 containers and 20,000 domestic trailers to our 28 DC’s and 3 partner warehouses across the U.S. and Canada. In addition, the Logistics Analyst will be tasked with supporting merchandise objectives in order to meet sales goals.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities
Oversee enterprise destination operations which include drayage, transload operations, domestic transportation, and financial analysis as it relates.
Partner with service providers to establish and maintain compliance of all KPI’s and contract terms to include and on time delivery, chassis management, cost mitigation, and invoice accuracy.
Provide analytical and operations support to internal partners with the goal of ensuring allocation dates are met through priority reporting.
Maintain working knowledge of terminal and rail processes to support external partners and ensure containers are retrieved timely.
Analyze shipping and tracking data, compile reports and implement process improvements to drive business results and offer meaningful insights to management.
Manage databases that include drayage rates, fuel surcharges, transload labor rates, and domestic freight rates to ensure pay accuracy.

Specific Tasks
Track and trace containers through web-based applications and interpret trends to better understand potential delays.
Support 3rd party warehouses that manage the deconsolidation of containers into 53’ ft trailers. This includes setting labor expectations and ensuring domestic capacity is in place.
Analyze data flow between internal systems used by Dollar Tree to ensure no discrepancies occur. When errors occur, determine how they occurred and resolve each issue timely.
Track seasonal and promotional merchandise as needed. Provide updates to merchandise and ensure truckers prioritize delivery of these shipments.
Provide container and carton forecasts to DCs to aid in planning of resources at the DC level.
Create reports and reporting mechanisms to monitor and control all aspects of the supply chain, including, carriers and distribution centers.
Audit and process freight invoices, including per diem, demurrage, labor expense, drayage costs, and domestic transportation.

Minimum Requirements/Qualifications
Education/Experience
Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university and 2 years of related work experience (or)
5+ year’s professional experience in corporate supply chain management/logistics
Job Related Skills
Must be results driven, adaptable, detail oriented and organized.
Must exhibit strong problem solving/decision making and time management skills.
Demonstrates the ability to analyze data, identify root causes, trends, opportunities, and concerns.
Exhibits excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as relationship management.
Computer Skills
Must be proficient (advanced preferred) in the use of Microsoft Office including Excel, Power Point, Word.
Ability to develop, manipulate, format and share spreadsheets for the purpose of analysis.
Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, logistics procedures within the department and outside of the department.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and to meet project deadlines.

This is not to be considered a complete list of job duties, as they may be amended or added to as needed.

Uniphore is one of the largest B2B AI-native companies—decades-proven, built-for-scale and designed for the enterprise. The company drives business outcomes, across multiple industry verticals, and enables the largest global deployments.
Uniphore infuses AI into every part of the enterprise that impacts the customer. As AI becomes more powerful, every part of the enterprise that impacts the customer will be disrupted. We believe the future will run on the connective tissue between people, machines and data: all in the service of creating the most human processes and experiences for customers and employees.

What We are Looking For:
Uniphore, an early leader in Conversational Automation is looking for a Business Operations Analyst to manage programs within the Global Services and Delivery (GSD) group which may include projects/activities like governance (both tactical and long term), various reporting requirements, strategic executive support (preparing customer and analyst presentations, supporting HR with org-specific HR operations, etc.). This person will report to the Senior Manager of Business Operations and work closely with the Chief Customer Officer and Global Delivery Management Lead.
Responsibilities:
Assist in Process Framework development, deployment, and maintenance.
Monitor milestones and delivery of multiple projects.
Own day to day tactical activities, small projects in a cross functional environment.
Coordinate for data / facts / insights gathering from various functions to enable centralized reporting and plan automation/workflow-based reporting for future.
This is a hands-on role and incumbent will work on some project as an individual contributor while working in some projects as facilitator or leader.
Qualifications:
3+ years’ overall experience in business operations, process management, executive support
2+ years’ experience in a corporate role working on processes across various functions such as finance, operations/delivery, sales, etc.
Digitally savvy, aware of many transformational tech like AI, RPA, Voice bots, Chat bots, generative AI, etc.
Excellent stakeholder management skills in a multi-cultural set up.
Adaptability – willingness to work in a fast-paced environment and continuously upskilling and learning new technologies.
Understanding of conversation AI technology’s application in contact center environment, benefits, challenges in delivery, etc.
Functional & Leadership Competencies:
Ability to manage internal and external stakeholders’ priorities, issues and solve conflicts
Effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Proactive and results-oriented, with strong prioritization skills
Manage and collaborate with cross country, cross culture stakeholder group
Ability to handle multiple tasks and work toward long-term goals
$78,000 - $90,000 a year
The anticipated base salary hiring range for this position is:
Non - California: $78,000 - $90,000 base + 10% Bonus
The specific rate will depend on the successful candidate's qualifications and prior experience.
In addition to competitive base pay, this position also includes an annual bonus based on target achievement, pre-IPO stock options, benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with a match, and more, plus generous paid time off, paid holidays, paid day off for your birthday and other paid leave policies to support employees through all phases of life.

Information regarding recruiting and phishing scams:
Employment offers will always be made by a Uniphore hiring manager or Talent Acquisition team member with a @uniphore.com email address only. We will never text you about an employment opportunity, interviews or employment offers, and we do not make job offers after only one interview. Additionally, we will never ask you to provide funds for onboarding, supplies or anything else, nor we will ask you to submit your personal information (date of birth, passport details, banking information, social security number, etc.) as part of the interview process. If you are receiving an employment inquiry or employment offer from a non Uniphore.com email address, please assume it is spam. If you believe you have been a victim of a phishing or false employment scam, you may want to report this incidents to the FBI iC3, or visit the Department of Homeland Security’s Cyber Smart website to learn how to report such scam.

The Technical Product Owner (TPO) is responsible for working with the various internal and external business partners to help provide solution design to complex business needs. The Technical Product Owner represents the business needs at the agile team level to ensure the team is delivering the functionality that meets business and client needs. He/she must have past experience working with agile technology teams and have business skills and experience.

The primary role is to support the gathering and documenting of requirements based upon the needs of the business and conduct/lead requirement meetings and facilitate user acceptance testing. Additionally, the role will be present these requirements as user stories to IT agile team members in scrum ceremonies such as grooming, planning, daily standups, demos, and retrospectives. The TPO is responsible for providing expert system support for complex system development/ enhancements/ problems/ issues impacting other areas (interfaces/sub-systems). This lead position provides business /technical expertise and team leadership on major, complex initiatives. The position may be responsible for giving work direction, mentoring, and providing input to junior Business Systems Analysts.

What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?

Works closely with Business stakeholders and external customers, vendors, and other areas in Assurant to understand business objectives and product requirements. Interpret high-level business, compliance, and financial needs/requests for complex projects, with little or no background information or foundation.

A self-starter that has the ability to lead solution definition and refine requirements for several concurrent initiatives around the globe.

Be the “go to” person for knowledge of the department’s applications and data. Work closely with the Agile Team on complex system changes.

Writes functional and technical user stories that clearly communicate customer/stakeholder needs to the Agile team, accepts stories once complete and demo’d. Backlog planning, prioritization, and management.

Understands and supports inter-team dependencies, and ability to identify priority issues and determine which issues can be managed within the authority of a TPO and being able to discern those issues requiring engineering support or to be directed from a higher authority.

Analyze complex processes, interfaces, and sub-system problems for modification. Participate in new process definition efforts, as requested. Document existing and new business processes and workflows with a high level of complexity. Data Mapping of complex tables, files and records resulting from the corporate initiatives that involve system integrations, business acquisitions, and assumptions.

Identify and resolve complex, non-routine problems and issues where no precedent has been established or exists. Identify trends/patterns; facilitate and/or conduct root cause analysis; recommend solution alternatives. Identify and implement process improvements.

Validate UI meets business needs and support spot validation of integrations using tools like Postman and/or SoapUI. Work closely with the Testing resources to determine testing requirements involving cross-functional areas and sub-systems. Assist as needed in designing and drafting test plans as well as participate in testing for complex, large-scale projects.

Demonstrate detailed knowledge of Agile principles and scrum methodologies established and approved by our Company. Manage multiple projects, concurrently.

Communicate release date and scope for the initiatives the TPO is leading.

Attends and actively participates in team events (e.g., daily stand-up, grooming, sprint planning, sprint review).

What are the requirements needed for this position?

5+ years of progressive experience gathering and writing user stories for Web based, Mobile Applications, Web Services based functionality and as well as File Interfaces.

2+ years of experience using two or more of the following: Postman, SoapUI, SQL Server, Swagger UI.

3+ years of experience working with Process flows (Visio) and solution diagrams using Microsoft Visio or similar tools.

Experience with agile development; agile certification a plus.

Ability to lead, prioritize and work independently or as part of a project team to complete multiple tasks, concurrently.

Ability to process complex time sensitive data and information from multiple sources, make decisions and communicate actions.

Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively meet and drive the requirements gathering with our internal/external customers and translate into effective user stories for the agile team.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.

Ability to develop productive working relationships with both technical and non-technical partners.

Ability to prioritize and work independently or as part of a project team to complete multiple tasks, concurrently.

What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?

Excellent organizational and planning skills.

Desired knowledge of: Azure Application Insights, Azure Storage Explorer and familiarity with JSON, XML, YAML, HTML, okta authentication, ASP.NET.

Previous Insurance, Wireless (Cell Phone Industry), OEMs, experience.

Previous Telecom/Mobile experience.

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or related field.

Job Title: Student Assistant - Data Analyst and Reporting
Job Description:
Job ID
254411
Location
Georgia Gwinnett College
Full/Part Time
Part-Time
Regular/Temporary
Temporary


About Us



Since our founding in 2005, Georgia Gwinnett College (GGC) has been dedicated to providing an exceptional educational experience to our students. At GGC, we believe that our students' success is our success, and we are committed to creating a culture that supports and uplifts them throughout their academic journey.

As a member of our faculty or staff, you will become part of a dedicated and passionate community of educators and professionals. Together, we work towards a common goal of empowering our students to achieve their full potential, both academically and personally. We take pride in our diverse student body, which represents a multitude of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. Whether you are involved in teaching or providing essential services, your contribution will make a significant impact on the lives of our students and the broader community.

In addition to our commitment to student success, we also value the well-being and professional growth of our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, designed to support the diverse needs of our faculty and staff. From competitive compensation to health and wellness programs, professional development opportunities to work-life balance initiatives, we strive to create an environment where everyone can thrive and feel valued.

Located in the thriving community of Gwinnett County, GGC offers a rich cultural and social landscape that enhances the overall college experience. Our backdrop is a beautiful, modern 260-acre campus located just 30 miles northeast of downtown Atlanta. Our students and employees benefit from the close proximity to various local amenities, including shopping, dining, entertainment, and outdoor recreational opportunities. This vibrant community serves as an extension of our campus, providing a diverse and stimulating environment for personal and professional growth.

Join GGC and become part of a dynamic team that plays a pivotal role in shaping the lives and celebrating the achievements of our students. Together, let's make a positive impact and empower the next generation of leaders.

Job Summary



The project plans to (1) assess the academic success of students on target student population (first generation students, Pell grant recipients, non-native English speakers, etc.); (2) quantify the impact of interventions that occur in classes; and (3) identify the most optimum time periods in a day when students can potentially form study groups

Creating a reporting dashboard (and backend database) will provide the staff, and faculty a centralized location for important information and resources for students, tutors, and administrators. Creating a custom dashboard/reporting tool for student retention can provide important insights and information to help improve retention rates. Some potential benefits include being aware of academic support¿s contribution and other interventions. With hybrid offerings due to the pandemic, the dashboard will help assess differences in outcomes in online versus in-person classes or academic supports.

Responsibilities
Identify specific items and metrics that need to be included in the data analysis. Identify appropriate and software tools available at GGC
Develop sketches on what the look of the dashboard
Submit data requests for identified metrics or use the given excel file data
Calculate required quantities for required metrics for the dashboard from requested data.
Develop the database and frontend (dashboard) tools. Refine the dashboard tool
Perform QA by user testing of reporting and analysis tool and perform identified updates
Submit all data, analysis tools, software to the project manager
Required Qualifications
Must be enrolled in at least 6 credits hours of course(s) during fall and spring semesters at Georgia Gwinnett College for a STEM major
Must be in good academic standing and maintain good standing for the duration of employment
Must be in good conduct standing with the Office of Student Integrity and maintain good conduct for the duration of employment
Must have a completed at least 70 credits in course work leading to an IT major (any concentration)
Work in-person in a remote and/or in-person setting for at least 10 hours/week in Spring 2023
Preferred Qualifications
IT major (any concentration) at GGC
Conditions of Employment



Hiring is contingent upon eligibility to work in the United States and proof of eligibility will be contemporaneously required upon acceptance of an employment offer. Offers of employment are contingent upon completion of a background investigation including a criminal background check demonstrating your eligibility for employment with Georgia Gwinnett College (GGC). Eligibility of employment is determined by GGC in its sole discretion, and includes but is not limited to confirmation of credentials and employment history reflected in your application materials; and, if applicable, a satisfactory credit check. Applicants may be subject to a pre-employment drug test.

Offers are subject to the applicable federal laws, state laws, statutes, rules and regulations of this institution, and to the bylaws and policies of the Board of Regents (BOR) of the University System of Georgia (USG), which are available for your inspection upon request.

Equal Employment Opportunity



Georgia Gwinnett College is an equal employment, equal access, equal educational opportunity, and affirmative action institution. GGC does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, age, religion, national or ethnic origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, sex (including pregnancy or childbirth), veteran status or military status, genetic information, or disability in employment or admission or access to its programs and activities, as required by Title IX. Inquiries including anyone who feels they have been discriminated against should contact the Office of Equal Opportunity and Title IX compliance and direct concerns to the GGC Title IX Coordinator, Building B, Suite 3700, titleix@ggc.edu or (678) 407-5085.

For individuals requiring disability-related accommodations for participation in any event including the application, interview process, or to obtain print materials in an alternative format, please contact HR Payroll and Benefits at (678) 407.5054 or email benefits@ggc.edu.

Other Information



Due to the volume of applications, applicants may not receive a reply from the College unless an applicant is selected for an interview. Review of applications will continue until positions are filled. Georgia is an open records state.

At Mohawk Industries, we’re committed to more – more customer solutions, more process improvements, more sustainable manufacturing and more opportunities for our team.



As a Fortune 500, global flooring leader with some of the best-known brands in the industry, Mohawk is a great place to start or develop your career with an emphasis on more of what’s important to you. Whether you want to lead more, innovate more, learn more or create more, you can find your more with Mohawk.




What you’ll do:

Plans and executes material resupply orders and monitors inventory to effectively meet production demand.

Monitors and reports on inventory quality for all product types in monthly and quarterly review meetings.

Suggests technological upgrades/automation of existing processes and systems, and supports the implementation of the recommendations.

Builds relationships with internal stakeholders to ensure the supply chain strategies support company goals while meeting customer expectations.

Receives requests from the user community for changes to, or the creation of manufacturing and planning master data records and manages the requests through a formal process of validation and approval.

Transfers and translates various technical details from manufacturing and planning to the master data system.

Serves as the “go to” person for all matters related to manufacturing and planning data.

Tracks and publishes weekly key performance indicators for on-time shipment, fill rates, production schedule adherence and inventory quality vs. goals.

Solves manufacturing and planning master data problems and provides support for efficient daily operations.

Coordinates changes to data with other departments that are impacted as a result of standardization, elimination of duplicates, changes to specifications, etc.

Pro-actively monitors and analyzes all manufacturing and planning master data files for continuous improvements to the accuracy of the data.

Presents and communicates data to all levels of management.




What you have:




BS in Supply Chain, Logistics or an analytical discipline or equivalent experience is required. MBA/ advanced degree a plus.

3 - 5 years of experience in supply chain operations, inventory or production planning in Consumer Durables manufacturing.

Thorough knowledge of supply chain management process flows from requirement to fulfillment.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must have excellent presentation, creation, and performance skills.

Ability to analyze and work through problem solutions, be poised with all levels of management, and maintain positive relationships with internal and external customers.

Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applications including proficiency in Excel, Access, and PowerPoint.

Working knowledge of key ERP systems and Forecasting/Demand Planning software tools.

Proficient in data retrieval, database manipulation/organization, and a demonstrated ability to analyze data and present solutions that add value to the customer (external or internal).

Proven collaborative and consultative abilities. Superior planning skills to prioritize and balance multiple changing projects simultaneously.

Ability to perform in a high-pressure environment and/or crisis and render good decisions to resolve the problems, maintain safety and ensure adherence to Corporate Code of Conduct.

Mohawk Industries is a leading global flooring manufacturer that creates products to enhance residential and commercial spaces around the world. Mohawk’s vertically integrated manufacturing and distribution processes provide competitive advantages in the production of carpet, rugs, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone and vinyl flooring. Our industry-leading innovation has yielded products and technologies that differentiate our brands in the marketplace and satisfy all remodeling and new construction requirements. Our brands are among the most recognized in the industry and include American Olean, Daltile, Durkan, IVC, Karastan, Marazzi, Mohawk, Mohawk Home, Pergo, and Quick-Step. During the past decade, Mohawk has transformed its business from an American carpet manufacturer into the world’s largest flooring company with operations in Australia, Brazil, Canada, Europe, India, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Russia and the United States.




Mohawk Industries, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability/veteran committed to an inclusive workplace and a proud Drugs Don’t Work participant.

Are you looking for more?


At Mohawk Industries, we’re committed to more – more customer solutions, more process improvements, more sustainable manufacturing and more opportunities for our team.



As a Fortune 500, global flooring leader with some of the best-known brands in the industry, Mohawk is a great place to start or develop your career with an emphasis on more of what’s important to you. Whether you want to lead more, innovate more, learn more or create more, you can find your more with Mohawk.




What we need:

Drive the future of how consumers shop the rapidly growing online Flooring category in this exciting role on Mohawk Flooring North America’s Digital and eCommerce team. This role will assist in enabling a data informed culture primarly through helping create measurement plans and generating Digital and eCommerce performance reports through BI tools. This role will work to promote data driven marketing, media, and experience strategy working with the Analytics Manager and other cross-functional teams. The individual is also responsible for optimizing capabilities with a focus on Reporting, Visualization, Web Analytics, Experimentation, and Emerging Analytics Technologies.




What you’ll do:

Generate Reporting and Omni-Channel Dashboards – As a post-tracking support, this individual will aid the Digital and eCommerce team and other cross-functional teams in creating dashboards and reporting to support our brand initiatives. The role will be responsible for but not limited to: templatizing ongoing performance reports, constructing dashboards allowing for analysis of our marketing and website initiatives, and helping generate reports that demonstrate action-oriented insights. This role must be able to mine and analyze data while pulling out insights in a digestible format to clearly communicate goals, KPIs, predictions, and optimizations.
eComm Platforms Analytics Support– Alongside knowing the operations and capabilities of the Analytics platforms (i.e Google and/or Adobe Analytics), this role will assist in investigating and the application of the analytics available in the other Digital and eComm team platforms and systems. The role will offer optimization and efficiency suggestions for current reporting workflow and processes while working in the depths the Digital and eCommerce data platforms. The individual will activate optimization opportunities working with the Analytics Manager/s.
Assist in Website / Data Tracking Plans for Measurement Success – Partner cross-functionally and with the Analytics Manager to drive tracking initiatives to support business goals, ultimately driving the performance of master brand sites - pergoflooring.com, mohawkflooring.com, and/or karastan.com – as well as Mohawk’s B2B sites. Includes recommending and aligning on measurement plans with cross-functional stakeholders (such as IT, Brand, Product, etc.) and our external tracking partners. The role should bring forward new approaches to data collection and measurement, and have the ability to speak confidently about analytics and data management. Measurement success will be translated via dashboards and reporting tied to this role.
Document and Project Manage Tracking Requirements – A component of the role will be comprised of ensuring proper documentiaion is created and maintained for clearly outlining eCommerce website’s tracking plans. The individual will be responsible for prioritizing tracking requests from other teams and effectively communicating the project expectations and timelines. This individual must hold at least a basic-level skillset of website tag implementation, be extremely detail-oriented, and be capable of translating complex tracking concepts into simplistic terms.

What you have:

2-4+ years experience in media or digital marketing doing analytics work
Bachelor’s degree in Business/Marketing/Data Analytics/Statistics Preferred
Well versed in web analytics platforms

PROGRAMS ANALYST - RECREATION & PARKS





This is a full-time position and receives all benefits afforded to regular employees. This position requires working 40 hours per week for the Glynn County Recreation & Parks Department.


Essential Job Functions: The purpose of this classification is to coordinate special projects and conduct research and analysis of various departmental functions and operations for the Glynn County Recreation & Parks Department. Work at this level is of a responsible, technical or professional level relative to a supporting role in the management of a division, department, or operation, but without supervisory or managerial responsibilities. All authority and autonomy inherent in this classification is at the discretion of and delegated by a department director.


Conducts operational research, productivity analyses and management studies to assist in the management of departmental operations, programs, and services: compiles and/or monitors various administrative and statistical data pertaining to divisional operations; researches information pertinent to task or project; analyzes data and identifies trends; prepares or generates reports; makes recommendations for changes in policies and procedures to improve operations, provide more responsive service, and/or optimize the use of resources; and develops recommendations for changes in departmental policies and procedures; and provides technical assistance and information to management to aide decision making.


Performs financial reviews and analyses for the department: compiles and evaluates operational data and cost histories; monitors and reviews billing activities, expenditures, and financial reports; conducts detailed cost analysis; makes recommendations to improve cost and operational effectiveness; and participates in budget development.


Coordinates special projects for the department, including the planning, design, implementation, and evaluation of moderate construction/maintenance projects, management studies, introduction of new programs, and various professional services: assists in defining the scope of the project; identifies and recommends proper allocation of financial, material, and human resources committed to the project; formulates solutions and resolves problems; facilitates implementation of the project; and provides administrative support to the project as needed. Work at this level is usually relegated to coordination of the department's participation in major, county-wide projects, and serves in a secondary or subordinate role to the designated construction manager for large capital projects.


Oversees professional contractors and/or consultants providing services for projects: participates in the evaluation and selection of contractors/consultants; interfaces with and monitors the contractors/consultants to ensure timely and quality completion of project; facilitates cooperation with the project throughout the organization; and provides information and support as needed.


Assists the department managers with strategic and long-range planning for departmental operations: participates in planning efforts at the local and regional level; keeps director apprised of developments at the state and federal level that impact the department; monitors pending legislation for impact on operations; oversee compliance with new legislation.


Recreation & Parks Specific Duties:



Oversees the creation, editing, and printing of the department activity guide


Serves as the department timekeeper for payroll in Executime


Serves as the reviewer of Peard reconciliation in Munis


Manages the Athletics4AII Scholarship Program


Manages the Volunteer Coach Refund Program


Serves as a member of the department's budget team


Serves as a member of the department leadership team


Assists in monitoring departmental budgets and expenditures


Performs customer service functions as needed; responding to customer inquiries, processing payments for rentals and registrations,assisting individuals in completing forms, and providing information on department programs and services


Operates a computer to enter, retrieve, review, or modify data


Utilizes various software systems and applications to perform work tasks (i.e. Office 365, Munis, Executime, OpenGov, CivicRec, DigitalRez/RezExpert, Achievelt, Performance Pro, ZenCity, and Sharepoint)


Maintains confidentiality of departmental issues and documentation


Works on special projects as assigned by department director


Minimum Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Public/Business Administration, a field related to assigned.operation, or equivalent technical experience and certification: three years of experience in area of assignment; or any equivalent combination of education, training, and experience which provides the requisite knowledge, skills, and abilities for the job. Background in accounting and/or bookkeeping desired.


Certifications and/or Licenses: Must posses a valid Georgia Driver's License. May be required to possess and maintain applicable technical certifications.

Job Title: Senior Medical Education Data Analyst - School of Medicine, Information Tech Services
Job Description:
Discover Your Career at Emory University:
Emory University is a leading research university that fosters excellence and attracts world-class talent to innovate today and prepare leaders for the future. We welcome candidates who can contribute to the diversity and excellence of our academic community.
Description:
The Emory School of Medicine is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Education Data Systems Analyst to join a group dedicated to providing outstanding medical education to students in six degree programs. The medical education faculty and staff are committed to transforming medical curricula to meet the needs of the 21st century care-giver. Data retrieval and management are a core requirement for affording this transformation. This role is pivotal in our efforts to integrate, analyze, and leverage data from multiple sources to inform educational quality improvements, ensure accreditation compliance, and drive innovation.

The Sr. Data Analyst position is a part of the SOMITS - Curricular Support team and will be embedded in the Office of Education Transformation and Innovation. The position has a dual reporting role to the Sr. Executive Leader for Education and Transformation and SOMITS-CS.

A successful candidate will serve as a knowledge translator who can work with internal and external vendors to synthesize different types of academic data from multiple sources into high-level reports and dashboards that provide actionable insights for education leadership.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Data Integration and Management:
Work with internal and external tech partners to integrate data from various sources, including OASIS, AMP, LearningSpace, and others, into a unified database.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and security.
Develop and maintain efficient data collection and storage processes.
2. Data Analysis and Reporting:
Perform high-level data analysis to generate actionable insights related to learner outcomes, curriculum effectiveness, resource allocation, and teaching impact.
Create customized reports and dashboards to present educational data in a user-friendly and informative manner.
Provide data-driven recommendations to support educational continuous quality improvement (CQI) efforts.
3. Educational Quality Improvement:
Collaborate with educators and educational administrators to identify areas of improvement.
Assist in the longitudinal monitoring of learner outcomes, enabling data-driven interventions to enhance education quality.
Compare curricular inputs (teaching) with learner outcomes (learning) to identify correlations and areas for enhancement.
4. Resource Allocation:
Assist in allocating resources to curricular programs based on data analysis and educational priorities.
Analyze resource utilization to optimize the allocation of faculty, facilities, and other resources.
5. Faculty Feedback and Support:
Provide faculty members with data-driven insights into the impact of their teaching on learner outcomes.
Collaborate with faculty to design and implement evidence-based teaching strategies.
6. Program Design and Modification:
Use data to inform the rational design or modification of education programs within EUSOM.
Collaborate with educational leaders to align curricular goals with desired learner outcomes.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Supports the acquisition, management and analysis of data from multiple sites or sources.
Supports the configuration and management of technology solutions supporting the receipt, transformation, validation and storage of data.
Ensures that the uses of data through reports and queries are appropriate.
Serves as an organizational consultant on matters relating to databases by providing expertise to assist users in meeting their needs.
Develops automated quality control procedures to assess quality of data and provides reports to data owners.
Works effectively within a group setting in areas of design of data collection instruments, database management, analysis of data, and creation of reports and dashboards.
Develops and performs appropriate analyses.
Provides explanations of analysis methods, assumptions made, and assists in interpretation of results and implications therein.
Documents methods and results through development and maintenance of standard documentation artifacts including data dictionaries, standard operating procedures and analysis methodology descriptions.
Works with onsite or field-based counterparts to coordinate consistent implementation of data quality control measures and provision of access to the central data repositories.
Performs related responsibilities as assigned.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
A bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, and three years of experience in processes and standards related to data, OR an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
Experience with relational database management systems such as, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL preferred.
Experience with statistical packages such as, SAS, SPSS, R preferred.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree (or higher) in a data-related field, with a preference for candidates with a strong educational or health sciences education background.
Possess general knowledge of computer programming, database development / management, and concepts informing the use and development of data dashboards / reporting tools, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.
Familiarity with medical education-related accrediting bodies, compliance, and education processes pertaining to health sciences education.
Excellent organizational, communication, listening, and collaboration skills.

NOTE: This role will be granted the opportunity to work from home regularly but must be able to commute to Emory University on a flexible weekly schedule based upon business needs. Schedule is based on agreed upon guidelines of department. This role requires residency in the state of GA. Emory reserves the right to change remote work status with notice to employee.
Emory Supports a Diverse and Inclusive Culture:
Emory University is dedicated to providing equal opportunities and equal access to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, genetic information, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, and veteran's status. Emory University does not discriminate in admissions, educational programs, or employment on the basis of any factor stated above or prohibited under applicable law. Students, faculty, and staff are assured of participation in University programs and in the use of facilities without such discrimination. Emory University complies with Executive Order 11246, as amended, Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Era Veteran's Readjustment Assistance Act, and applicable executive orders, federal and state regulations regarding nondiscrimination, equal opportunity and affirmative action. Emory University is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of its affirmative action, equal opportunity and nondiscrimination policy in all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotions, transfers, discipline, terminations, wage and salary administration, benefits, and training. Inquiries regarding this policy should be directed to the Emory University Department of Equity and Inclusion, 201 Dowman Drive, Administration Building, Atlanta, GA 30322.
Emory University is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities upon request. To request this document in an alternate format or to request a reasonable accommodation, please contact the Department of Accessibility Services at 404-727-9877 (V) | 404-712-2049 (TDD). Please note that one week advance notice is preferred.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Communicate complex analytical topics to multiple stakeholders in a clean and simple manner to address current and future business challenges
Ability to drive and complete projects/initiatives successfully amongst different stakeholders within the company
Manage diverse assignments while simultaneously working within a deadline driven environment
Perform all other duties as assigned by management, within scope of practice
Other duties as required

Knowledge & Experience

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings utilizing reports and dashboards within BI applications, i.e. Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, etc.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Technical expertiseregarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong analytical skillswith the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong critical thinking skills; able to think outside of the box and identify innovative approaches to business challenges
Must be articulate and able to effectively communicate with both internal and external (non-technical) clientele
Capable of managing confidential and proprietary information
Strong knowledge in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
Strong time management, organizational and record keeping skills

QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS):

Formal Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Information Management, Business Administration, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science or other related analytical field; or equivalent experience required
At minimum 4 years of experience as Data Analyst working with business intelligence technologies and IT Systems



WORK CONDITIONS:

(The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.)

Office environment
Occasional periods of standing or sitting for extended periods of time
Frequent computer and telephone use
Frequent communication with people throughout the day

Equipment Maintenance Data Analyst

- 230001HT


Build Your Career. Build America’s Future.

Vulcan Materials Company is the nation’s largest producer of construction aggregates and a major producer of aggregates-based construction materials including asphalt and ready-mixed concrete. When you join Vulcan, it’s more than starting an exciting career – you get to make a difference for millions of people every day across the country.

When you join Vulcan, you join a dynamic culture in which career development is encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is valued. No matter the role or the location across the country, every member of the Vulcan team lives through the Vulcan Way: doing the right thing, the right way, at the right time.


What You’ll Do:

Train and Assist. Train and assist system users at the operation.

Maintain Work Orders. Open and close work orders with completion notes for all repairs. Analyze completion rate and communicate to appropriate parties.

Review Reports. Review reports throughout the month and at month-end to ensure that the system is being properly utilized. Follow up with users and managers when problems are determined. Analyze and follow up on items that need to be addressed. Run and distribute reports requested by Central Services Management.

Modify Schedules. Work with Central Services to communicate preventative maintenance and maintenance schedules. Add/modify preventative maintenance schedules for all equipment in the system. Identify scheduling errors in the system and make corrections.

Execute Equipment Transfers. Execute equipment transfers with the EMS. Set up new equipment in the system. Retire old assets.

Participate in Month-End Accounting Functions. Maintain equipment numbers on the Accounting Database and in the Procurement System. Participate in month-end accounting functions with regard to diesel fuel gasoline inventory and accounting and fuel allocation. Print inventory reports, review reports, and create journals via system software. Investigate discrepancies in data from the plants with regard to physical versus book inventory.

Maintain Filing System. Maintain the EMS filing system. Maintain the process of issuing and receiving inspection forms. Verify proper signatures and dates on all paperwork. Verify that all deficiencies are adequately and descriptively noted on all paperwork.

Labcheck Coordinator. Maintain Castrol labcheck system. Set up new equipment. Transfer equipment. Update lubes and quanities. Train users. Run and monitor sample result reports. Communicate results with operations.

Maintain Inventory. Maintain/order fuel, oil, grease, welding supplies, and other consumable inventory. Understand how to assist operations when necessary.

Additional Responsibilities. Other duties as assigned.


Skills You’ll Need:

Education. BS/BA degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or other applicable degree preferred.

Experience. Must have experience with administering databases or deployed applications. Experience with report writing is preferred. Experience in managing all facets of fixed and mobile equipment in the aggregates industry is desired.

Communication Skills. Must be able to communicate with other employees for the purpose of reporting problems with equipment and receiving assignment procedures. Be able to communicate with employees over various levels of the organization.

Computer Skills. Must be proficient in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Must understand Lab Check Program and have current EMS knowledge. Must have a thorough understanding of Mobile and Fixed equipment. Knowledge of Oracle or comparable database experience.

What You’ll Like About Us:

Great Company Culture. Our people share a competitive drive for excellence in an environment of trust, teamwork, open-mindedness, and communication.

Safe. Industry leader in health and safety standards. We are committed to creating a safe work environment and protecting all employees and customers.

Meaningful Work. What sets us apart is the work we do impact daily lives – and every employee contributes. Our aggregates produced are used to build roads, schools, hospitals, airports, and housing throughout the United States.

Health Benefits. Medical, Dental, Vision programs, plus much more.

Rest and Relaxation. Paid vacation, personal floating days, and paid holidays.

Prepare for the Future. 401(k) with company match and contribution.

Training and Development. We see our development programs and helping our employees meet their goals as a key part of our business.




Vulcan Materials Company is committed to employing a diverse workforce. You will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. You also have the right to be free from discrimination for medical needs arising from pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions.

Job Description:
At Regions, the Risk Initiative and Integration (RI&I) Analyst will work to ensure Risk Management’s proactive partnership internal to Risk and with other groups within the Bank. This role is part of a high performing team that participates in strategic initiatives, continuous improvement identification, process alignment and optimization, stakeholder management, and evaluation of emerging methodologies.

Primary Responsibilities
Contributes to RI&I efforts for its four main functional responsibilities: Enterprise Initiative Enablement, Risk Continuous Improvement, Business Process & Analysis, and Governance & Oversight
Leads research and analysis efforts and providing recommendations on relevant issues and topics
Supports enterprise transformation efforts through identification of opportunities, development of the end-to-end Risk strategy and associated plans for execution, conducting internal/external research, and soliciting feedback from leaders across the Bank
Assesses and provides recommendations around opportunities to improve internal RI&I and overall bank processes as related to execution of major initiatives
Contributes to the execution of major bank initiatives
Researches, recommends, and implements re-engineering methods/tools to streamline and optimize processes, reduce risks, strengthen controls, and improve Regions’ ability to manage risk
Assists in the development of risk assessment processes and methodologies to evaluate new technologies and processes
Supports RI&I relationships with key individuals and groups, including partners in Risk, other governing groups, senior and executive leadership, and third parties
Drives continuous improvement through detailed, data-driven analysis to identify opportunities to increase efficiency, prioritize limited resources, and/or align strategic objectives across the Risk organization
Strategically balances business priorities to recommend solutions and timing of implementation
Drives successful change management and support adoption of innovation across Risk Management
Independently manages one or more RI&I effort(s) with minimal oversight
Takes responsibility for contributing to the coaching and development of junior associates

This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.

This position is incentive eligible.

Requirements

Seven (7) years of experience in banking/financial services, risk management, project management, strategy and governance, or related field
Experience and demonstrated effectiveness in service transformation, process redesign/reengineering, change management, communication, relationship management, strategy implementation, and project management

Preferences

Skills and Competencies
Ability to effectively collaborate with teams and individuals across various levels internally and externally
Ability to effectively work under pressure and meet deadlines in fast-paced environment
Ability to learn additional systems
Ability to obtain support, implement, and influence across organizational boundaries with a focus on collaboration
Ability to research, analyze data, and derive facts
Ability to work independently
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
Strong communication skills, both oral and written
Strong critical thinking skills and judgement required
Strong leadership and organizational skills

A strong candidate for this role will have knowledge and experience with bank regulation and examination, e.g., Resolution Planning. They may come from legal, treasury, and/or related fields, as well as those listed under requirements. Additional proficiencies in such a candidate include:
High comfort level interacting with and influencing executive-level professionals
Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Creative problem solver who can identify and efficiently sort critical information while strategically planning
Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Technical writing, including drafting of procedures and policies, and narratives for regulatory submissions

JOB TITLE: Business Intelligence Analyst

DEPARTMENT: Analytics

JOB LOCATION: Atlanta

STATUS: Exempt

REPORTS TO: Director of Finance & Analytics

LAST REVISION: November 2023

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Walk-On’s Sports Bistreaux was founded in 2003 by two former walk on basketball players for the LSU basketball team. The concept started as a school project where these two walk-ons got a C on the project. The walk on mentality and the dream to open a sports bar that served great Louisiana cuisine near LSU kept the founders busy at work, looking for a location and financing to bring the dream alive. Walk-On’s was voted ESPN’s #1 Sports Bar in North America in 2012, NFL quarterback Drew Brees invested in the company in 2015 and today Walk-On’s owns and franchises 80+ locations. Our Purpose is to bring people together and Vision is to be More Than a Restaurant that inspires a lifestyle that embraces the underdog mindset in all of us. Walk-On’s management team is focused on being the best franchisor in the industry and has hired great talent ahead of the need to achieve this mission.

SUMMARY DESCRIPTION

The Business Intelligence Analyst will report to the Director of Finance & Analytics and will partner cross-functionally with marketing, operations, finance, technology and other key stakeholders within Walk-On’s. The Business Intelligence Analyst will ensure data accuracy and consistent reporting by designing and creating optimal processes and procedures for the analytics function. They will use advanced data modeling, predictive modeling and analytical techniques to interpret key findings from company data and leverage these insights into initiatives that will support business outcomes. The right person for the job will apply their exhaustive knowledge of data analysis to solving real-world problems faced by our company and finding opportunities for improvement across multiple projects, teams and business units.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Strong SQL skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries.
Expertise with Microsoft data and business intelligence tools including Azure Data Lake Store, Azure Data Lake Analytics, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Stream Analytics, Power Automate, and PowerBi.
Oversee the design and delivery of reports and insights that analyze business functions and key operations and performance metrics.
Ensure accuracy of data and deliverables of reporting employees with comprehensive policies and processes.
Manage and optimize processes for data intake, validation, mining and engineering as well as modeling, visualization and communication deliverables.
Examine, interpret, and report results of analytical initiatives to stakeholders in leadership, technology, sales, marketing and operations teams.
Oversee the data/report requests process: tracking requests submitted, prioritization, approval, etc.
Anticipate future demands of initiatives related to people, technology, budget and business within your department and design/implement solutions to meet these needs.
Organize and drive successful completion of data insight initiatives through effective management of analyst and data employees and effective collaboration with stakeholders.
Communicate results and business impacts of insight initiatives to stakeholders within and outside of the company

Qualifications

Working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sources.
Understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for business units.
Experience and knowledge of statistical modeling techniques
Experience using analytics techniques to contribute to company growth efforts, increasing revenue and other key business outcomes.
Strong ability to plan and manage multi processes, people and projects simultaneously.
Excellent communication, collaboration and delegation skills.
Strong problem solving, quantitative and analytical abilities.
Expert Excel modeling skills and experience with Word and PowerPoint.

Education and Experience

4+ years of relevant industry experience in the areas of Strategic Analytics, Business Intelligence, Business Economics, Data Science, or Consulting
Graduate degree, preferably MS in Engineering, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related technical discipline.
Hospitality, Casual Dining, QSR or Fast Casual experience preferred

Travel Requirements

Ability to travel 0-10%.

Trimont is a commercial real estate services firm that has been providing asset management, loan servicing, due diligence, and customized advisory solutions to commercial real estate lenders and investors for over 30 years. We are a trusted partner to clients in the Americas, Europe, and Asia.

Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Appian Business Analyst to join our team at Trimont. As an Appian Business Analyst, you will be responsible for utilizing your expertise in data analysis, business process management, and problem-solving to drive efficiency and improve business processes through the Appian platform. The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of Trimont's culture and values, and possess the ability to align Appian solutions with the company's strategic objectives.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze business requirements, ensuring alignment with Trimont's culture and values.
Utilize Appian platform to design, develop, and implement effective business process management solutions.
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights to drive informed decision-making.
Identify process bottlenecks and inefficiencies, and propose innovative solutions to streamline operations.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define and document business processes and workflows.
Conduct user acceptance testing to ensure the successful implementation of Appian solutions.
Provide training and support to end-users to promote adoption of Appian platform.
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices related to business process management and Appian platform.
Continuously monitor and assess the performance of implemented solutions, identifying areas for improvement and suggesting enhancements.
The ability to prioritize multiple projects effectively.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably with experience in utilizing the Appian platform.
Strong understanding and appreciation of Trimont culture and values.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into Appian solutions.
Proficient in data analysis, using tools such as Excel, SQL, or other data analysis software.
Experience in business process management and process improvement methodologies.
Familiarity with Appian's Low-Code platform and ability to develop and configure Appian applications.
Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Experience with real estate or financial services industry is a plus.
Appian certification is a plus.

Joining Trimont as an Appian Business Analyst offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of a leading real estate services company. If you are passionate about data analysis, business process management, and problem-solving, and if you appreciate Trimont's culture and values, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to become a part of our dynamic team!

Position Summary
The Data Analyst/Programmer reports directly to the Director of Advancement Services, and is responsible for the design, implementation and maintenance of Institutional Advancement’s (IA) database and reporting systems. The position supports various departments within the divisions of Institutional Advancement, College Relations, and partners with STS and software vendors to meet data and reporting needs accurately and efficiently. The ability to provide fundraising reports, retrieve data accurately and in a timely manner, the maintenance of hardware and software, and the ability to troubleshoot problems are of primary importance to this role. The Data Analyst/Programmer will lead the division in all major data projects, included, but not limited to, database clean-up, updates, upgrades and conversions.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Develop, test, and provide reports in a timely manner in support of all programs within the divisions of Institutional Advancement and College Relations (and other areas as directed);
Maintain and enhance the reporting tools used to extract data from the database.
Perform database administration/programming functions such as; building and updating fields, subroutines, application customization, database structures and report generation.
Create and design custom reports, dashboards, visualizations and database programs.
Design, implement, modify and maintain operational reports, dashboards and data visualizations to track progress of fundraising programs toward fiscal year goals.
Translate data into useful tools for development and alumnae affairs staff.
Organize and maintain analyses and reports for regular and systematic dissemination.
Design data structures and maintain integrity in databases based on a thorough understanding of the structure of current databases and of the division’s various fundraising programs.
Serve as liaison with STS, database vendors, third party consultants for technical problems associated with the database application and server environment, and coordinate contact and corrective actions.
Represent Institutional Advancement regarding all matters pertaining to the campus-wide enterprise system.
Implement and manage the integration of all user interfaces with administrative applications, coordinate disk space planning and management, and monitor and tune the system to achieve optimum performance.
Assist with the identification of and conversion to a new fundraising database, including system definitions, creation of business rules, conversion timeline, testing and execution.
Maintain documentation on all customizations with special attention to reducing the impact of database patches and new release loads.
Develop and validate statistical models for forecasting fiscal year end progress using historical trend data and information from industry peers.
Analyze and interpret data to identify issues and recommend appropriate methods to resolve; develop and implement predictive models for identifying new prospects for the College’s fundraising efforts.
Work with Prospect Research team members to validate results and track success of proactive identification efforts.
Develop a prospect scoring system through data modeling and research of engagement, giving and external data.
Collect data and maintain ongoing peer benchmarking studies on a variety of aspects in development; oversee the College’s participation in various institutional surveys relevant to fundraising and alumnae affairs programs.
Must be available for evening and weekend work.


Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree (B.A./B.S.) and at least three years related experience required. Experience in higher education fundraising with major fundraising database systems such as, Raiser’s Edge, Ellucian Banner, Salesforce etc. preferred.
The work of this position requires expertise in a variety of analytical and database reporting software, including Microsoft Excel, Access, software expertise in SQL report writing, especially using Crystal Reports and Argos/Cognos Reporting, Tableau, software statistical analysis and forecasting programs (e.g. SPSS, SAS, Crystal Ball, Forecast Pro) and presentation. Experience implementing results of electronic donor screening and segmenting initiatives preferred.
The incumbent must have considerable working knowledge of and ability in coding Oracle and one or more database management systems such as MySQL, MS SQL Server, PL/SQL and/or DB2 for efficient data retrieval in a complex scheme, stored procedures, triggers and server side scripting; knowledge of Oracle 10g/11g, Oracle PL/SQL, Oracle Forms, Oracle Developer, and Oracle VPD facility; familiarity with relational databases and ability to design reports from databases.
Demonstrated ability to interpret and present information and ideas clearly and accurately in writing, verbally and by preparation of reports and other materials. Maintain a high level of professionalism and confidentiality in dealing with information, and working with members of the Senior Team, departments and divisions across campus along with external vendors. Incumbent will exemplify successful experience in developing, directing and managing multiple projects and implementing strategic program goals.


Preferred Qualifications
Experience in higher education fundraising with major fundraising database systems such as, Raiser’s Edge, Ellucian Banner, Salesforce etc. preferred.
Experience implementing results of electronic donor screening and segmenting initiatives preferred.


Certifications, Licenses, Restrictions
N/A

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to: talk, hear, sit and use hands to operate the computer and other office equipment. The employee frequently is required to: stand and walk. The employee is occasionally required to: reach with hands and arms, and lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include ability to adjust focus.

Make your mark for patients


We are looking for a Global Rare Disease Organization (RDO) Analyst to join us in our Global Rare Disease Organization based in our HQ, Brussels, Belgium (preferred), Slough, UK or in Boston/ Atlanta, US.




About the role

UCB is focused on the patient journey and areas of unmet need to incubate new solutions.




Our Compounds are currently being investigated in late stage clinical development with the aim of improving the lives of people with pathogenic IgG-autoantibody-driven autoimmune rare and ultra-rare diseases. We are actively pursuing multiple organic and inorganic opportunities to complement our portfolio in RDO.

From development to commercial and across multiple unique patient populations and indications, we seek to generate differentiation and opportunities to improve multichannel engagement, care delivery and provide an administration solution that removes the complexity for our patients.


Are you strategic and analytical in your approach? This very special blend of talent means you are a deep-thinking planner devoted to improving the lives of patients. As a member of the global team you like to work in an environment where you can:

Develop a deep understanding of our future business needs
Lead the internal development and act as key contact on our advanced analytics platform
Develop actionable accurate models for the RDO growth
Collaborate across teams to deliver the best insights to analytics to serve our current and potential future assets


What you’ll do

Leading the internal development and acting as key contact on our advanced analytics platform
Predictive modelling: Develop state-of-the-art predictive project models in to customers and internal stakeholder specifications.
Support RDO horizon scan opportunities scouting by conducting supporting research into business case validity.
Gain awareness of the rare and orphan disease space to aid facilitation and challenge of assumptions.
Facilitate workshops to translate subject matter experts knowledge into quantitative data that can be modelled for the business
Develop new methods and models for decision analysis
Data visualization: Support and maintain dashboards and other visualizations using various techniques, for example data mining, business intelligence tools
Act as key mission contact for financial planning while working with finance business partners
Ensure accuracy of models created
Own the methodology and tool and become an advocate / trainer to scale the capability to other areas within the organization


Interested? For this role we’re looking for the following education, experience and skills

Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Decision Sciences, Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, or Engineering, M.Sc. and or MBA a plus
3 – 5 years of advanced excel and quantitative modeling experience required
Ability to analyze data and draw concise and meaningful conclusions; making connections and seeing opportunities
Ability to work in a dynamic environment with 3-5 ongoing projects at all times
A progressive thinker and problem solver, with a strong ability to manage ambiguity
Ability to lead cross-functional meetings and projects across matrix and geographies
Experience in a consulting capacity is highly desired
Team player with the ability to work independently
Collaborative and balanced with a bias for fast decision making
Proactive, entrepreneurial, resilient, hands-on, can-do attitude
Impeccable ethics and integrity
Experience from the pharmaceutical industry is highly desired
Excellent command of spoken and written English
Travel is required for regular internal and external business meetings


Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About us
UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work for us?
At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

Learn more about sustainability at UCB and how it is integrated into our business approach.
