JOB DESCRIPTION:

SUMMARY

Responsible for creating and maintaining of a wide range of forecasting and planning measures for the improvement in the demand planning process to meet annual and long-term financial objectives. Monitors forecasts, sales, trends and shipments to optimize inventory levels and meet customer demands.

KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPIs)

. Maintain specified lead time to customer for finished goods in accordance to their classification.

. Validate units sold by group have the appropriate ABC classification assigned.

. Maintain minimum inventory levels at the DC, DS, and PSF locations in accordance with the business strategy set the for the subject year.

. Ensure planned production is loaded into ERP.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

. Responsible for forecasting appropriate inventory levels based on the demand and historical data of sales to and from both the regional distribution centers and third-party dealers.

. Collects, analyzes, and reports data to support decisions on day-to-day operations, strategic planning, and specific business performance issues.

. Identifies seasonal and promotional trends that could impact demand planning and replenishment needs.

. Maximizes sales and inventory turns by forecasting consumer demand and developing optimal product assortments and inventory replenishment strategies.

. Supplies demand and forecasting data to production planners to assistant with the development of accurate production schedules.

. Continuously looks for way to increase the accuracy of the forecasting process.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree in Business or related field and two years of reporting/data analysis experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information.

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Detailed oriented with strong analytical skills.
Good documentation and communication skills.
Proven ability to recognize patterns in large datasets.
Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a dynamic environment required.
Excellent time management and customer service skills.
Intermediate Excel skills.

PHYSCIAL REQUIREMENTS

Non-Manufacturing:

. Typically work is in an office environment where the noise level is low to moderate.

. Requires standing and/or sitting for prolonged periods of time.

. Ability to lift boxes/materials weighing up to 10 lbs.

. Requires telephone work and/or computer work, as well as interactions with other employees and customers.

. Ability to read, write, listen, and communicate effectively.

. Travel between facilities may be necessary in some instances.

Company Description

At Casebook PBC, our software makes people’s lives better. Our company is committed to empowering community well-being through the delivery of adaptive, research-based and practice-driven technology. Designed to “help the helpers,” our innovative and award-winning SaaS solutions help improve outcomes in human services. We are continually expanding and updating the Casebook Platform in the hopes that our technology will reach a broader array of agencies, and that we will push the entire industry to innovate and aspire to a higher standard. We are a mission-driven company, and by joining, you’ll be making that mission a reality.

Location: Casebook is a remote-first company, and you are welcome to work from anywhere in the United States! Up to 20% travel as needed.

Job Description

At Casebook, Customer Experience is a driving force in our organization. The Lead Business Analyst is a key role in working with prospective and current customers who require additional support and services on top of our standard implementation packages. The Lead BA’s top priority is to make our customers successful and ensure that their work is delivered quickly, accurately, and with personable support.

As the Lead Business Analyst at Casebook, your task is to make our customers successful by defining add-on requirements - such as form development, data import, integration and report building - and estimating that work so that the customer can sign off and our team of offshore BAs and other collaborators can execute upon the customer’s priorities.

This role relies upon a blend of customer-facing communication, technical scoping and project coordination skills. Our customers rely on Casebook for their day-to-day work with vulnerable populations and we want to provide the best service we possibly can.

Responsibilities include:

Provide subject matter expertise both internally and to our customers

As needed, interpret customer unique business needs, rules, requirements and processes to develop documentation and guidance

Lead scoping, estimation and execution of customer configuration, data import and system integration for the off-shore configuration team

Work closely with customers and help them to articulate their configuration, import and integration requirements

Work with information technology professionals to develop a solution that meets business requirements

Conduct business analysis and research to identify key metrics and opportunities for improvement

Consult with key stakeholders to determine business objectives and success factors

Lead the team of BAs to configure system settings, develop and test forms, to support data import and system integration as needed

Present findings, recommendations and status updates to stakeholders

Collaborate with customer and quality assurance teams to identify needed test data and develop acceptance criteria that ensure expected work is validated

Identify, report, and mitigate risks and issues

Develop processes and procedures to ensure business solutions meet strategic goals

Ensure business processes are running in accordance with Agile methodologies

Continuously improve existing business processes and strive to develop new ones to improve efficiency

Qualifications

Required :

Experience executing the above responsibilities using Agile methodology

Five (5) years of experience as a Business Analyst

Two (2) years of experience working in Agile projects

Demonstrated detailed analytical and problem solving abilities

Strong experience in user testing

Experience developing requirements and documenting user stories

Experience with SQL database management and maintenance skills

Experience and proficiency with Microsoft Office products

Experience working with remote teams

Exceptional communication skills

Preferred :

Experience with B2B IT systems and/or modular implementations

Experience with successfully completed IT legacy replacement projects

Two (2) years experience in social services programs

Two (2) years experience with SLED government IT projects

Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree, or at least six (6) years of relevant industry experience in the areas of administration, information technology, business operations or finance


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Casebook PBC is also an equal opportunity employer. At Casebook PBC, we appreciate the value of diversity, and strive to create and support a workforce representative of the population we serve. Casebook PBC is committed to creating an inclusive and respectful environment for all employees, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender expression and identity, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, sexual and reproductive health decisions, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or any other non-merit factor.

Job Title
Business Analyst III - Pricing
Position Overview
This position is focused on pricing analysis, administration and support of pricing enablement tools, applications, and infrastructure. The position will be involved in the maintenance of the business-specific data. This person will partner with Category, Channel, and Sales Leadership to provide specialized analysis and insights to optimize sales and profitability through pricing strategies. The role will provide user support and help define future system enhancements assisting the Residential Division use application(s) to achieve a strategic advantage.
Essential Duties:
Use mathematical analysis to track pricing trends.
Perform margin and pricing analysis to support business initiatives.
Identifies opportunities to optimize sales and profitability through pricing strategies.
Ensure pricing automation systems operation for all business users.
Work with the IS Development team on a regular basis to administrate enhancements and bug fixes.
Liaison with Salesforce.com premier support on a regular basis to manage open cases and ensure the best use of resources.
Enforcement of business rules. This will require the monitoring of data entered into the system and following up with users regarding problems and/or business rules.
Lead and manage requirements, testing, and implementation of system and/or process improvements affecting sales automation systems.
Serve as business analyst to administer, implement and maintain price lists and price agreements in collaboration with product, channel, and sales leadership.
Maintain and support control of core pricing automation system functionally including data management, basic system and configuration.
Analyze systematic issues as reported by users and/or identified through testing to determine root cause, business issue, data challenges and recommendations for resolution.
Other Duties:
Assist other departments necessary to implement action plan(s)
Ability to make sound decisions based on customer, company, and employee needs
Perform other duties as assigned by manager
Position Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, accounting, statistics, marketing, or finance or 5+ years of experience with pricing and/or sales operations.
5+ years of Business Intelligence experience in complex report development, advanced knowledge of relational databased, SQL, query tools (Teradata SWL Assistant, AQT, Crystal, Business Objects Enterprise).
Excellent business requirement definition skills.
Strong practical understanding of systems, databases and database terminology.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications; high level in Excel.
Sound analytical skills with the ability to troubleshoot / problem solve with internal and remote user groups.
Self-motivated and capable of managing own tasks with little direct supervision, organization, able to prioritize and multi-task, works well under pressure and tight deadlines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively and persuasively at all levels.
Preferred Experience:
Preferred experience with a pricing science and pricing management software such as
Zilliant, Price IQ, Price Manager, and Deal Manager
Competencies:
Deliver Compelling Communications
Influence Others
Demonstrate Good Judgement
Initiate Action
Innovate
Learn Continuously
Build Trusting Relationships
Work Shift
8 Hr non-rotating shift, Hrs fall to in punch day, Observed Calendar, shift starts AM

Overview

How would you like to work in a place where your contributions and ideas are valued? A place where you can serve with compassion, pursue excellence and honor every voice? At Wellstar, our mission is simple, yet powerful: to enhance the health and well-being of every person we serve. We are proud to have become a shining example of what's possible when the brightest professionals dedicate themselves to making a difference in the healthcare industry, and in people's lives.

Responsibilities

This is an audit lead role that provides an analytical strategy and approach for developing, implementing and maintaining a data analytics program and analytical tools with the objective of optimizing the use of data to support the internal audit activities (risk assessment, planning, testing, reporting and follow-up) while continuously growing the department's use of continuous monitoring and auditing strategies as well as supporting the audit team members in the development of analytics.

The primary responsibility of the Lead of Internal Audit Data Analytics is to produce and guide the audit team in the production of analytical solutions including data integration, manipulation and solution design, translating business needs into sustainable and high-quality deliverables. This includes understanding our internal and external customer needs for data and metrics.

The Lead works with all level of management and as a working Lead, indirectly supervises the audit team on projects using analytics. The Lead will work with the auditors to grow the data analytics program, automate routine audits, and conceptualize audits of new areas. The Lead is also responsible for performing the audit procedures as outlined in their assigned audit work program.

The Lead keeps current knowledge of audit techniques and principles and meet CPE requirements to preserve professional certification.

Qualifications

Required Minimum Education:
Bachelor's Degree, preferably in technology (Computer Science, Management Information Systems), Accounting, Business Administration, Math, or a related field; Required
Master's Degree, Preferred

Required Minimum Experience:
Minimum 7 years to ten (10) years relevant experience with previous audit or relevant business line and data analytic experience with financial information. Required
Experiences with ERP Systems, business intelligence, and analytical tools. Required
Experience working with large complex data sets, drawing conclusions and reporting findings. Required
Experience in healthcare industry strongly, Preferred

Required Minimum Skills:
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to identify gaps in logic and handle complex communication challenges individually.
Skilled in creating analytics and using analytical tools, e.g. SQL, Excel, ACL, Tableau, or similar software to query and present data.
Ability to develop, mentor, motivate team members.
Demonstrate an ability to quickly collaborate and work effectively with a diverse group of clients and team members, consistently delivering the highest quality communication, work product and client service.
Demonstrate an ability to give and follow instructions accurately and efficiently directing work efforts towards the desired outcome.
Display good judgment and decision-making skills.
Ability to identify sensitive issues and proactively facilitate effective communication at various levels in the organization to avoid surprises.
Ensure adequate focus on professional growth relevant to taking on challenging assignments and tasks beyond assigned audit engagements and standard work assignments.
Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein

Required Minimum License(s) and Certification(s):
Certified Analytics Professional (CAP), Preferred
Google Data Analytics Professional Certificate, Preferred

Hybrid

ABOUT THIS POSITION
The PCS Business Integration Analyst is the link between Product, Client Success and Development with the goal of providing superior service and support to the various stakeholders responsible for the various Waystar Robotic Process Automation (RPA) product lines.

Utilizing the knowledge of the authorization and referrals verification process and the rules required by the various health plans, the PCS Authorization Business Analyst applies business analysis techniques, tools and common templates to ensure timely and thorough resolutions of all received requests; performs analysis and troubleshooting to identify and correct root causes; and when applicable, delivers business requirements, processes, and/or instructions in a clear and coherent manner to the appropriate stakeholder(s).

The PCS Business Integration Analyst serves as a subject matter expert and helps define and set team strategy to effectively deliver superior service and support up through the department and out to the appropriate stakeholders.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Performs business analysis activities, such as requirements analysis, creation of use cases and business rules consistent with workflow requirements of Waystar's Health Systems & Hospital clients.
Draws on real-world experience and maintains a working knowledge of health plan authorization and referral requirements.
Applies functional knowledge of ANSI 278, 276/277, 270/271 transaction sets to optimize the design, testing and implementation of defined business requirements associated with RPA, API and EDI based solutions.
Collaborates with Product, Client Success, Technology and/or other departments regarding Robotic Process Automation (RPA), API and EDI related inquiries, activities and business issues.
Performs data analysis and troubleshooting of application issues and business user concerns to identify and correct root causes.
Draws on real-world experience and maintains a working knowledge of health plan authorization and referral requirements.
Applies functional knowledge of ANSI 278, 276/277, 270/271 transaction sets to optimize the design, testing and implementation of defined business requirements associated with RPA, API and EDI based solutions.
Translates business requirements into detailed requirement specifications and use cases.
Drives integration through collaboration with various stakeholders in the recommendation, and implementation of enhanced and/or new business processes.
Acts as liaison between various stakeholders and Development to address questions/issues.
Must be a self-starter, be able to set priorities and back other team members when required.
Works team-driven department, cross-department and various sized projects, independent of supervision.

Job Title: Senior Workday Financial Data Analyst (Adaptive Insights) (Remote)
Job Description:
Job Description:
Progressive Leasing is a leading provider of in-store and e-commerce lease-to-own solutions. As an almost 20+ year old FinTech company that has gone from start-up to industry leader, we know how to innovate, simplify, and value all people. We are a company founded on our grit and we are constantly looking to the future. As an ever-evolving group of entrepreneurs and technologists, we strive to do the right thing period in all aspects of our work. We are a subsidiary of PROG Holdings (NYSE: PRG), an exciting FinTech holding company, with three business segments including Progressive, Vive Financial, and Four, a Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) platform.

We are currently hiring a Senior Financial Data Analyst to help grow our company and ensure our mission is achieved!

This role is a work from home position and can be performed remotely anywhere in the continental US or in one of our corporate locations in Utah or Arizona.

Employee Value Proposition (EVP): PROG is dedicated to providing people with opportunity; opportunity for inclusive collaboration, opportunity for innovation, and opportunity for development.

WE ARE: A team of financial experts focused on the adherence of reporting and planning our Progressive Leasing’s financial wellness. Progressive Leasing is known for the high-quality assistance that we provide, and we love to continuously pursue excellence and compassion in all that we do! We are dedicated to creating a culture of belonging, inclusion, diversity, and equity in our teams and celebrate each individual contributions and uniqueness.


YOU ARE: As a Senior Financial Data Analyst on the FP&A team, you will play a crucial role in extracting, analyzing, and visualizing financial data to support various business functions. Your expertise with Adaptive Insights, advanced SQL, and data visualization tools such as Tableau Insights will be instrumental in helping our organization make data-driven decisions and achieve its financial goals.

YOUR DAY-TO-DAY:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and design solutions for complex financial analyses
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial data in the Adaptive Insights system. Implement validation checks and data quality controls to maintain data consistency
Design and architect complex financial models within the Adaptive Insights platform to support the organization's evolving needs. Ensure models are structured logically, incorporating best practices for scalability, efficiency, and ease of maintenance
Develop and implement advanced formulas and calculations within Adaptive Insights, including complex allocation methodologies, driver-based modeling, and custom scripts using the Adaptive Formula Language (AFL). Create formula-driven solutions for intricate financial scenarios
Continuously seek opportunities to enhance financial planning and analysis processes. Streamline workflows, automate repetitive tasks, and optimize the use of the Adaptive Insights platform to increase efficiency
Stay informed about updates and enhancements to the Adaptive Insights platform. Evaluate how new features can improve financial planning processes and lead the implementation of these enhancements when relevant

YOU’LL BRING:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a related field
3-5+ years of proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in Finance
A strong foundation in Adaptive Insights, including advanced knowledge of model building, formula writing, and report/dashboard creation. Certification in Adaptive Insights is a plus
Proficiency in data validation, quality control, and data integrity practices, ensuring that financial data remains accurate and reliable
Expertise in data visualization and dashboarding tools, particularly Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities, allowing you to address complex financial challenges and propose creative solutions
Strong communication and presentation abilities to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and meet tight deadlines
WE OFFER:
Competitive Compensation
Full Health Benefits; Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance + Paid Parental Leave
Company Matched 401k
Paid Time Off + Paid Holidays + Paid Volunteer Time
Diversity Alliance Resource Groups
Employee Stock Purchase Program

DeKalb Community Service Board (CSB) is an innovative, community-based behavioral health and developmental disabilities services organization located in metropolitan Atlanta, Georgia, offering a full range of mental health services, developmental disabilities programs and substance abuse treatment to more than 11,000 citizens annually who are uninsured and underinsured.

As a public, not-for-profit organization, the DeKalb CSB operates more than 20 locations in DeKalb County with a diverse workforce of more than 500 direct-care and support staff.
Our staff of physicians, nurses, clinicians and support personnel is dedicated to helping our clients and their families recover from these debilitating disabilities and resume productive lives. We strive to provide the highest quality, evidence-based services in the least restrictive settings, and we envision a community in which disabilities no longer limit potential. DeKalb CSB is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Rehabilitation Facilities (CARF). Read more on our recent CARF accreditation here.

Salary Range: 43,000 - 50,000

Job Summary
Assist with the development, preparation, and revision of DeKalb CSB operating budget. Prepares or completes various forms, reports, correspondence, expenditure trends and projections, budget allocations, variance analysis, operational reports, or other documents within designated timeframes. Perform reviews and analysis of budget program and policy issues. Performs expenditure analyses and prepares budget-related financial summaries and recommendations for management review.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Under general supervision, incumbent duties and responsibilities will include but is not limited to the following:

Assist with the budget preparation including but not limited to budget calendar, planning, development, and budget planning meeting with directors and managers.
Conduct monthly reviews comparing budget to actual to ensure compliance with approved budget and commenting on high and low variances.
Analyze monthly preliminary financial statements for missing expenses, prepare expense accrual entries.
Generate invoicing for expense-based contracts and record to revenue and accounts receivables.
Identify potential problems and inform directors and managers with recommend solutions.
Prepare or complete various forms, reports, correspondence, expenditure trends and projections, budget allocations, variance analysis, operational reports, or other documents within designated timeframes.
Analyze budget submission, funds request processes and new position request; make recommendations to increase efficiency and accuracy and monitor new or changing budgetary implications.
Develop and submit budget reports monthly; work with directors and managers to develop and refine statements of departmental objectives; perform periodic reviews of budget variances and progress on objectives.
Analyze data and identify trends; make recommendations for changes in policies and procedures to improve operations.
Notify directors and managers of developments at the State level that may impact their departments including but not limited to contract changes or performance expectations.
Participate in field research projects; prepare financial information; assist departments with policy and procedures if necessary.
Additional responsibilities as assigned.
SKILL, COMPETENCY AND EDUCATION AND/OR LICENSURE REQUIREMENTS:

Knowledge of budget development process
Knowledge of state contract and reporting requirements
Ability to analyze, interpret, and explain financial information
Knowledge of financial system
Ability to interpret and apply DCSB policies and procedures
Ability to apply rules, regulations, and policies to specific budget programs and areas
Ability to communicate both orally and in writing
Skilled in the use of accounting spreadsheet applications
Bachelor’s degree in business administration or related field
Preferred: 2 or more years of fiscal analysis experience
**Hybrid consideration after 3 months Introduction period**

As a part of the pre-employment process, the selected applicant will undergo an FBI Criminal History Records check, Motor Vehicle Report (MVR) check and drug screening. Direct Care positions may require Tuberculosis (TB) testing.

Insurance Claims Analyst II

What you'll do:

Reviews and analyzes mitigation claim reports based on standards including: correct invoicing of line items, critical review of data in the record of drying conditions, correct labor efficiency, price list variation, equipment sizing, etc.
Submits claims within established guidelines for commercial and personal lines clients and insurance customers, and follows up on the status of all claim files with clients and requests monies due on all losses that analyst processes.
Communicates expectations of file quality to franchisees including completeness and accuracy of Record of Drying conditions according to the S-500 standards established by the Institute of Inspection, Cleaning and Restoration Certification.
Records billed items into the system and verifies aging accuracy.
Corresponds with franchisees, 866RECOVER (end user) clients, agents, policy holders, and insurance companies on claims and payment status.
Records billed items into the system and verifies aging accuracy.
Assists with process improvement and creation of standard operating procedures to better meet client requirements.
Produces and distributes weekly and monthly reports.
Delegates claims to analysts for review in a timely manner that maintains acceptable cycle time standards.
Maintains DR Claims Review Inbox, responds to escalations and FZ inquiries.
Generates reports and analyzes data.
Reviews and completes commercial claims.
Assists with training new hires on the team.


What you bring:

Bachelor degree and/or 2+ years relevant experience
Ability to manage work flow efficiently (time management)
Detail oriented when analyzing claims
Ability to multi-task effectively
Ability to follow processes and have great follow through skills
Good communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to interact with internal and external customers in a positive manner
Ability to work independently

Hybrid role based in our Atlanta office.


About ServiceMaster Brands

ServiceMaster® Brands® is a leading franchise provider of needs-based residential and commercial services in the restoration, cleaning, moving, and bioremediation industries. Founded in 1929, the company is home to over 3,200 franchisees across 4,600+ locations serving over 1,000,000 homes and businesses each year. ServiceMaster was founded with a deep commitment to integrity and customer service and does business under seven brands today across 50 states and nine countries that generate more than $3.5B in system-wide sales: ServiceMaster Restore®, ServiceMaster Clean®, Merry Maids®, TWO MEN AND A TRUCK®, Aftermath Services®, Indoor Science.

While each brand maintains a distinct identity, we share a commitment to our mission to Making Everyday Heroes More Heroic™. From our franchisee experience to career development to our community outreach efforts, our values – We Serve, We Care, We Deliver, We Do - guide us.

Working as part of our team means bringing your best ideas to work every day and seeing the impact of your contributions. Stars in our company at all levels are builders—they love to create, lead and see their plan come to life. Our best people understand that while great ideas are important, they require incredible focus and teamwork to execute. Life inside our company is the opportunity to do the best work of your career.

ServiceMaster Brands is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia.

Roark Capital Group acquired ServiceMaster Brands in October 2020. Roark focuses on investing in the consumer and business services sectors, with a specialization in multi-location and franchised businesses. Since inception, affiliates of Roark have invested in 100 multi-location, franchised brands, which collectively generate $62 billion in annual system revenues from 66,000 locations in 50 states and 89 countries. Please visit www.roarkcapital.com to learn more.

Smart Space was created primarily to offer real solutions to the growing worldwide environmental crisis emerging from carbon emissions. Commercial and residential buildings account for the majority of the total carbon footprint of cities around the world. New buildings are built with this in mind, so the real key to substantial progress is reducing existing building energy consumption and carbon outputs. Smart Space is dedicated to retrofitting residential and commercial buildings to reduce energy waste, improve indoor air quality, while optimizing a return in the investment for clients. Using the most current technologies, diagnostic tools, and principals of building science, we are passionate about the whole building approach with the understanding that a space performs optimally as a integrated whole. We are a full service company that offers a complete range of products and services to improve the comfort, health, and efficiency of spaces.

We see our Building Analyst and Sales Technician as a source of our competitive advantage. Smart Space looks for people who are eager to bring skills, knowledge, and passion to an integrated team. As we work towards scaling our growth while maintaining the quality of our services, we are hiring a dedicated Building Analyst/Sales Technician who will have three key areas of responsibilities: (1) gathering and analyzing data, (2) learning and acquiring new skills in the continually evolving field of building science and sustainable retrofitting, and (3) educating our customers about the most effective strategies to improve comfort and indoor air quality, reduce energy waste, and save money.

Roles and Responsibilities
Establish an initial relationship with customers and communicate the scope of work (initial and post Smart Space BPI Home or Commercial Energy Assessment, sitting down to discuss reports generated, and filing of rebate applications etc)
Collect and analyze data of buildings using diagnostic tools (blower door, duct blaster, pressure pan tests, infrared camera imaging, safety testing, etc) with a keen eye towards quality control, detail, and mitigating risk
Select and manage tools, materials, equipment, and track inventory
Identify any health and safety issues related for retrofitting projects
Inspect and analyze building envelope, mechanical systems, electrical systems, or process systems to determine the energy consumption of each system
Analyze technical feasibility of energy savings measures using knowledge of engineering, energy productions, energy use, construction costs, maintenance, system operation, or process system.
Generate software reports based on gathered data
Educate residential customers based on date gathered, software modeling, and principals of building science on the most effective retrofit projects to reduce energy waste, improve indoor air quality and comfort.
Negotiate terms of agreements and draft contracts
Prepare internal and external reports pertaining to job status
Proven working experience in related fields
Able to articulate a broad knowledge of and passion for building science and the field of sustainable retrofitting in a thoughtful, concise, and professional manner
Expert knowledge of building products, construction details, relevant rules, regulations, and quality standards
Familiarity with software modeling programs for retrofitting
Qualifications
Proven working experience in related fields
Able to articulate a broad knowledge of and passion for building science and the field of sustainable retrofitting in a thoughtful, concise, and professional manner
Expert knowledge of building products, construction details, relevant rules, regulations, and quality standards
Familiarity with software modeling programs for retrofitting

Required Skills

Outstanding communication, relationship, and collaboration skills
Resourcefulness in the ability to achieve results in the most effective manner
Excellent organization and time management skills, including the ability to work within strict deadlines
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Comfortable in wearing multiple hats when necessary to get the job done
Communicate and align strategy with key internal and external stakeholders
Eager to learn and acquire new skills and knowledge as the field evolves and changes

Please send a cover letter, a resume, or any questions to harden@smartspaceatlanta.com.

Summary of the role:

We are looking to fill the position of Business Analyst (BA) to support business and technology projects at Builders Insurance Group. The BA will serve as the liaison between the business, information technology, and end users to ensure that all requirements are documented and communicated so that the right solutions are delivered. Ours candidate will need to be able demonstrate strong communication skills and be able to succinctly capture the requirements (business/technical) to develop, maintain and enhance solutions. The candidate must also be able to analyze data to enable leaders to make informed business decisions

What would be your day in the life at Builders?

Conducting detailed analysis of business & system processes and document impacts due to changes in processes and data
Documenting detailed requirements and designs (business & technical) so that teams can build solutions to the requested specifications
Interacting with subject matter experts and stakeholders to identify their issues and requirements
Using problem solving techniques to support the design of technical solutions and solve business issues
Leveraging business analysis techniques and tools to provide insights into improved business decisions (i.e.; data management, predictive modeling, data mining, forecasting simulation and optimization)

What skills will you need?

Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in business, IT or computer science
3 to 5 years’ experience in analytics and systems development
Proficiency in using Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio
Working knowledge of SQL and other languages to evaluate data sets
Experience generating process documentation and reports
Technical writing experience
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights
Excellent problem-solving skills
Working experience collaborating and negotiating with team members, subject matter experts and stakeholders

Job Purpose: The Senior IT Business Analyst role is to drive the successful alignment of information technology solutions
with business objectives, ensuring the efficient and effective delivery of IT projects and initiatives. This position plays a
critical role in bridging the gap between technology and cross-functional business areas, working closely with stakeholders
to gather and analyze requirements, identify opportunities for improvement, and recommend innovative solutions to
enhance operational efficiency and drive business growth.


Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyze current business processes and make recommendations for improvement.
Use a variety of data analysis and organizational tools to uncover insights.
Work with business users to understand requirements.
Work closely with functional leaders to fully understand their business needs and identify the best way to address the
needs using existing software.
When needed evaluate other software solutions to address the needs of the business.
Assist the development team with documenting the data flow and overall system workflow.
Ensure that any new software integration into ASB systems meets functional requirements, system compliance and
interface specifications.
Ensure that development projects meet business requirements and goals, fulfill end-user requirements, and identify
and resolve systems issues.
Coordinate and meet with the business leaders to ensure that business requirements are clear and include defined
ranges for changes to the existing system or needed functionality within all systems new and existing.
Serve as the quality analysts to thoroughly test the features of the new system and ensure it meets all the functions
that were defined in the original business requirements.
Develop business requirement documentation to include process flow, use cases, and system diagrams.
Work closely with the development team to ensure they fully understand the business requirements and they are
delivering a quality solution.
Oversee implementation of projects with internal and external consultant groups from inception to completion.
Documents the project from the initial conception, through the requirements phase, design, development, and
implementation.
Validates results by working closely with subject matter experts to test programs.
Ensures operation by training business partners in the use of new system or changes to the existing system.
Constantly looks for new ways to improve the processes, procedures, and overall workflow within the organization.
Is an advocate of change within the organization capable of communicating the process improvements to the
business processes.
Identify business challenges and opportunities for improvement and provide recommendations for solving using
analysis.
Review and analyze existing application effectiveness and efficiency to develop strategies for improving or leveraging
these systems.


Qualifications:

3+ years as a Business Systems Analyst.
3+ years direct experience in full life cycle software development.
Experience with Infor M3 or similar ERP manufacturing, sales, and distribution systems.
Bachelors or Master’s degree in business or Computer Science or similar experience.

Experience working with reporting and data analytic software.
Technical background and knowledge of SQL is preferred.
Experience with cloud based ERP systems.
Sharp problem-solving, analytical and innovation skills.
Excellent communication skills and ability to translate complex ideas into simple language for non-technicians.
Ability to communicate to a wide variety of audiences, both business and technical.
Solid technical background and skilled at developing releases for upgrades, troubleshooting and implementation of
new software programs.
Keen leadership and project management skills, ability to drive projects from inception to completion.
Strong knowledge of system and software best practices and methodologies.
Self-motivated with strong attention to detail.
Ability to adjust priorities and execute tasks in a fast pace environment.
Experience working in a team oriented, collaborative agile environment.
Knowledge of database design and file management techniques.
Ability to identify and document business requirements, ensure quality of data and pull of information to assist with
analyzing key business questions.
Ability to understand existing business processes and assist with efforts to re-engineer processes.
Proficiency in basic project management.
Ability to work with business and third-party consultants in support of our software integrations process is a key
requirement. Support of workflow design, business process mapping, and requirements gathering will be a critical
part of this position.


Work Environment: Hybrid/remote- 6 days in office moving to 12 days in office beginning in January 2024. Preference given to candidates near Grovetown, GA or Sidney, OH

Title: Business Analyst-Human Capital Analyst

Locations: Dublin, GA; Atlanta, GA.

Join a fast-growing company of dedicated professionals who bring a diverse set of talents and experience to collaboratively deliver high-impact solutions to their clients.

At GovStrive, we are committed to helping federal agencies better understand the needs of their workforce and support their critical operational priorities for HR. We partner with our clients to transform their HR strategy by improving business processes, conducting data analysis, integrating innovative systems, and cultivating a workforce culture ready for the future of work. Our cloud-based solutions and diversified talent enable federal agencies to make better business decisions for their organization – all while aligning our strategy to the agency’s mission and enabling a stronger workforce culture. GovStrive is a people-centric organization that invests in their employees’ professional growth.

Position Summary
We are looking for a self-driven, resourceful Human Capital Analyst who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment to join our Dublin or Atlanta, GA office. As a member of the Consulting team, the Human Capital Analyst will support projects and workstreams that help organizations manage and improve their business performance and operations. Areas of responsibility will include, but are not limited to project management, program management, HR service delivery, business process re-engineering, workforce strategy and talent management, change management, employee engagement, organizational design, training, leadership development, and diversity, equity & inclusion. The Human Capital Analyst will actively participate as a member of a project team to identify, recommend, develop, and implement programs, processes and frameworks that deliver required results in support of the overall objectives of our clients. This position requires interaction with clients at all levels, various vendors, and 3rd party consultants.

Responsibilities
Collaborate with team members on your project workstream, prioritize work assignments, and execute next steps.
Prepare for and participate in client meetings, internal meetings and working sessions.
Support client satisfaction through the delivery of quality service/work products and results.
Execute against technical approaches, frameworks and methodologies based on guidance received from leadership.
Provide inputs to the development of project deliverables (e.g., briefings, presentations, reports/dashboards, trainings, communications, standard operations procedures).
Contribute to business development efforts, including proposals and whitepapers.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with a focus in business, human resources, organizational psychology, or related field
Fundamental analytical, critical thinking, and conceptual reasoning abilities
Excellent documentation skills
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Facilitation skills
Decisive and effective judgment
Ability to collaborate well in teams while also working independently
Comfort with ambiguity by demonstrating flexibility and adaptability
Efficient managing time and prioritizing workload
Experience working in Microsoft Office suite

GovStrive offers a culture that supports work-life balance and invests in our employees’ development and personal growth. GovStrive offers a comprehensive benefits package, including PTO, healthcare, matching 401K, flexible hours, identity protection, and a collaborative work environment.

JOB PURPOSE:
The Sr. Analyst provides oversight and support for Revenue Cycle integrity and workflow processes using data analytics. The Sr. Analyst assures all established billing, systems, and process requirements have been met in order to ensure timely and optimal reimbursement. Through the analysis of key performance indicator data, the Sr. Analyst works to improve Revenue Cycle production and efficiency. The Sr. Analyst recommends changes that will positively impact the Revenue Cycle and help Piedmont Healthcare (PHC) operate according to industry benchmarks and meet A/R performance goals and productivity. The Sr. Analyst will improve and implement internal controls over the revenue cycle and will work closely with IT on interface and system issues as required to improve the flow of data. The Sr. Analyst may lead projects for Revenue Cycle.

Qualifications:

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Finance or a closely related field required.
In lieu of degree, six (6) years of relevant work experience will be accepted in addition to the experience requirement.


MINIMUM EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Three (3) years of experience exhibiting advanced performance in physician and/or hospital billing revenue cycle required.
(If no degree, a total of nine (9) years of experience required).


MINIMUM LICENSURE/CERTIFICATION REQUIRED BY LAW:
None.


ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
Advanced knowledge of third-party insurance, and familiarity with insurance plan types; HMO, PPO, POS, and Indemnity.
Excellent knowledge of Government Programs, including Medicare (CPT, ICD coding/reimbursement, and Medicare Fraud & Abuse regulations), Medicaid and Tricare Programs.

Tableau and Epic proficiency.
Possesses thorough knowledge of HIPAA regulations.
Possesses advanced knowledge of Revenue Cycle Systems.
Healthcare experience in data analytics, systems performance, and/or accounting. Experience with root-cause analysis and lean processes.

Job Description:
Wisemen Multimedia Corporation, LLC (WMC) is seeking a skilled SQL Database Administrator to join our Contact Center Support team. Our team supports the management of the largest private, secured civilian government toll-free telephony infrastructure in the United States. The WFM Data Analyst in this role is accountable for supporting the development of accurate operational forecasts for volumes, average handle time, and shrinkage based on historical patterns and predictive analytics utilizing multiple forecasting techniques. The selected candidate will be charged with identifying, researching, and data abnormalities. This person will also be charged with creating and maintaining advanced projection models that support our client’s decision-making ability. These models will include advanced statistical analysis. This position will work closely with business leaders to gain insight into the day-to-day operations of the organization and project impact of future initiatives. As such, partnership with all areas of the business and quantifying impact will be a critical requirement of this role. Candidates should be experienced in analytical and critical-thinking skills, leadership communication, contact workforce management experience, and have a proven track record of collaboration within cross-functional organizations.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain statistical forecast models for workload and staffing requirements, including forecast vs actual trends, and forecasting for trend changes due to seasonal variations and other operational variables.
Utilize performance analytics tools to identify agent and volume behaviors for future forecast and schedule scenarios and recommend action items to drive efficiencies and improve workflow.
Utilizes advanced SQL programming to manipulate, forecast, and project models that operationalize, optimize, and drive business performance.
Ensure governance and compliance for best-in-class standard operating procedures (SOPs) related to forecasting, scheduling, and performance analytics.
Create scenarios and present comprehensive recommendations for strategic staffing and hiring plans to ensure cost center optimization.
Identify and communicate areas for continual improvement of service levels across the operation, recommending and initiating improvements necessary to attain expected targets.
Review and analyze results and report on deviations from forecasts for data validation and root cause analysis.
Review and identify trends or patterns of practices/activities that impact operational service level results.
Measure and provide hindsight analysis for forecast accuracy and scheduling efficiency used for operational planning.
Establish a regular cadence with business leaders to share insights/recommendations regarding volumes, average handle time, shrinkage, and hiring plans.
Additional duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business, accounting, finance, statistics, or economics, or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Minimum of 5 plus years’ experience in call-center forecasting.
Advanced experience with databases, building reporting, utilizing SQL, etc.
Advanced Excel skills and experience in formulas, arrays, table formatting, conditional formatting, graphs, and pivot table reporting.
Understanding of forecasting and value-maximization techniques.
Strong understanding of Automatic Call Distribution (ACD) and/or Back-Office Work Routing platforms.
Experience with WFM Software(s), experience with Alvaria are a definite plus.
Must have a high degree of personal initiative and self-motivation.
Ability to be responsive to changing business needs, manage and prioritize concurrent assignments, and handle ambiguity.
Strong verbal and written skills with demonstrated ability to communicate complex and technical concepts in general terms to broad audiences.
Strong analytical abilities in decision-making and problem-solving.

The DeKalb County Board of Health (DCBOH) Public Health Workforce Initiative aims to increase the public health workforce by providing opportunities for learning experiences and on-the-job training to advance more equitable health outcomes for underserved communities in DeKalb County, Georgia. Members will work with DCBOH's program staff to learn how to manage and operate public health-related programs that will help meet communities' public health needs by providing capacity, support, and increased awareness of COVID-19 testing and vaccinations. The members' roles and responsibilities will focus on community engagement, health promotion, and support and direct services. This is a three quarter-time position, living allowance of $13,110.00, 1200 hours during the service year, 25 to 30 hours per week, and a college graduate is required. The member will support the MORE Program. The MORE program is comprised of Public Health Educators who work closely with pregnant mothers and mothers with children under one. The goal is to provide support and resources to expecting and new mothers to prevent infant mortality. Staff is trained in nutrition, health and wellness, Ages and Stages of Development, and Safe Sleep techniques. The staff is also Doula certified. They provide a series of classes throughout enrollment. They conduct patient/client/ intakes, participate in team planning, and perform the intervention. They serve as a liaison for all social service needs. They also provide case management to prenatal and postnatal mothers. Staff members provide education and resources to expectant mothers through locating and utilizing all community resources including legal, medical, financial assistance, and other sources. They also develop, prepare, and coordinate grant-related activities and deliver information, regulations, and training about the Child Passenger Safety program.






Member Duties : AmeriCorps staff will be review and update the current MORE data base. They will also collect, enter, and analyze data regarding the MORE program and its deliverables. They will work with the team to develop new data tracking applications. The impact to the community will be dependent on data and data trends focused on maternal and infant disparities in our community. The member will process pre and post-surveys from clients. The data will allow the team to identify priority areas and areas for improvement. The Data Analyst will increase the capacity to leverage accurate and up-to-date data in order to make appropriate programmatic changes and impacts. Staff will create spreadsheets and graphs used to create presentations for community partners and stakeholders.



Program Benefits : Relocation Allowance , Training , Childcare assistance if eligible , Health Coverage , Choice of Education Award or End of Service Stipend , Living Allowance .

Vantage s’engage à être un lieu de travail d’inclusion, d’équité, de respect et d’acceptation. Nous célébrons la diversité et cherchons intentionnellement des occasions d’apprendre des expériences de chacun.
Vantage Data Centers alimente, refroidit, protège et connecte la technologie des plus grands joueurs hyperscale, des fournisseurs de solutions infonuagiques et des grandes entreprises. Présente dans six marchés en Amérique du Nord et six en Europe, Vantage innove dans la conception des centres de données pour offrir des gains spectaculaires en termes de fiabilité, d’efficacité et de durabilité ainsi que des environnements flexibles qui peuvent évoluer aussi vite que le marché l’exige. Vantage connaît une croissance exponentielle grâce à ses installations nouvelles jumelées à ses acquisitions à travers l’Amérique du Nord et l’Europe.
Site Operations Department
The Site Operations Department is responsible for the overall health and wellbeing of all mechanical and electrical systems, building maintenance, customer service and performance of all data modules at each campus. The teams are staffed 24 x 7 on site with Critical Facilities Engineers (CFEs) on each shift. These teams are the face of Vantage to our customers and the first line of defense regarding the uptime of our campus as well as the general health of our customer installations. Using a Critical Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to plan and track needed work, each campus Site Operations department manages all preventative and corrective maintenance on-site for our campuses located throughout North America. Our culture expects and rewards operations teams that engage directly with the customers and the facility infrastructure. These teams do most of the work themselves versus calling out constantly to vendors. As a result, we provide superior service that is faster and more cost effective. We prove that service through transparent reporting on all key performance metrics giving the customers the ability to focus on their operations without having to manage the performance of the facilities.
Position Description

The Lifecycle Asset Analyst is responsible for the implementation and ownership of the enterprise-wide asset management program. This includes working with Reliability Engineers in the development and implementation of processes, procedures, and systems to maintain, repair, and replace all physical assets efficiently throughout the equipment lifecycle. You will work closely with various departments to collect information and requirements, find opportunities for improvement, and implement standard processes to ensure that the organization's assets are reliable and cost-effective. Key to success in this position is to optimize the performance and lifespan of critical assets while minimizing maintenance costs and enhancing their value to the organization.

Essential Job Functions
Develop and implement an enterprise-wide asset management strategy
Update and maintain an inventory of all physical assets in the EAM/CMMS system.
Use data analytics and metrics to drive decision making and optimize asset performance
Connect with team members to understand requirements, find opportunities, and ensure alignment with overall business objectives
Continuously improve the asset management program through research, analysis and implementation of standard processes
Take ownership of existing asset data quality, lead asset data gathering and improvement plans

Duties
Develop and implement policies and procedures for asset management across the organization.
Collaborate multi-functionally with Procurement, Construction, and Operations to ensure the EAM system is properly deployed at new sites and upgraded at existing sites.
Establish processes and procedures for the management of assets, including maintenance scheduling, repair, and replacement
Provide Equipment Lifecycle cost analysis and end of life forecasting and replacement cost analysis
Collaborate with teams to ensure the EAM/CMMS is being used effectively and efficiently
Provide training and support for the organization's asset management processes and procedures.
Configure and maintain the EAM/CMMS, including setting up users, equipment, and work orders
Train users on how to use the EAM/CMMS, including standard processes for entering data and creating work orders.
Generate reports and analyze data to identify trends and areas for improvement
Review and revise existing EAM/CMMS processes as needed
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation for the EAM/CMMS
Monitor and track asset performance, including identifying trends and areas for improvement.
Collaborate across departments to ensure timely and effective maintenance of assets
Handle relationships with vendors and contractors providing asset management services

Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or related field, or equivalent work experience required
A minimum of 5 years of experience in enterprise asset management, maintenance engineering or maintenance management.
SMRP certification (CRL, CMRP, CMRT, etc.) or ASQ CRE a plus.
Strong understanding of regulations and industry standards related to asset management (ISO 55000).
Experience using metrics and data to drive decision making
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Proficient in the use of EAM software, CMMS software, and other related software.
Experience in the data center, manufacturing, or process industry is a plus
Ability to work in a cohesive environment and promote collaboration across the team.

Additional Details:
This position will be based at our office in Alpharetta, GA.
This position is eligible for company benefits including but not limited to medical, dental, and vision coverage, life and AD&D, short and long-term disability coverage, paid time off, employee assistance, participation in a 401k program that includes company match, and many other additional voluntary benefits.

As the Accounts Payable Senior Analyst at Inspire Brands, you will play a crucial role in managing the company's financial operations by ensuring accuracy and efficiency in accounts payable processes. You will be responsible for account reconciliations, AP activity analysis, AP search accruals, and the monitoring of key performance indicators (KPIs) related to accounts payable.


RESPONSIBILITIES

Account Reconciliations

Perform regular and ad-hoc account reconciliations to ensure accuracy in AP records.
Identify and resolve discrepancies and variances in a timely manner.
Collaborate with other departments to investigate and resolve reconciliation issues.
Ensure accruals and journal entries are booked during month-end close.
Process monthly reconciliations in the ARCs system in a timely manner.

AP Activity Analysis

Analyze accounts payable transactions and data to identify trends and patterns.
Prepare reports and summaries (including an AP trades aging report) and communicate findings to the AP team.
Provide insights and recommendations to optimize AP processes and reduce costs.

AP Search Accruals

Maintain and update accruals for accounts payable to accurately reflect outstanding liabilities.
Ensure that accruals are properly recorded in accordance with accounting standards and company policies.
Collaborate with other teams to validate accrual amounts.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

Develop and track KPIs to measure the efficiency and effectiveness of accounts payable processes.
Prepare regular reports and dashboards to monitor KPIs and provide insights for process improvement.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement changes based on KPI analysis.

Process Improvement

Continuously evaluate and improve AP processes to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
Identify automation opportunities and work with IT teams to implement system enhancements.

Other Activities

Manage AP SharePoint site and maintain up-to-date content.
Stay updated on industry best practices and trends in accounts payable.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS

4-year degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field required.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in accounts payable, financial operations, or financial analysis.


REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, or ABILITIES

Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.
Proficiency in accounting software and ERP systems (e.g., Oracle, Basware, Workday, Concur, etc.).
Advanced Excel skills, including pivot tables and data analysis.
Proficiency in Office applications, including PowerPoint and Word.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to interpret and analyze data and make recommendations based on findings.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication, and organizational skills.
Ability to plan and complete work effectively and efficiently, meeting assigned deadlines.
Ability to multi-task and shift priorities.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.
Oracle and Basware experience preferred.
System process and controls knowledge preferred.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CPA, CMA) is a plus.

Overview
We’re looking for a Staff Analyst to join the Mailchimp Sales Analytics team. You will be responsible for owning key analyses projects, reporting, and processes leading to insights that help drive revenue growth and retain customers. We are seeking a motivated and energetic data analyst to support the growth of the analytics function of this team
As a Staff Analyst on the Sales Analytics team, you will help lead strategic, data-driven decision making at Mailchimp. In this role, you will apply a variety of analytical tools and techniques to conduct analyses to understand and explain customer behavior, business trends, and predict future business outcomes. Your main stakeholders will be the sales, onboarding, customer education teams. You’ll work cross-functionally with, product, finance, marketing, legal, and others - to support the business on strategic analytics requests and build cross-functional reporting to arm Mailchimp with insights that will help steer our future.
What you'll bring
Functional
Deep understanding of customer support, sales enablement (Salesforce reporting, lead enrichment, propensity modeling, quota setting, etc) and user behavior data analysis is a plus (Salesforce, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.)
Expertise in analyzing data from a variety of different sources (quantitative and qualitative), presenting the data in a clear and concise manner, and developing actionable insights
Experience in partnering with and presenting to executive and cross-functional leadership
Strong communication, collaboration, and problem-solving abilities
Technical
Advanced knowledge in SQL and experience working with cloud based data warehouses (Google BigQuery, Redshift, or Snowflake)
Proven experience in stitching together disparate data sources and building data infrastructure, defining KPIs, and tracking business performance
Experience with business case modeling and market/opportunity sizing
Demonstrated experience with data visualization tools (Tableau/Looker) and dashboard development for executive and customer-facing teams
Work/Education
Minimum of 5 years experience in an analytics-focused role. Prior work experience within a SaaS company and sales enablement function is a preferred
Bachelor’s or Graduate degree (business, analytics, or mathematics a plus or equivalent work experience)
How you will lead
Analysis & Insights
Build analysis plans individual or team analysis projects
Using a combination of SQL, Excel/Sheets, and Tableau, analyze multiple kinds of data sets to provide a complete picture of user behavior
Design experimentation initiatives, develop experiment tracking, analyze results and present recommendations
Develop data infrastructure guidelines for new customer outreach programs and partner with data teams to implement
Drive methodology iteration and build templates for common analysis projects
Identify and synthesize both quantitative and qualitative research and trends related to the business
Craft narratives and recommendations from analyses, build presentations, and present findings to business stakeholders
Drive Visibility & Decision Making
Lead the development, improvement, and automation of Customer Team Initiative reporting (e.g., Tableau & Looker dashboards, visualizations)
Facilitate insight generation from KPIs, highlighting and decomposing trends and drilling down to identify underlying drivers
Build relationships and provide analytical guidance to business stakeholders and leaders

Business Analyst Primary Responsibilities

Enter and run customer rebate process in PeopleSoft (monthly, quarterly, semi-annual and annual).
Answer internal/external questions on customer rebate calculations as needed.
Update and maintain sales regions and territories in PeopleSoft for Sales Reporting. Maintain published territory/region sales maps.
Prepare agents agreements using DocuSign.
Updating Sales Commission agreements in PeopleSoft after signed agreements are received.
Set up automating reports when possible.
Assist Sales Organization in pulling ad-hoc sales reports when requested.
Assist Sales VPs, Directors and Regional Managers with reports/analysis as needed.
Become QlikSense power user for Sales Organization. Helping pull reports and develop charts and graphs in QlikSense.
Other duties as assigned.
Travel less than 5%.

Business Analyst Experience

Minimum 2-3 years related work experience in business analytics and/or reporting
Work experience using an ERP computer system is beneficial

Business Analyst Education, Licenses & Certifications

A four-year degree in Business Administration or Business related field from an accredited college or university

Business Analyst Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Impeccable clerical, computer expertise, and organization skills are a must
Excellent work ethic, good oral and written communication skills
Motivated task oriented self-starter
Fluent in English (Reading, Writing, Speaking)
Able to read, analyze, and interpret technical procedures and government regulations.
Ability to present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, customers, employees, and general public.
Intermediate level math skills (able to calculate discounts and commissions)
Advanced proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Email, and PeopleSoft
Follows through on projects in a timely manner
Openly communicates and shares
Commits to high standards of moral and legal conduct and acts fairly in all business dealings

Job Title: Healthcare Business Analyst - Hybrid in Atlanta, GA
Job Description:
Job Description:
Warbird Consulting Partners is seeking a highly qualified individual who is interested in pursuing a long-term career in the high growth Healthcare Advisory Division at Warbird Consulting Partners. The preferred candidate will play an integral role on our business development and client service team, providing quantitative and analytical support for advisory engagements that deliver strategic, financial, operational solutions for major health systems, hospitals, and physician groups throughout the country. The Healthcare Analyst will report directly to and work directly with senior executive members across Warbird’s Healthcare Advisory Division. Responsibilities will include many of the elements of sourcing business development opportunities, developing analytic materials to support client deliverables, and other strategic initiatives designed to support Warbird’s Healthcare Advisory Division.

This role is hybrid/remote in the metro-Atlanta area.

For more information, visit www.warbirdcp.com


JOB DUTIES/KNOWLEDGE

Primarily support Warbird Healthcare Advisors division, assembling client deliverables and developing analytic tools that support client engagements.
Prepare financial and market analysis of specific client operations and geographic service areas.
Develop profitability and key metric analyses of revenue mix, labor ratios, payor/patient mix, location demographics and other business insights to support client recommendations and reports.
Leverage internal and external data sources to develop analytic tools, informatics, and dashboards that support client deliverables.
Perform ad hoc analyses as needed.

Position Summary

ServiceNow Business Analyst

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology, a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.

Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below:

The Team
The HR Transformation team is a core component of our Human Capital practice; the work we do supports the five major issues our clients are facing. We collaborate with our clients to develop leading global HR strategies and support organizations in achieving excellence through implementing solutions that transform how they organize, develop capabilities, deploy leading technology, and deliver a leading employee experience.
Keeping the employee in mind, all our services cater to improving an organization's productivity through their human capital asset. The client issues we work with range from the need for a comprehensive HR strategy, to determining the need for new and enabling technologies, to streamlining HR operations and transforming the way HR is delivered.

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities
As a ServiceNow Business Analyst for our HR Transformation team, you will utilize your knowledge and experience of ServiceNow to support Deloitte’s Human Capital Consulting ServiceNow team. In this role you will be responsible for:

Working closely with the client's business function to design and implement a target state process
General support, administration, and maintenance of ServiceNow platform and associated applications
Assess existing artifacts, documentation, and data to baseline client performance against best practices
Oversee business process assessment, target state design, and road map activities
Conduct design and discovery sessions with clients, gather business requirements, and translate into user stories for development team
ServiceNow configuration, integrations, and business rule creation
Coordinate and provide guidance to the development team

Conduct demos of out-of-the-box capabilities and new functionalities of ServiceNow Platform
Work closely with project team to support ServiceNow implementation
Provide technical oversight and ensure the design is accurately translated into a functional solution
Design and oversee integration of ServiceNow with third party system and automate business processes
Monitor health, usage, and overall compliance of ServiceNow and its applications
Negotiate what is expected to be configured out-of-the box or customized
Enable the adoption of new processes, procedures, and tool

Qualifications Required

2+ years of ServiceNow experience in an enterprise environment
Strong understanding of ServiceNow Platform capabilities
Experience with out-of-the-box client scripts, update set creation, and deployment process
Experience and understanding of Agile methodologies
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, a similar technical discipline, or comparable experience
Must be technically savvy and possess strong experience configuring ServiceNow
Familiar with Service Oriented architecture and web service integration (SOAP, WSDL, REST)
Experience conducting design and discovery sessions with clients, gathering requirements, and translating into user stories for development team
Hands on experience in ServiceNow configurations, flow designers, integrations, and business rule creation
Experience working with ATF
Experience in ServiceNow reporting & dashboards
Travel up to 10% annually
A current government security clearance, or the ability to hold a clearance is required
No Sponsorship: be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred

ServiceNow System Administrator / Developer certification
ITIL V3 Foundation Certification
