Job title: Commissions Analyst
Reports to: Commission Controller
Department: Accounting
Location: Alpharetta, GA or Garner, NC
Grade: 14

Our Company: Priority Technology Holdings, Inc. is a leading financial technology company that specializes in providing integrated payments and banking solutions. Our innovative native platform empowers businesses to effortlessly collect, store, and send money in a scalable manner. We are committed to revolutionizing the way companies handle their financial transactions by offering cutting-edge technology and exceptional customer service.

Job Summary: As a Commissions Analyst you are dedicated to support all aspects of the residual calculation and analysis for the sales channel, independent sales offices and executive partners. You will be primarily responsible for reviewing the accuracy and timeliness of residuals payment by performing trend analysis on large sets of data. You will work closely with IT to resolve compensation calculation errors and map new items as needed. Other responsibilities include Partner onboarding, Partner management, handling commission inquiries, aid in the implementation of new programs and collaborate with other teams as needed.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyze and review key metrics to identify payment trends and ensure compensation calculations and processes are correct.
Ability to manipulate, validate and organize large amounts of data for internal and external payments.
Manage partner onboarding and partner updates like Banking, entity, A&A, etc.
Maintain residual payments schedules for Accounting and Audit Purposes.
Collaborate with Finance and Accounting on various AP/AR activities.
Identify and recommend improvements to departmental processes.
Monitor revenue portfolios and schedule A changes to validate agent pricing and ensure accurate billing.
Flexibility and willingness to take on new assignments and generate ad hoc reporting.
Monitor reports for anomalies as a result of process, product, or environmental changes.
Facilitate process flow redesign and streamline associated data manipulation tasks.
Provide recommendations to residual payments schedules to maximize revenue and identify opportunities.
Works closely with Finance, Accounting and other teams on various KPIs, dashboard reporting and other analytic tools to provide relevant, accurate data.
Drives the implement of processes improvements and review workflow to ensure quality and adherence to internal standards of quality and production.
Comply with and enforce company policies and procedures.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
BA/BS degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics.
Strong excel skills.
Entry Level experience on SQL queries.
T-SQL.
Stored procedures.
1-3 plus years of work experience in a related commissions field.
Must be highly motivated, and have the ability to work independently.
Must be able to receive and understand instructions, and carry out those instructions.
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Access.

PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:

Ability to multi-task, prioritize and meet deadlines.
Strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills.
Self-Starter with the ability to work on multiple processes and suggest process improvements.
Exhibit the ability to trouble shoot and resolve issues in a timely and consistent manner.
Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; able to handle a situation under pressure and find a solution.
Ability to receive and analyze data and input data into the computer.

Compensation & Benefits:

Compensation range: $69,800 - $82,000
Unlimited PTO after year 1 (3 weeks to start)
Medical, Dental & Vision
401k Match
Education Expense Reimbursement
Gym Membership Reimbursement
HSA and FSA
Employee assistance program (EAP)

Traditional Physical Requirements:

Requires prolonged sitting, standing, bending, stooping and stretching.
Requires the ability to lift 10 pounds.
Requires eye-hand coordination, manual dexterity and a normal range of hearing and vision (with or without correction).

Join our team at Priority Technology Holdings, Inc. and be part of a dynamic and innovative company that is transforming the financial technology landscape. Together, we can shape the future of payments and banking solutions while providing unmatched value to our clients.

AtriCure, Inc. provides innovative technologies for the treatment of Afib and related conditions. Afib affects more than 33 million people worldwide. Electrophysiologists and cardiothoracic surgeons around the globe use AtriCure technologies for the treatment of Afib and reduction of Afib related complications. AtriCure’s Isolator® Synergy™ Ablation System is the first medical device to receive FDA approval for the treatment of persistent Afib. AtriCure’s AtriClip® Left Atrial Appendage Exclusion System products are the most widely sold LAA management devices worldwide. AtriCure’s Hybrid AF™ Therapy is a minimally invasive procedure that provides a lasting solution for long-standing persistent Afib patients. AtriCure’s cryoICE cryoSPHERE® probe is cleared for temporary ablation of peripheral nerves to block pain, providing pain relief in cardiac and thoracic procedures. For more information, visit AtriCure.com or follow us on Twitter @AtriCure.

We foster a culture of inclusion by embracing diverse experiences and individuals where everyone’s authentic self is welcome. We offer supporting programs and resources that provide enriching and equitable opportunities for each person to contribute professionally and personally.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Senior PLM Business Analyst (BA) will assist the PLM Business Solution Architect to consult and collaborate with business teams to capture and analyze current PLM business practices and systems, assist in architecting future state PLM solutions based on industry best practices enabled by computer-aided design (CAD), PLM and related technologies, and ensure technical alignment with AtriCure’s 3DExperience PLM platform. This role will partner with business stakeholders, Product Owners, SME’s, solution architects, data analysts, solution providers, and support personnel following the Agile framework and delivery. The PLM BA plays a critical role in capturing business, functional, system level requirements and serves as the liaison between the business and the IT development team to ensure the end solution adequately meets all requirements.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Assist the team in the design of future state PLM solutions (process models enabled by CAD, PLM and related technologies) based on industry best practices and aligned with Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform for the following areas: document management, quality management, advanced product configuration management, change control, managed CAD in PLM, systems engineering and requirements management, risk management (FMEAs), materials management and compliance, and integrations with CRM, ERP, MES, Reporting & Analytics platforms
Collaborate with business’ legacy system owners and IT to define the scope and requirements for migrating legacy PLM and CAD data to the configured 3DExperience application
Assist the team in archiving and retiring legacy systems and associated data
Perform basic mockups, configurations on the Dassault ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform to facilitate future state solutioning workshops and align with out-of-the-box capabilities to minimize configuration and customization effort
Work closely with the business Product Owner and PLM Solution Architect to author and refine Agile features and associated user stories with clear and accurate acceptance criteria definition.
Quality Assurance and Incident Resolution: Assist the team through authoring and executing test scripts for verification, validation and capture results. Communicate and help rectify gaps, bugs, missed requirements for the developed solution that are exposed during testing to ensure delivered solution meets all requirements
Assist Project Lead / Scrum Master to keep projects on schedule and hold team accountable to the AtriCure delivery process
Assist with the development of training materials, socializing, and training business users on the future state PLM solution and mitigating solution gaps
Assist in the continuous improvement of AtriCure’s project delivery methodology including implementing improved revision and change control practices for living artifacts (e.g., requirements, source code, technical specifications, test plans & scripts, release packages, etc.)
ADDITIONAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION:

Experience with Continuous Delivery frameworks, Microsoft Azure and DevOps specifically
Familiarity with cloud-based Enterprise Application platforms used to support cross-functional business areas
Proven experience in conducting current state analysis and modeling future state solutions and related tools
Thorough understanding and proven experience with core, out-of-the-box 3DExperience functionality for change control, document management, product configuration management, and managed CAD.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in science, computing technology, or engineering discipline is required.
5+ years of experience working as a BA or comparable role with ENOVIA 3DExperience PLM platform (preferably 2021x or higher) with proven ability to demonstrate 3DExperience capabilities and facilitate requirements gathering workshops
8+ years of experience working with project teams to successfully implement ENOVIA 3DExperience solutions (preferrable) and/or other enterprise PLM package solutions for discrete manufacturers
Ability to interpret, understand and analyze complex legacy business processes, systems, and associated data, model and map to the future state solution
Proven experience in authoring requirements specifications for PLM solutions (features & user stories)
Working experience in an onsite-offshore model and collaborating with developers to meet the project schedule
Proven experience in providing input to quality assurance strategies, authoring, and executing test scripts and playing a significant role in the incident resolution process
Ability to partner across all levels in the organization to initiate, develop and maintain effective working relationships
Understanding of the various application development lifecycles (e.g., Agile, RUP, and Waterfall)
Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to travel 10%
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies
Minimum of two years experience working in the medical devices or health sciences industry supporting and/or providing business-process-enabling technologies
Two years experience using or supporting CAD data management systems – preferably Solidworks
3 years of combined experience working in Agile environment with multiple teams and dependencies in an enterprise organization
Trained or certified Agile Product Owner
Experience w/ using automated testing tools is desirable
OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

Ability to regularly walk, sit, or stand as required
Ability to occasionally bend and push/pull
Ability to occasionally lift up to 10 pounds
Ability to pass pre-employment drug screen and background check
Salary range of $105,500 to $136,500. The pay for the successful candidate will depend on various factors (e.g., qualifications, education, prior experience). You may also be entitled to receive bonus, benefits, and more.

Job Title: Sr Business Analyst- Tax Technology Automation
Job Description:
Dematic is seeking a Senior Tax Technologist, focused on US and Canadian tax technology integration and automation. This role is a key member of our core tax team providing automation and technology guidance and enhancements with an emphasis primarily on US and Canadian indirect taxes for a complex industry. Reporting to the Director of Tax, the candidate will be leading the creation, implementation, and maintenance of tax technology tools and process improvements, system automation, and data analytics. This role will assist in improving the effectiveness and efficiency of existing tax processes as well as developing more effective future processes with the expected implementation of SAP S4/HANA.

The successful candidate should have 4-7 years of experience in tax in a corporate setting and/or Public Accounting with a focus on tax technology. The candidate should also be comfortable communicating at a professional level, as well as taking a hands-on approach to their daily responsibilities.

This is What You Will do in This Role:

Represents the tax department and acts as the primary liaison with other business functional departments, IT and the Business Transformation (S4/HANA) team.
Leads process to provide support and/or identify tax technology needs and partners with IT to provide relevant options.
Provides technical knowledge in the design (e.g. tax data requirements), development, implementation, maintenance, and support of enterprise tax systems.
Implements and maintains tax automation and reporting tools as well as new system enhancements by gathering and documenting business requirements and partnering with IT to identify and test.
Partners with others to understand and create specific business requirement documents, system configuration documents, test plans and test cases, user training documents and communications to users.
Assesses, documents, and improves processes and data flows related to tax.
Stays informed on emerging tax technologies.
Provides training where needed on all utilized technology tools & resources.
Aids in software design and development that is sustainable, supportable and scalable.
Interacts with Dematic associates, customers, tax advisors, state and local Departments of Revenue, and state and local assessors to resolve issues and maintain relationships
Assists Director of Tax where needed on special projects, sales tax audits, etc.

What We are Looking For:

BS/BA in Accounting, finance, or computer science relevant field
At least 4-7 years of experience in related field, demonstrating successful execution of key responsibilities and knowledge as presented above
US and Canadian indirect tax experience (including audit/controversy experience) preferred (sales and use taxes / GST)
Proficient understanding of data extract / transform / load (ETL) tools
Prior experience in tax technology, including implementation and maintenance of automated tax systems
Experience in developing process documentation as well as gathering/documenting requirements and participating in end user acceptance testing
Ability to balance multiple demands with a strong sense of urgency and prioritization
Strong analytical and deductive reasoning skills
Strong communication skills
Advanced Excel/Microsoft Office tools skills required
Experience with SAP and indirect tax software such as SOVOS Global Tax Determination
Experience implementing financial systems such as SAP S4/HANA
Experience leading project management or financial process improvement.
Experience working with third parties including services providers, auditors, and/or consultants.

Company Name: ZÖe Center for ABA and Development Services
Job Description:

ZÖe Center for ABA and Development Services

Job Description

ZÖe Center for ABA and Development Services focuses on providing quality Applied Behavior Analysis therapy to individuals and their families that are in need of our services. We are hiring experienced and passionate Behavior Analysts to conduct comprehensive assessments, develop individualized behavior plans, provide initial and ongoing training, and overall oversight of services provided to the clients and their families we serve. Board Certified Behavior Analyst

o Conduct a variety of comprehensive assessments (FBA, VB-MAPP, ABLLS-R, AFLS, PEAK, Essentials for Living, etc.)

clinic: 2 years (Required)

Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) – Center Based Position

As a certified ABA clinician, you have plenty of options on where you choose to work. You deserve to work for an organization that cares about you as much as you care about your work. One that understands that you are essential to making a difference in the lives of your clients and their families.

KNR offers an employee-first work environment where you will receive extensive support, ongoing encouragement, highly competitive compensation including attainable bonuses, excellent benefits, and resources for personal and professional growth. Additionally, you will have a voice as no idea is off the table in this collaborative environment.




KNR IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING YOU:

Financial Health:

Guaranteed base salary of up to 65K annually (based on experience and qualifications)
Attainable bonus structure (between 10K and 15K annually)
Eligibility for 401K plan match



Physical and Emotional Wellness:

UNLIMITED PTO
Health and dental insurance
Mental health care



Professional Development & Career Advancement:

Collaboration with industry experts such as Dr. Linda LeBlanc
Professional development stipend
Professional growth through research and additional activities to enhance your assessments, approaches, and supervision skills



Integrity of Care:

Paid Safety Care and BLS certifications
Service hour requirement of just 25 per week
Time to focus on BT support and training
Time to focus on parent and caregiver training and support
Time to thoughtfully analyze data and conduct research



POSITION EXPECTATIONS

KNR’s BCaBA manages and oversees the delivery of ABA therapy services to children with developmental delays, especially Autism Spectrum Disorders. The BCaBA performs assessments, develops treatment plans, leads and supervises a team of therapists, trains staff, and works with parents and families.

Primary Responsibilities:

Conduct comprehensive behavioral skills assessments
Develop individualized ABA treatment plans and programs based on assessment results
Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments and develop Behavior Intervention Plans
Modify treatment plans and programs as needed based on data-driven decisions
Oversee treatment plan implementation and provide clinical supervision to staff
Work collaboratively with members of the child’s team, family, and other professionals
Provide regular training to families and caregivers
Provide initial and ongoing training to therapists
Write reports and maintain client records
Create materials as needed to support program implementation
Ensure internal policies are followed



Principles of practice:

Do No Harm
Be Accountable
Set Healthy Boundaries
Take Responsibility
Foster Positive Supervision
Communicate with Empathy
Inspire and Empower
Foster Engagement



QUALIFICATIONS

Board-Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) granted by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board (BACB)
Minimum of a Master's Degree in behavior analysis or other natural science, education, human services, medicine, or a field related to behavior analysis.
Physically capable of performing a range of activities such as running, sitting, climbing stairs, and lifting up to 30 lbs.
Ability to administer first-aid and CPR in case of emergency situations.
Prior experience in Applied Behavior Analysis and this position must be aligned with your two-year career path.



KNR strives to attract the type of individuals who can identify with our purpose-driven set of core values (C.A.R.E.) that guide us in everything we do.

Collaboration: We believe in the power of listening and growing together, in recognizing and honoring each other’s strengths, and in supporting one another to achieve a collective goal.
Accountability: We recognize the importance of being accountable for our own contribution to the pursuit of excellence, the achievement of KNR’s objectives, mission, and vision, and the impact our actions have on the ability of others to achieve their goals.
Relationships: We strive to build professional relationships within KNR and with others in the field of ABA and the community that is built on respect, seeing value in conflicting opinions, honesty, and support.
Excellence: We seek personal and professional growth, the highest quality clinical outcomes, data-driven interventions reflected in current literature, and continuous opportunities for organizational and professional excellence.



If you meet the above criteria and KNR sounds like what you have been searching for, we invite you to apply now.
